Version 9.1 Customer Release Notes
Click here to see this page in full context

Version 9.1 Customer Release Notes - 9.1.611.062c

Escalation Statuses in SAMPro And DBAnalytics in 9.1.611.052+

The Work Order Escalation Statuses of Travel, Onsite, and On Break have been added to support additional granularity in Scheduled Events and reporting. These statuses were previously grouped together as Active. This will impact the existing range of Work Order Escalation filter and sub-filter settings in DBAnalytics. These filters should be reset manually when upgrading to SAMPro 9.1.611.052+ to ensure that your Work Orders are accurately displayed in DBAnalytics. See An Important Note for Users Upgrading to 9.1.611.052+ for details.

Click to go to Recent Updates.

1  System

1.1 Registry Viewer

 Due to the need to maintain certain Registry records in a specific order the Registry's lower pane is no longer sorted automatically when it is saved. Instead, the new Sort Lines button allows the user to resort to individual registry entries alphabetically.

To do

1. Complete any needed changes to the Registry record.

2. Save (or Add) the Registry record.

3. Click the Sort Lines button.

4. Save the record again to retain the new Sort Order.

Important: The Registry viewer does NOT warn the user about losing unsaved changes if all the user did to a record is push the new SortLines button.  

1.1.1 Registry to Limit Software Expiration Warnings

By default, all SAMPro Users are warned if their software is close to expiration.  This registry changes the expiration warning so that only the specified Users or members of the specified User Groups are warned. If this registry is not present, all Users will continue to get the expiration warning on login.

Id: sys-expiration-notification

Setting Key: GroupId   Setting Value: comma-delimited list of User Group Id's

This registry specifies the User Group(s) to receive the expiration warning. The system will evaluate the User Groups on the User's Main and Additional Groups tabs.

Setting Key: UserId   Setting Value: comma delimited list of User Id's

This registry specifies the User or Users who should receive the expiration warning. The system will evaluate the User Groups on the User's Main and Additional Groups tabs.

TIP:
Include the support user login in the list of UserId's to be alerted.

Example:

Id: sys-expiration-notification

Setting Key: GroupId   Setting Value: IT, Executive 

Setting Key: UserId   Setting Value: OfficeMgr,dbasics

In this example, members of the IT and Executive User groups as well as User OfficeMgr and dbasics support users would receive the expiration warning.

1.1.2 Disable Warning When User Accesses a Journal Entry That Has Been Replaced

When most SAMPro journals are edited, the revised entry's id is appended with a 'tack' number. The original journal entry cannot be edited if it has been replaced with a new entry (with a 'tack' number).  In this release, users are warned if they access a journal entry which has been replaced.  For example:

WARNING: Purchase Order 123456 has been replaced by 123456-01.

This record cannot be changed.

This warning is designed to prevent the user from wasting time by attempting to make changes to a journal entry record that cannot be saved because it has already been replaced. This new default behavior may be disabled globally or by individual viewers:

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings  (or by the individual viewer)

Setting Key: DisableCase6552 Setting Value: truethe 

1.1.3 Saving reports to Disk (dbreportfiles)

Previously, there was no check to make sure that the path in the dbreportfiles directory entry referenced a valid file system directory. In this release:

- If a directory path is found in the Registry, but that path does not exist, an attempt will be made to create that directory.   

- If that directory creation fails (or no Registry entry is found) a default path referencing the 'Reports' sub-directory within the SAMPro directory will be used. That directory will be automatically created if needed.   

- If all else fails, the path to the SAMPro directory itself will be used. This is what previously happened if the Registry entry was absent.

1.1.4 Default Journals' Balance Sheet Entity for Intercompany Installations

For installations not running with Intercompany enabled, 'sticky' GL Entity fields in many Journals provided for the setting of the default balance sheet entity.

However, if Intercompany is enabled, the 'sticky' behavior is turned off.  The following registries have been created to support a global registry key for Default Balance Sheet Entity setting as well as journal-specific override/exception registry keys. These registries are particularly useful for single-company Intercompany new installations.  

Registry to Enable Use of Default Balance Sheet Entity

The following journals are impacted by this registry:

AR Cash Receipts
AR Sales (for manual journal entries)
AP Journal
Bank Deposit Journal
Bank Transfer Journal
Bank Reconciliation Journal

This registry can be set globally in sys-ffv-global-settings or on a journal by journal basis:

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

OR

Registry Id: sys-viewer-afunctionid (where afunction is replaced by the journal's function Id as listed below).

AR Cash Receipts: sys-viewer-varrcptslst
AR Sales (for manual journal entries): sys-viewer-varslslst
AP Journal: sys-viewer-vapjrnl
Recurring AP Journal: sys-viewer-vrcrrngapjrnl
Bank Deposit Journal: sys-viewer-vbnkdpstjrnl
Bank Transfer Journal: sys-viewer-vbnktrnsfrjrnl
Bank Reconciliation Journal: sys-viewer-vbnkrcncltnjrnl

Setting Key: UseDefaultBalanceSheetEntity    Setting Value: true  (default is false)

If this registry is enabled, there are two ways to specify the Default Balance Sheet GL Entity Id:

1.  Use the following registry setting that explicitly provides the Id.

2.  Derive the GL Entity from the Company record if possible and default that. If the default has been explicitly defined in the following option, it overrules this option.

Registry To Set Specific Balance Sheet Entity

This registry can be set globally in sys-ffv-global-settings or on a journal by journal basis:

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings (to set globally)

OR

Registry: sys-viewer-afunctionid  (where afunction is replaced by the journal's function Id as listed below)

AR Cash Receipts: sys-viewer-varrcptslst
AR Sales (for manual journal entries): sys-viewer-varslslst
AP Journal: sys-viewer-vapjrnl
Bank Deposit Journal: sys-viewer-vbnkdpstjrnl
Bank Transfer Journal: sys-viewer-vbnktrnsfrjrnl
Bank Reconciliation Journal: sys-viewer-vbnkrcncltnjrnl

Setting Key:  DefaultBalanceSheetEntity  Setting Value: GLEntityId

The Setting Value should be replaced by an appropriate balance sheet GL Entity. If this registry is present it will be used and the system will not attempt to derive it from the Company record.

Note: Version 9.1.611.048 and above corrects a spurious 'has changed' message in recent releases. This occurred when a blank journal entry form was left when the DefaultBalanceSheetEntity is designated.

1.1.5 Registry To Control Maximum Size of Error.log

Extremely large error logs are difficult for programmers to research and time-consuming for support to download.  In this release, after a successful logon if the error.log size is more than the maximum size of 1 gigabyte, then the error.log will be renamed as 'error [date/time stamp].log'. Next, the system will send a new 'error' message to the log stating 'error.log archived as whatever the renamed file name is'. This will force the creation of a new error.log file. It will also document who did it and what the archived file name is.

The following registry allows the user to override the maximum size for archiving the Error Log.

Id: sys-ffv-global-settings of the registry

Setting Key:  ErrorLogMaxSize  Setting Value: size in bytes

The default is currently 1 Gigabyte (1073741824 bytes).  

Example: Set maximum size of error.log to 250 Meg (a quarter of a gig).  

Id: sys-ffv-global-settings of the registry

Setting Key:  ErrorLogMaxSize  Setting Value: 262144000 

1.1.6 Report Performance Enhancement

This release supports new registries which enable performance enhancements for all or specific user-defined reports such as the Service Invoice that are imported into the user's database. Note: This does NOT apply to system reports such as the Purchase Order.

Apply Performance Enhancements to All or Selected Reports

Id: sys-behavior-reports  

Setting Key: ReportExtended   Setting Value: true   (default false)

This option allows a user to invoke the performance enhancements contained in this case for all reports.

The registry setting ReportExtended can also be added to any report registry to enable (true) or disable (false) the performance enhancements.

For example, to enable for the Service Invoice only:

Id: sys-report-serviceinvoice

Setting Key: ReportExtended   Setting Value: true   (default false)

This will enable the functionality for the Service Invoice (assuming that the sys-behavior-reports registry is not enabled or set to false).

1.1.7 Require Work Order for Service Compute Jobs - Various Journal-type viewers

Registry Setting Global

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: NeedWOInServiceComputeJobs  Setting Value: Warning, Error or Neither (default is Neither)

Jobs indicated as "Service Compute" get billed by the Work Order, yet we allow costs to be entered and posted to Jobs w/o reference to any specific work order, leaving these unbilled costs in limbo. This new feature may be activated to warn or error if a Work Order is not specified for Jobs flagged as 'Service Compute'.

When this option is set in the global registry, it impacts the following Journals/Records:

AP Journal (tests are ignored for lines imported from a PO)
AR Sales Journal
Job Journal
Labor Journal (tests are ignored on lines imported from TechAnywhere/TimeAnywhere
Purchase Order

When the Setting Value is set to Error, the user will be alerted when leaving a line lacking a Work Order Id and will not be able to save the record. Note: Implementing an Error on an existing system impacts the user's ability to edit existing entries. It should be implemented with caution.

When Warning is implemented, the user will be alerted when leaving a line lacking a Work Order Id but will be able to save the record.

If Neither is implemented (or the registry option does not exist) the user will not be alerted if a Service Compute type Job lacks a Work Order reference.

Registry Setting by Journal to Require Work Order for Service Compute Job

The NeedWOInServiceComputeJobs option may also be set for a specific journal. If so, it will trump the global setting. For example, to use the Warning option globally, but the Neither option in the Job Journal (to simplify making corrections), the following registry entries would be made:

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: NeedWOInServiceComputeJobs  Setting Value: Warning

Registry Id: sys-viewer-vjbjrnl

Setting Key: NeedWOInServiceComputeJobs  Setting Value: Neither

1.1.8 Login Processing - WebHelp

This release supports new logging to help support diagnose issues where WebHelp does not launch. If enabled via registry, the new DefaultHTML.log file will be updated on each login with the user, date and time and the .HTML path used display a html document. The Log file will be created in the SAMPro Base Directory if it does not exist.

This feature can be turned on and off with the following Registry Entry:
Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings
Setting Key: DefaultHTMLLog   Setting Value: true (default is false)

The log shows the path that SAMPro will use to display the Help files. If the path is valid then WebHelp should display; if the path is nil or invalid then WebHelp will not launch.

1.1.9 Fillable Forms - Do Not Auto-Display PDF

This release adds registry-enabled functionality to skip the auto display of the PDF version of fillable forms such as Lien Waiver Report Fillable (AR) report. If this registry is not in place, clicking the Fillable Form button to generate the formatted, PDF version of the report will open the PDF. If the following registry is in place, the PDF will be created but not opened.

Registry Id: sys-report-reportfunctionid

Setting Key: showdocumentfillableform   Setting Value: false (default true)

1.1.10 View SQL Button Registry

The ViewSQL button is now generally available in SAMPro Record viewers. This button adds the ability to have custom add-in Special Query Results List Panes defined and called via stored procedures maintained in a user’s database.

Note: Utilizing this feature will generally be a decision made in coordination with Data-Basics representative to provide a rapid deployment solution alternative to a standard SAMPro programming modification request.

When enabled via registry in conjunction with a corresponding stored procedure added to the database, results list panes can be launched to present additional information about the selected record as per the definition of the stored procedure.

The 9.1.611.059 release refines the SQL output display when the ViewSQL button is clicked.  The SQL display window can now be resized so that columns are not cut off.

The following registry is presented as an of the example the settings needed to enable this. In this simple example, the View SQL button would ALL fields from a the work order header (select * from wrkordr). This example is presented for learning purposes.

Sample Registry to Enable View SQL button

Registry Id:  sys-sql-vwrkordr:WO List

The Id must reference the record the ViewSQL button is to be enabled. In the above example, this will be for the work order viewer. The text following the colon defines this specific entry (more than one View SQL entries may be defined for a viewer).

Registry Name: View SQL - Work Order

Setting Key: MenuTitle   Setting Value: WO List

This Setting defines the Menu Title that appears when the user clicks the button if more than one SQL function has been specified for this record.

Setting Key: ListTitle  Setting Value: WO List For: ^wo_id^

This setting provides title used in the report itself. Tokens appropriate to the stored procedure and record must be used. For the ListTitle registry the token set in the Setting Value field must be lowercase.

Setting Key: Token~wo_id  Setting Value: wrkordr.id

This setting defines the token passed to the stored procedure from the record. Lowercase values for tokens and field names should be used.

Setting Key: SQL  Setting Value: sp_WO_List ^wo_id^

The Setting Key specifies the procedure object (typically SQL). The Setting Value specifies the stored procedure object name followed by the appropriated token to be passed to it. Lowercase values for tokens should be used.

Setting Key: Error~wo_id  Setting Value: Work Order ID must be specified

The setting defines the error processing message the user does not (in this case) specify a Work Order Id.

The following is the stored procedure for that example:

CREATE PROCEDURE dbo.sp_WO_List

@wrkordr_id NVARCHAR(10)

AS

SELECT *

FROM wrkordr

WHERE wrkordr_id = @wrkordr_id

1.1.10 Change to AutoDocumentAfterChange Notes Option

The existing AutoDocumentAfterChange registry option may be enabled in viewer registries to automatically add a Note when a record is saved. In previous releases, these Notes were set to Public by default, resulting in them being uploaded to Service Channel when certain records were saved. In this release, the Notes default to Private when generated via this registry.

Id: sys-viewer-vFunctionId  or sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: AutoDocumentAfterChange Setting Value: true

1.1.11 Report Registry to Require Company Selection

When intercompany is enabled, the user is only required to select a Company if some sort of posting is generated when the user confirms that the report has printed correctly. This registry may be enabled to require that the user select a Company when printing a report that does not include a print confirmation. This may be enabled to ensure that the correct bitmap is used on the report or for some other reason.

Registry Id: sys-report-functionid

Setting Key: CompanySelectionRequired

Setting Value: true, t, y, yes, or intercompanyonly   (default is not enabled)

By default, this functionality is not enabled. The intercompanyonly key should only apply if the intercompany is enabled.

WARNING: This registry should NOT be applied to reports run via the Scheduled Report Manager.

Example: Require Company Selection for COP Order Acknowledgement

Id: sys-report-rordracknwldgmnt

Setting Key: CompanySelectionRequired  Setting Value: true

Company/Security specific registries (e.g., sys-report-rordracknwldgmnt-securityid) must also be established to specify appropriate bitmaps.

1.1.12 Registry to Improve the Loading Speed of SQL Results 

This registry improves the loading speed when processing SQL results.

Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: MaxCharacterCountToCompress    Setting Value: 50000000

1.2 User Viewer

1.2.1 New Tab: Other

User Security 1-3:
These fields are designed for use with certain custom analytics. They are not currently referenced by the SAMPro code.

1.2.2 New Tab - Apps

App Name: Last Session Id:
Reserved for Future Use.

1.2.3 Main Tab

Import / Export Profile Buttons

This release corrects a Key Is Missing error when importing certain older analytics with a missing query name.  

1.3 Reports

1.3.1 Start Report Import

When a new report is added to your database, the system automatically creates a new User Defined Function for it so that it can be assigned to the appropriate User Groups. This process was not always reliable in previous versions.

1.3.2 Global Registry to Enable Windows Printer Dialog

Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: OldPrinterDialog    Setting Value: true    (default false)

Enabling this setting will display the Windows (OldPrinterDialog) screen instead of SAMPro's Printer List when printing a report. This allows the use to select a different paper tray and other functions not supported on the SAMPro printer list.

This may be disabled on a function by function basis by the following:

Id: sys-printer-dialog-funtionid

Setting Key: olddialog   Setting Value: false

The system handles existing local report registry oldDialog='' as oldDialog = true to preserve old-style registry settings turning on this functionality.

Note:
When OldPrinterDialog/Olddialog is enabled, the From - To Pages settings in the Report viewer are NOT carried to the Second Windows printer box where it must be set. To print only a few pages of a report, the page number must be entered in the Windows Dialog.

1.3.3 Generic Text Printer Files: Start Move Generic Documents  

Some users 'print' to a generic text printer; this may generate a file with NO FILENAME EXTENSION instead of paper. In some cases, the file is written to the directory containing the SAMPro executable which clutters up the folder. In this function, 'generic document' refers to these files, not SAMPro Document records. In this function, 'generic document' refers to these files, not SAMPro Document records.

If the following registry entry exists, this new function will move all files with no filename extension from the SAMPro base directory to the Destination Directory specified in the registry. If this registry does not exist, running the function will have no impact on your files. This function is designed to be run 'headless' so that it can be scheduled to run as a scheduled event.

If there is an exception list of files in the registry these files will not be moved. If the file already exists in the Destination Directory then a count will be added to the file name before it is stored. Special Characters in File names will be replaced by Underscore before the file is moved.

Id: sys-start-smvegnrcdcmnts

Specify the Destination Directory

Setting Key: DestinationDirectory   Setting Value: PathToDestinationDirectory

The Setting Value should provide the full path of an existing directory. Start Move Generic Documents will move files with no Filename Extension from the base SAMPro directory to the folder defined in this option.

Specify Files to Excluded from the Move (required)

Setting Key: FileExceptions   Setting Value: ListOfFilesToIgnore

Some files with no filename extension are used by SAMPro and should be excluded from the move. At this point, LabelRemap and inetlog should be excluded. It is possible that others should also be excluded.

Example:

Setting Key: FileExceptions   Setting Value: LabelRemap,inetlog

 

1.3.4 Report Scheduling Enhancement

Previously, when scheduling the DGLHSTRY report and including single quotes in the text in the range field, it would result in an error. The DGLHSTRY reports can run correctly when single quotes are used in the range fields. This update corrects this defect. 

Previously, if a new version of a currently scheduled report was installed, a System Primitive error was generated if the report included a new Button field that would appear on the report. In this release, the software will display the text "Unknown" for the value of the missing field instead of crashing the report manager. The report should be manually rescheduled so that it will be generated with the new report parameters.

The Day and Time Repeat Options validation is also performed when the GO button is clicked: previously validation was only performed when the OK button was clicked on the Schedule Report Pane.

In previous releases, there was not a way to edit the settings made when users schedule a Report Anywhere report. Users have to delete the scheduled report and then re-schedule it from scratch. In this release, the system allows users to easily update, copy or cancel a scheduled report. To do so:

Assess the scheduled report to change and select the Schedule Report option in the upper left-hand pane. The following new fields will be displayed:

Event Id:
Double-click on the Event Id. This field allows users to select from the list of existing Scheduled Events for this report. Select the Schedule Event for this report to be changed.

Process Type:
This field allows users to select what they want to change to the selected Event when the OK button is pressed. The 3 choices are:

Create Only -This will create a new Scheduled Event; the currently selected Event will not be modified.

Create/Cancel - This will create a new Scheduled Event and remove the selected Schedule Event selected in the Event Id field.

Update - This option will update the selected Scheduled Event.

When OK is pressed on the Scheduled Report screen, the fields on the Scheduled Event screen will be validated and the Report Range screen displayed. Make any needed changes to any of the Range or other input field. When the report options correctly configured for the new/revised event, click GO. Doing so will create/remove/update the scheduled event table based on the process type.

1.3.4a Schedule Report Enhancement - Recent Update

A scheduled report may be edited by selecting it's Event Id.  This release corrects an issue where the value set in the report's Date fields via the right click Repeat Date Strategy was not retained when the report was edited or copied.

This release corrects the problem with Report Trial Balance (a landscape-oriented system report) being emailed/saved as a portrait when run as a Scheduled Report. This fix prevents an orientation override for non-User Reports. 

1.3.5 Reprinting Reports

This release refines the functionality used to reprint a DBR report where the server with the original bitmaps was changed (a problem if mapped drivers were NOT specified). In this release, when the original bitmap location no longer exists and the system checks the \bitmaps folder of the SAMPro base directory, and supports  bitmap overrides (BitmapOverrideBasedOn=branch) as long as a bitmap= option is NOT in the report registry. However, if the bitmap= option is active, it overrides the override.

1.3.6 Start Report Import

SAMPro's User Defined Reports share field definitions. Importing an older report (with a smaller field size) will reduce the field size for all reports that use it in the database; this can result in other reports throwing errors. In this release, the user is alerted when a field being imported is smaller than that found in the database (unless the global registry setting ReportImportReportFields=Keep is enabled).

Field size comparisons are calculated as follows:

Decimal fields (Precision - Scale) for both fields
Textbox fields (Precision * Scale) for both fields
All other types of fields compare only the Precision.

If the report field definition being imported is smaller that the corresponding report field in the database, the following message will be displayed:

The Field Id: xxxxx now in your database for Report: yyyyyyy

has Field Size: 15 greater than the report you are importing with Field Size: 10

Do you want to import the smaller field  (not recommended)?

We recommend selecting 'No' if this message appears.  Please take a screen capture of this message if it appears, and contact Support with this information so that the problem with the report can be corrected.

1.3.7 Report Input Screens

This release extends the Custom Fields (right-click) relabel functionality implemented in record viewers to also display on report input screens. For example, if 'Client Id' is changed to 'Customer#' in the Client viewer, report ranges previously labeled 'Client Id' will now be labeled 'Customer#'. Note that this enhancement is for the 'user' reports obtained from Data-Basics and applies to the report input fields, not the text in the report itself.

1.3.8 Fillable Forms Reports - Registry to Prevent Auto-Open

This release adds registry-enabled functionality to skip the auto display of the PDF version of fillable forms such as Lien Waiver Report Fillable (AR) report. If this registry is not in place, clicking the Fillable Form  button to generate the formatted, PDF version of the report will open the PDF. If the following registry is in place his, the PDF will be created but not opened.

Registry Id: sys-report-reportfunctionid

Setting Key: showdocumentfillableform   Setting Value: false (default true)

1.3.9 Crystal Reports

This release corrects a recent problem where the Crystal Viewer Web did not launch correctly if Chrome as the default web browser.

1.3.10 Word Wrap on User Defined Reports

This release corrects a sporadic issue where the word wrap on report textbox fields would split a word at the end of a line incorrectly instead of wrapping it. This issue was noticed on the Service Invoice and Service Worksheet but would have been present in other reports. Note: In certain cases, it may be necessary to use the textboxwidth report registry to obtain the desired results.

1.3.11 General Reports

This update adds an indicator in the title bar when a cached report is in use.

In 9.1.611.060 and up,his update saves pre-compile report definitions to reduce the load time of any report, including the service invoice report.

Id: sys-behavior-reports Setting Key: UseCompiledReport          Setting Value: true

Note: This registry is important for performance improvement for every report. Contact your Data Basics Support member for more details. 

This update allows the message box to automatically close after running reports. User can click “Yes” on the message box to close it before it automatically closes. 
Note: This registry is vital for efficiency.
Id: sys-messagebox

Setting Key: ReportPrintConfirmationTimeout    Setting Value: 30 Seconds (0 default)

When searching terms on a report, the select search terms font color is now a darker green, for better readability.

1.4 Start Archive Record Change Log

In 9.1.611.061 and up, this update improves performance when using the Archive Record Change Log function by executing deletes in batches.

This function improves performance when accessing records in SAMPro. Internal changes in Version 9.1.611.056 support the synchronization of the Record Change Log and Archive tables to allow this function to run successfully. The user will be asked to confirm the table changes if this function is run manually. Errors will be reported if manual intervention is needed to support archiving; contact your Support Rep if this occurs. This fix is only supported for MS SQL databases. Corrects a problem that prevented this function from running in recent versions.

1.5 Document Management

Internal changes in this release improve performance by Document Archiving and TechAnywhere document posting when folders contain a very large number of files.

This release corrects a timing issue where SAMPro would attempt to create an archive before the original document is done being scanned/saved. This could result in a 0KB archive file being created. 

This release corrects a sporadic 'Runtime error: index: 1 is outside of collection bounds' which showed up in Windows 10 (fresh install) when trying to show an image in a Document record.

1.5.1 Scanning

Using Attach>Scan now logs the User Id in addition to the date and time.

1.5.2 Start Document Archive Maintenance

Start Document Archive Maintenance's option to convert DBR's to PDF's generated PDF'd PO's as portrait instead of landscape in previous releases. The correct orientation is now maintained when a report is converted to PDF.

When Force Archive and Convert to PDF are both flagged, the archived .dbr file is now converted to a PDF. Previously, the file extension was changed but the file remained in .dbr format.

The DBR to PDF function now uses the report's internal bitmap path to set the pdf graphics if available.

This function now puts convertedDBRs in the root of the document\archive\convertedDBRs with subfoldering (YYYY-MM) if it is enabled.

New Field: Days Past to Check PDF Archives
This field controls a new purchase which has been added to this function to look for documents which failed to be converted from XML to PDF's; if any are found, the system will convert them to PDF's.  

When this function is run, the system subtracts the NumberOfPastDaysToCheckPDFArchives in the registry from today's date to check all documents created after that date; if the archive file is a PDF file then it checks if it exists. If it doesn't then it checks if there is an XML document for that archive, and if there is it converts it to the PDF Archive.

By default, this field is set to 7: documents created within the last 7 days will be checked to see if  they need to be converted to PDF's.  If this field is set to 0, no Documents will be checked to set if they are XML files which need to be converted to PDF.  The following registry allows the default value of the Days Past to Check PDF Archives field to be adjusted.

1.5.2a Registry Entry to Provide Default Days Past to Check PDF Archives

Id: sys-start-sdcmntarchvemntnnce

Setting Key: NumberOfPastDaysToCheckPDFArchives   Setting Value: numberofdays (default is 7)

This registry entry provides the default value for this field for the manual Start Document Archive Maintenance function and the Start Document Archive Maintenance (Automated) function.

1.5.3 Document Viewer

Multi-file Document records allow the user to view the files combined into a single PDF, generating a UserId_ViewDocument.pdf in SAMPro's base directory. This file is deleted when the user logs off for security reasons and to cleanup these extraneous files.

File Location:
Some users employ the Document Viewer to store web addresses instead of actual files. The File Location validation applied in earlier releases now ignores the location validation if the Location field begins with 'http://', 'https://' or "www.'.

If a web address is stored in the File Location field, clicking the View Document button launches a web browser pointing to the web address.

Document Viewer Download Button:

This update provides a download button to the document viewer. 

Field: push-saveDocument

1.5.3a Document Viewer

Web Viewable  FM - Web Viewable CRM - Web Viewable Tech
Documents uploaded from the web products (DBAnalytics, FMAnywhere, CRM, Dispatch Board) that use the 'Start Dashboard Post' or 'Start NetFramework Post' functions, now have their appropriate web viewable flags set. 

1.5.4 Correcting PO's Saved as Portrait PDF's

In previous releases, if the global registry option UseConvertedDBRs was set to true, landscape PO's that were archived as PDF's using this functionality were erroneously generated in portrait format. This release corrects this problem.

To correct previously auto-saved PO PDF's

Access the Purchase Order or Print PO Form

Start the Print PO process to display the report (but do not actually print it),

If your PO's are set to autosave, this procedure will resave the PO DBReport and regenerate the PDF correctly.

1.5.5 Quick Attach

Quick Attach documents may now be attached to 'locked' journal entries (both the Add and Save button disabled). QA documents are attached immediately when the record is NOT in Add mode.

This release provides a performance enhancement that will be especially noticeable if the save path has many files. In addition, the user will be warned if the Quick Attach Save path does not exists, and will not be allowed to continue. If the Quick Attach New path does not exist, the browser windows will be opened to the SAMPro root directory, and the user will be allowed to continue.

In version 9.1.611.059 and up, the quick attach cancel alert changed to “file selection was cancelled. Please click OK to continue.” Previously, it said “file selection was cancelled. Please click Yes to continue.” The button said OK.  

1.5.6 Canadian Date Formats

This release supports short-format Canadian dates (yyyy-MM-dd) when creating/using YYYY-MM subfolders generated by: Document Archive Maintenance, Quick Attach, Dashboard Post, Netframework Post, TechAnywhere Post, and Project Manager Workbench (RFI, RFQ, Transmittal, Submittal, Other.

1.5.7 Saving Report Files

This release improves the performance of saving report files; this should be especially noticeable if a large number of files already exist in the directory the file will be saved in.

1.6 Email

1.6.1 Emailing Reports

SAMPro's Email form supports an expanded Message field of 1200 characters to allow the entire contents of a Common phase to be included in the Message.

This update allows users who have selected the Use Java Mailer? option to send email tests with commas included in the text. Before, if a user had Use Java Mailer? selected and included a comma in the text, an error message would appear. 

In 9.1.611.060b and up, this update corrects a defect where the spacing and other formatting changes made the email content look warped. This only happened when common phrases were referenced in the email. 

1.6.2 Use Outlook Enhancements

When UseOutlook is enabled in the sys-email registry, this release handles setting the 'To' field for multiple addresses. For example, when emailing from the Collection viewer, the Client's Collections Email containing 0, 1, or 2 addresses (delimited with a comma or a semi-colon) will be inserted in the Outlook form's Email To field.

This release also supports setting Outlook's email 'To' field as well as defaulting pdf'd attachments The revised xmlToPdf.jar file (dated 12017/12/29 or later) is also required.

1.6.3 CopyAll Registry

This release corrects an issue where using the CopyAll registry setting in sys-email resulted in a duplicate email if the email came from an escalation event.

1.6.4 New XMLToPDF Files

Corrects Email Address / Subject Concatenation Issue from Client Collections

The revised XmlToPdf[2021-05-21 Java8-11].jar file corrects an issue in Outlook 2016. The "Collections Email Address" was having the "Collections Email Subject" concatenated when emailing an invoice from the Client Collections screen. This file must be renamed as XmlToPdf.jar in order for it to be used. This version supports TLS 1.2 and uses Javamail 1.6.2. Java 7 is not supported.

Support TLS 1.2 and Uses Javamail 1.6.2

A new version of the XML to PDF file is included as XmlToPdf[2019-04-05 Java 8-11].jar.  In addition to the features described in the version from 2019-01-16, this version:

Specifies the use of TLS 1.2 (a newer protocol) for emailing
Changes how XmlToPdf connects to email servers
Updates Javamail to 1.6.2

This file must be renamed as XmlToPdf.jar in order for it to be used. It does not support Java 7.

Supports Java 8-11, Monthly Folders and Registry to Retain Sent Files

XmlToPdf[2019-01-16 Java8-11].jar

This file must be renamed as XmlToPdf.jar in order to be used. This version of the XmlToPdf.jar file supports Java 8-11. It should NOT be installed if Java 7 users will be sending emails from SAMPro.  It also creates Monthly folders in the XmlToPDFSent folder (YYYY-MM format) to store all the sent pdfs (and XML and log files, if enabled via registry) from a particular month.   

This version of the file also corrects the following which existed in the previous Java 8-11 files:

Email Retry files would fail to include the pdf and leave it in the retry folder.

Single report (no attachments, one section) Password-protected PDFs were not properly applying a password.

1.6.4a Change to Registry When Using this XmlToPdf[2019-01-03 Java8-11] or Above

The functionality of the -d and -v flags (enabled via the global appflagsxmltopdf) has been altered for XmlToPdf[2019-01-03 Java8-11] and above. Previously, the -d flag just deleted the log and xml file. That was changed to include the pdf also at some point. This version makes the -d flag only delete the XML file. The PDF file is now always preserved. The log file is now deleted by default. Adding the -v flag will preserve the log.

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: appflagsxmltopdf

Setting Value: -d

This value retains the PDF files only. This is the default setting if this registry option appflagsxmltopdf is NOT enabled.

Setting Value:-v

If the Setting Value is set to -v the log, XML, and PDF files (if present) will be retained in the base XmlToPDF_Sent folder.

If the MailerMethod is set to Java in the sys-email registry, running with the -v flag set also retains the XML and log files of emails sent without an attachment. This allows the XML record of scheduled event emails to be retained.

Note: The log files of emails with PDF attached can be quite large, so the monthly folders should be cleared out on a regular basis.

Setting Value: -d -v

This retains the pdf and log files but not the XML files. If the MailerMethod is set to Java in the sys-email registry, running with the -v and -v flags set also retains the log files of emails sent without an attachment. This allows a log of scheduled event emails and emailed reports to be retained.

1.6.4b Installations with some Java 7 Users

Installations with some Java 7 users should rename the XmlToPdf[2017-12-27].jar XmlToPdf.jar in order for it to be used. This file supports the revised W-2 reporting format. It also corrects a file 'cannot find this file' error with UseOutlook enabled for Outlook 2013 and below. This version support Java 7 and 8.

1.6.5 Java Detection

When trying to call XMLtoPDF when Java is not installed, previous versions of SAMPro reported the error "Runtime error: OS Error: The system cannot find the file specified."  The system will now detect when Java not installed before launching Xml-to-Pdf java program and display the following error instead:

ERROR:
You do not have access to the Java runtime.
See your system administrator.

1.6.6 Revised XMLtoPDF to Correct UseOutlook Issue

Revised XmlToPdf.jar file for Java 8-11: TLS 1.2 and Uses Javamail 1.6.2 (no default file; must rename):

The XmlToPdf[2021-07-26 Java8-11].jar file corrects and causes SAMPro to hang until Outlook is closed under the following condition:

Registry Set to Use Outlook: (Registry Id: sys-email   Setting Key: UseOutlook   Setting Value: True)

Clicking an E-Mail button in SAMPro if Outlook is not currently open/running

1.6.7 Provide Support for Image/Logo in Emails

Scheduled Event Escalation Emails are not Sent with EmailHeaderImage or EmailFooterImage Registries set

In the above case, scheduled event escalation emails were not being sent out when a SAMPro environment used the SAMPro emailer instead of XMLtoPDF.jar. This update corrects that defect. Id: sys-emailHeaderImage-escalation

Setting Key: Escalation Profile Id    Setting Value: (path to the image)

Example: https://www.databasics.com/images/email/header.png

Id: sys-emailFooterImage-escalation

Setting Key: Escalation Profile Id       Setting Value: (path to the image)

Example: https://www.databasics.com/images/email/footer.png

Note: The path to the image must be accessible via the web, otherwise, the image will not appear in the email for the recipient.

1.7 Login Processing

Switching Security from the File>Switch Security Id menu no longer terminates the User's Web sessions.

For SQL Server database users, SAMPro will check for database table change rights and uncommitted transactions to ensure a successful database conversion.

Corrects a 'failed to set read permissions for user' error logging into SAMPro with an SQL 2008 database.

See Customer Note 1.1.1 for a registry to limit software expiration warnings to specific Users/User Groups.

 

1.7.1 Test for Intercompany Settings on Login

Data-related issues can occur if an Intercompany installation runs with a non-Interco v.cus and vice versa. In this version, the system will display a warning upon login if the v.cus file and global registry intercompanyenabled=true don't match.  'Special' users will not see the warning to avoid issues with agent-type users started via batch file.

WARNING: The Inter Company settings on your v.cus and global registry do not match. Please contact your support representative for assistance.

1.7.2  Enhanced Login Processing

The following three enhancements have been made to the SAMPro Login process in this release:

WHEN the Id is valid AND the Password is valid AND the user's Failed Login Limit is exceeded

THEN the 'User Account has too many Failed Logins' error is issued instead of the 'Invalid User Id and/or Password' error.

WHEN the Id is valid AND but Password is invalid AND the user's Failed Login Limit is exceeded

THEN also, the 'User Account has too many Failed Logins' error is issued instead of the 'Invalid User Id and/or Password' error. This is the procedure employed by many websites.

WHEN the Id is valid AND the Password is valid AND the Logon process has been successfully completed

THEN the user's Failed Logon Count is reset to zero. Otherwise, the Failed Logon Count will remain in effect for all future login attempts.

This is implemated in 9.1.611.059 and up: In previous releases, the following registry setting was enabled to allow users to display a message allowing users to log on back onto SAMPro immediately after logging off, perhaps as a different user.  However, this registry was not working as intended, and was launching the incorrect SAMPro image from the v.exe file rather than via the startme:

Id: sys-ffv-global-settings Setting Key: IsOkToLogonAgain Setting Value: true

Rather than implement a fix, the functionality was deemed unnecessary and this registry has been deprecated and removed from having any functionality.

1.8 Events Managers

The Dashboard, Point Of Sale, Reports, Scheduled Events and TechAnywhere Events Managers have been refined to better handle recurring events that have been interrupted and need re-scheduled.

1.9 Viewers

This update corrects a defect with the code when a specific user would clone an employee, a technician, or a client site record, entering a new Id and clicking “Add” would not copy fields, as it did for other users. In addition, a previous defect from a previous case where unintended issues in the Approval Wizard as well as the Service Channel integration impacted all viewers. This update corrects this defect to only impact Cloning records.

Previously, the SAMPro session run by customers using the AlwaysUp service would not fully close down because it gets hung up on the message box "Are you sure you want to exit?" AlwaysUp did not know what to do, so it waits and then ultimately has to forcibly end the task, leaving an orphaned active lgnhstry entry, and other issues like timeout alarms not being canceled. This update eliminates the "Are you sure you want to exit?" message box for certain users so that SAMPro just exits when the exit button is pressed.

Previously, the entry in the ranges table would not create when a new user attempted to open the WO viewer. Also, when a user opened a Work Order through another viewer, then cleared the filter for the specific Work Order in Find Data, and then clicked on List, it would generate the record. This update improves the work order viewer’s performance for new users and corrects these defects.

Previously when a user would clone an employee, a technician, or a client site record, entering a new Id and clicking “Add” would not copy fields. This update corrects this defect. 

This update corrects a defect with the code when a specific user would clone an employee, a technician, or a client site record, entering a new Id and clicking “Add” would not copy fields, as it did for other users. Previously, a defect from a previous case where unintended issues in the Approval Wizard as well as the Service Channel integration impacted all viewers. This update corrects this defect to only impact Cloning records.

Previously when loading SQL results into memory, there would be a lot of data to load resulting in slow processing. This registry improves the loading speed when processing SQL results.

This update corrects a defect preventing users from being able to use the "Copy Quote Scope" functionality on all new and existing Quotes, throwing an error when a user clicked the Copy Quote Scope button.

This release revises the Warning message that when you leave a record that has changes that have not yet been saved.

WARNING: you have not saved all the changes you made to record ''xxx'',

Click ''Yes'' to return to record ''xxx'' so you can save the changes.

Click ''No'' to continue without saving the changes.

This release corrects sporadic errors encountered when clicking the End key and then editing an Id field that already contains the maximum number of characters. In order to prevent any loss of data, it is necessary to save all changes before changing the Id (implemented in Version 9.1.611.050). Unfortunately, this resulted in the user sometimes being stuck in a loop when they clicked Yes to save changes and return to the original record. This has been corrected in Version 9.1.611.053. The 'No' path also works correctly and takes the user to the new record without saving changes.  

1.9.1 Id Lookup Lists

This release provides improved performance when an Id-lookup list is initially opened (by double-clicking on an Id field or clicking the Lookup button ) and also when the user selects a different sort order in an Id-lookup list.

1.9.2  Viewer Status Pane

The Status Pane (the bar at the bottom of SAMPro record windows) now displays the value of the field that the mouse is hovering over. This enhancement enables the user to view the contents of fields (such as the Job Cost Code Id) that are not fully displayed in the data-entry screen. Note: When the Status Pane displays the 'in focus' field that changes to that field will not be displayed on the Status Pane until the user has tabbed out of it.

1.9.3  List  Pane Column Filtering Enhancement

On list panes, users can now right-click on column titles to apply filters to the column. This includes both record lists and lists displayed via child and parent tabs. On record lists, this saves users the trouble of going back and forth to the range screen to do the user's  filtering.

* To filter a column, right-click on the column title and enter the filter on the subsequent popup.

* The list will be redisplayed with the filter applied. The column title will be displayed with the column title and text colors reverses to indicate that a filter on the column is being applied.

 

 

The new list pane filtering functionality is very similar to filtering users are used to in range screens and DBAnalytics. The following documentation provides details and examples on using the list pane filtering.

* Filters may be applied to multiple columns.

* To remove a filter, enter a blank filter in the popup.

* To apply a blank filter, enter a filter value of ‘=’ in the popup.

* After a filter is applied, the list will always revert to its original sort order.

* Filters on numeric columns will use numeric comparison operators. Case insensitive String comparison operators will be used on all other columns. This means that for numeric column (but not a String column), a filter of ‘5000’ will match a column value of ‘5,000.00’. A column is deemed numeric if

o All its contents in the list are numeric

o And the entered filter is also numeric.

The filter format is similar to that used by the ‘Find Data’ button  The filter consists of one or more ‘or clauses’ separated by commas.

Each ‘or clause’ can be in one of these two formats:

? <not><operator>value

<not> is the optional ‘not operator’ (‘!’)

Valid <operator>s are

 ‘=’
 ‘<>’
  ‘>’
 ‘>=’
 ‘<’
 ‘<=’

If no operator is present, '=’ is assumed.

Examples:

50 (and the equivalent ‘=50’)
<50
!<50 (equivalent to ‘>=50)
>=2017-01-01
<not><firstValue>_<lastValue>
<not> is the optional ‘not operator’ (‘!’)
The values represent an inclusive range
Example: 2017-01-01_2017-12-31

The list of ‘or clauses’ can be proceeded with a ’global not’ operator ( ‘~’). So while

50,60

will include all lines having a value of 50 or 60 in the column,

~50,60

will include all lines NOT having a value of 50 or 60 in the column.

‘Wild Card’ filters may be used with the actual or implied ‘=’ operators on non-numeric columns. Either ‘%’ or ‘*’ may be used as the Wild Card character.

If users enter a column filter that would result in no lines being displayed:

An Error Message will be displayed.
The list will not be updated.
The filter will be restored to its previous value.

When users hover the mouse over a title column, the status pane will now display the following:

A reminder that users can left click on a column to sort the list by that column.
A reminder that users can right click on a column to apply a filter to that column.
In addition, the current value of the filter (if there is one) will be displayed.

1.9.4 Viewer Child Tabs 

This update changes the contact child “Firm” field to “Contact Group” matching the value pulled from Client Site Contacts. This update keeps it consistent throughout SAMPro.  

Keyboard Equivalents

The user may now toggle between the Magnify and Line views of the selected child tab line with the keyboard equivalent Ctrl+Q or Ctrl+q.  

1.9.5 All Viewers: Combined Add/Save Sidebar Button

In all previous versions of SAMPro, separate buttons were used to Add a new record or Change an existing record. This was useful for managing record cloning as the Add button would be enabled what a new record was started. In this release, a single button will be used to save or add a record. The icon used on the button will indicate if a record is being changed or added, or if the button is disabled. The addition of the + sign to the button when the record is in Add mode will provide a visual clue that a new record is being added while maintaining the standard usage of a single button for the save process.

 

SKIN1 Icon

Function

Save existing record

Save (Add) new record

Save record disabled

 

1.9.6 Title Bar

In Version 9.1.611.059 and up, users now have their user ID displayed on the SAMPro title bar. This is helpful for users to know which license they are using for SAMPro. 

1.10 Journals Viewers with Tack Numbers

When most SAMPro journals are edited, the revised entry's id is usually appended with a 'tack' number. The original journal entry cannot be edited if it has been replaced with a new entry (with a higher 'tack' number). In this release, the user is warned if they access a journal entry which has been replaced. For example, if Purchase Orders are used as controlled documents, the following warning would appear:

WARNING: Purchase Order 123456 has been replaced by 123456-01.
This record cannot be changed.

This warning is designed to prevent the user from wasting time by attempting to make changes to a journal entry record which cannot be saved because it has already been replaced. See Customer Note 1.1.2 for a registry to disable this warning globally or by individual viewer.

1.11 Licensing

This release closes a loophole which allowed more Full User and TechAnywhere (Technician) records to be created than allowed by the Data-Basics license. If the maximum has been exceeded, the User/Technician records cannot be edited except to disable them. If this occurs:

User Record: Flag the Disabled flag on any Full User record not in service.

Technician Record: Active Techs not currently using TechAnywhere should have the Remote Device Type set to None so they will not be included in the TechAnywhere license count. These Technicians will not have access to TechAnywhere.

 

If additional Full User and/or Technician licenses are still required after disabling unused records, contact a SAMPro account manager.

1.11.1 Read-Only Users

This release prohibits any user with Access Type 'ReadOnly' from executing any Starter Function.

1.12 Positive Pay

All formats: This release correctly processes check amounts >1 million dollars instead of truncating them.

This release corrects an issue when an apostrophe in the Vendor Name was doubled for the HSBC, JPMorganChase and Mellon formats. The VOIDS HSBC Void Trailer Indicator field is also correctly set to VOIDS in this image.

1.12.1 Positive Pay (BoA)

This release supports Bank Of America Positive Pay Reporting w/ Payee Information. This functionality is enabled via the following registry:

Id: sys-positive-pay

Setting Key: Format  Setting Value: BankOfAmericaPayee

The AccountNo and BatchId registry options are also required when this Format is specified.

1.12.2 Positive Pay Reporting for RBC

This release adds Positive Pay reporting for RBC (Royal Bank of Canada). The Check Reference Name is included in the Positive Pay file. The following registry entries are required:

Id:   sys-positive-pay -glaccount- glentity

If more than one report will be produced, the Id must include the GL Account (and, optionally, the GL Entity combination) this file will be created for. Note: Even if an entity is not specified, a dash must follow the GL Account Id.

Setting Key: Format  Setting Value: RBC

This registry is required for RBC positive pay. The following additional registry options are required for positive pay reporting with Royal Bank of Canada.

Setting Key: RID Setting Value: TransitBatchNo

Enter the Transit/Batch Numbers as specified by the user's bank. This field defines the Transit/Batch Number (Referenced in Batch Header Record, Transaction Record, Batch Trailer Record).

Setting Key: BatchId Setting Value: ClientNumber

User's Client Number as specified by RBC (Referenced in File Header Record).

Setting Key: AccountNo  Setting Value: AccountNumber

Where AccountNumber is replaced by the number of the bank account at the user's financial institution. This field is referenced in the Batch Header Record, Transaction Record and Batch Trailer Record.

Setting Key: TestFileHeader Setting Value: StringForTestHeader

Enter the StringForTestHeader exactly as specified by RBC in the Setting Value. The system will use the TestFileHeader if the Test box on Report Positive Pay is checked.

Setting Key:  ProdFileHeader Setting Value: StringForProdHeader

Enter the StringForProdHeader exactly as specified by RBC in the Setting Value. The system will use the ProdFileHeader setting if the Test box on Report Positive Pay is clear.

1.12.2a Positive Pay - New Alternate Format for Royal Bank of Canada: RBC0002

Id:   sys-positive-pay-glaccount-glentity

If more than one report will be produced, the Id must include the GL Account (and, optionally, the GL Entity combination) this file will be created for. Note: Even if users do not specify an entity, a dash must follow the GL Account Id.

Setting Key: format    Setting Value: RBC0002

This format differs from the RBC format only in the B record line in positions 99-102 that have been changed from 0003 (D/A Payee Match) to 0002 (Payee Match Only).

The additional registry Keys required for RBC are also required for RBC002:

Setting Key: RID Setting Value: TransitBatch

Enter the Transit/Batch Numbers as specified by the user's bank. This field defines the Transit/Batch Number (Referenced in Batch Header Record, Transaction Record, Batch Trailer Record).

Setting Key: BatchId Setting Value: ClientNumber

User's Client Number as specified by RBC (Referenced in File Header Record).

Setting Key: AccountNo  Setting Value: AccountNumber

Where AccountNumber is replaced by the number of the bank account at the user's financial institution. This field is referenced in the Batch Header Record, Transaction Record, and Batch Trailer Record.

Setting Key: TestFileHeader Setting Value: StringForTestHeader

Enter the StringForTestHeader exactly as specified by RBC in the Setting Value. The system will use the TestFileHeader if the Test box on Report Positive Pay is checked.

Setting Key:  ProdFileHeader Setting Value: StringForProdHeader

Enter the StringForProdHeader exactly as specified by RBC in the Setting Value. The system will use the ProdFileHeader setting if the Test box on Report Positive Pay is clear.

1.12.3 Positive Pay Processing for BBT

The following registry options are required:

Id: sys-positive-pay

Setting Key: Format  Setting Value: BBT

Setting Key: AccountNo  Setting Value: as provided by the bank

The filename registry is optional. If the users do not use this option, the system will prompt users to select a name and directory for this file.

1.12.4 Positive Pay Processing  Wells Fargo2 (Custom)

This registry supports a custom layout requested by a specific SAMPro user.

Id: sys-positive-pay

Setting Key: Format  Setting Value: WellsFargo2

Setting Key: AccountNo  Setting Value: as provided by the bank

Se tting Key: BatchId Setting Value: format as provided by the bank

Setting Key: filename Setting Value: yourfilename^date^^time^.cvs

The filename format should be used if multiple branches are running this report. The filename should be set to .csv for Wells Fargo2. The file will be created in the working directory where the SAM Pro executable v.exe is running. If you do not use this option, the system will prompt users to select a name and directory for this file.

The ^date^ and ^time^ tokens enable you to automatically imbed the date and time the file is run. This will prevent existing reports from being overwritten.

1.12.5 Positive Pay Processing Citi-ARP

The following registry options are required for implementing Positive Pay Processing for Citi-ARP:

Id: sys-positive-pay

Setting Key: Format   Setting Value:  CitiARP

Setting Key: BankId   Setting Value: Bank Number provided by bank

Setting Key: AccountNo  Setting Value: Account Number provided by bank

The filename registry is optional. If users do not use this option, the system will prompt users to select a name and directory for this file.

1.12.6 Positive Pay PNC

The CRLF delimiter has been added to the end of detail records for PNC Positive Pay reporting.

1.12.7 New Positive Pay PNCPayee

Id: sys-positive-pay

Setting Key: format  Setting Value: PNCPayee

This format is identical to the existing Positive Pay format  PNC with the exception that the check reference name is stored in the Payee Name 1 field instead of the Additional Data field.

1.12.8 Positive Pay (HSBC)  

This release supports positive pay reporting for HSBC Bank. The following registry setting is required:

Id: sys-positive-pay

Setting Key: Format  Setting Value: HSBC

1.12.9 Positive Pay (Univest)

Id:   sys-positive-pay -glaccount- glentity

Setting Key: Format  Setting Value: Univest

Setting Key: AccountNo  Setting Value: 10 digit account number as specified by Univest

The above registry settings are required. The following registry may be enabled if needed.

Setting Key: filename Setting Value: yourfilename^date^^time^.txt

The filename format should be used if multiple companies or branches are running this report. The filename should be set to .txt. The file will be created in the working directory where the SAM Pro executable v.exe is running. If users do not use this option, the system will prompt the user to select a name and directory for this file.

1.12.10 Positive Pay for Signature Bank

Id:   sys-positive-pay -glaccount- glentity

Setting Key: Format  Setting Value: signature

Setting Key: AccountNo  Setting Value: Account number as specified by Signature Bank

The above registry settings are required. Note: The Payee Name must NOT include a comma.

1.12.11 Positive Pay for OceanFirstBank

Id: sys-positive-pay-glaccount-glentity

Setting Key: Format  Setting Value: oceanfirst

Setting Key: AccountNo    Setting Value: Account number as specified by Ocean First Bank.

The above registry settings are required.

1.13 User Group

Corrects a problem where 'cloning' a User Group cleared all selected lines. The settings from the original record are now retained in the newly created one.

1.14 Default and Java 8 XmlToPdf.jar Files

The default XmlToPdf.jar file included in this release will support both Java 7 and 8; it is dated 2017-12-29. It supports the revised W-2 reporting format and corrects a file 'cannot find this file' error when running with UseOutlook enabled.

Enhanced Java 8 Functionality: The newest XmlToPdf.jar file (included as XmlToPdf [2018-06-29].jar) requires Java 8. Java 8 must be installed on ALL machines that will do emails, including one that runs scheduled events.  This file supports enhanced error handling to give a number of different status codes based on where the error was encountered and what type of error it was. It logs the error to a new XmlToPdf.log file in the root SAMPro directory. To use this functionality:

Change the name of the default XmlToPdf.jar file to XmlToPdfOUT.jar and then

Copy the XmlToPdf [2018-06-29].jar and change the name of the copy to XmlToPdf.jar

1.15 Database Communications Recovery

A ‘Comm Link Failure’ (CLF) occurs when SAMPro attempts to access a database on a network-connected server and the communication link to that server is inoperable (e.g., ethernet or wireless issues). This release intercepts CLFs on database queries and enters a ‘Recovery Loop’ which tries to re-establish the connection to the database server. When the connection is successfully re-established, SAMPro continues as if nothing has happened. Registry entries are available from Support if this functionality needs to be adjusted.

1.16  PDFJoiner.jar Enhancements

Previously, when attempting to use the "Make a PDF" function to merge several documents together, it would occasionally produce an error. In 9.1.611.061 and up, this update improves the performance of the call to find the error, makes multiple attempts, and writes more information to the error log if one does occur. 

The revised PDFJoiner.jar file dated 2018-03-14 supports joining secured PDFs, such as invoices received from Vendors. When the Make PDF button is clicked (or another functionality involving a PDF merge is invoked), PDFs that do not require a password to open will be merged. PDFs that do require a password to open will be skipped.   

1.17 Custom Fields

In previous releases, the Custom Fields functionality was label-specific. In other words, if a user changed a common label such as "Email Address:" in one viewer (say, the Client record) to "Client Email:" it would appear in all Viewers (e.g, Job, Client Site, etc.) as "Client Email".  

In this release the Custom Fields functionality has been enhanced to be viewer-specific with the following exceptions:

Id Field Labels:
Custom Field Labels for record Id's are used wherever that record is referenced. For example, if a user changes the label "Client Id:" to "Customer#" the label Customer# will appear in the Client viewer as well as in the Job viewer.

Labels to the right of the field:
This release does not support the customization of labels that appear to the right of the fields, as is the case with most Checkbox (boolean) fields.

Fields without Standard Labels:
Some fields do not have a standard label defined; these may not be customized.

Address Fields:
Address fields may not be changed via Custom Fields but may be changed for all instances via Start Field Label Remap.

A new v.cus field is required to see this new functionality: contact a Support Representative if needed.

1.18 User Report Definition

Filter: The following token replacement strings are now supported in User Reports Definitions

^executiveprstring^
^executivepyrllprdstring^
^pmfilter^
^dscplnefilter^

Users can add ^executiveprstring^,^executivepyrllprdstring^,^pmfilter^ or ^dscplnefilter^ in the user query with a corresponding filter.  

1.19 Lock Recovery (MSSQL Server Only)

In previous releases, when a database access function encountered a record lock condition an ‘Record Lock’ error message was displayed, and the transaction failed.

This release provides a recovery process to resolve temporary locks for MS SQL databases; this functionality is not supported for Sybase databases. When enabled via the registry (see Customer Note 9.1.1 below), when a record lock condition is encountered, a dialog box will now be displayed. See the sample below.

The dialog box will include information as to the user who is holding the lock. This gives the locked-out user a chance to confer with the locking user who may be able to resolve the situation. If the user does not have permission to obtain the lock information, an appropriate message will be displayed instead of the lock information itself.

The dialog box contains 3 buttons:

‘Try Again’. When selected, the dialog box will disappear, and the query will be attempted one additional time.

If after the attempt, the lock is still in effect, the dialog box will be redisplayed.

If, however, the lock has been cleared by the locking user so that the query is now successful, the user will be so notified, and processing will continue as if the lock had never been encountered.

‘Try For 60 Seconds’. When selected, the dialog box will disappear, and the query will be repeatedly attempted for approximately 60 seconds.

If, after the 60 seconds, the lock is still in effect, the dialog box will display ag.

If, however, anytime during the 60-second wait, the lock has been cleared by the locking user so that the query is now successful, the user will be immediately notified, and processing will continue as if the lock had never been encountered.

‘Cancel’ (or ‘X-ing’ out the dialog box). The query will be tried 1 more time.

If, after the additional try, the lock is still in effect, the query attempt will return a failure status and processing will continue as is currently implemented.

If, however, the additional try is successful, the user will be so notified, and processing will continue as if the lock had never been encountered.

1.19.1. Registry to Enable Database Lock Recovery Dialog Box

The Lock Recovery popup window was implemented in version 9.1.611.053a: when a lock was encountered a dialog box providing lock information and the option to Try Again, Try for 60 Seconds, or Cancel was displayed. In version 9.1.611.055a the default is to not show the new box, but instead display the old record lock message box that only required the user to click OK. The user waiting to make a decision on which of the three options to select could make things worse.  The dialog box can be re-enabled globally via registry setting noted below.  It can also be re-enabled for specific users via the User Registry child table for those users who understood how the use the functionality properly.

Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: LockRecoveryDialogEnabled   Setting Value: true   (default false)

1.20 Launching External Apps / Documents

In Version 9.1.611.036, SAMPro Document opening was changed to try to improve the Windows Registry file extension lookup and to have a fallback to use Windows PowerShell to open the file as a last resort if SAMPro couldn't determine anything useful from the Windows Registry.

Version 9.1.611.056 improves SAMPro's ability to read and interpret Windows. In addition, CMD (the Windows Command line) will be used to open Documents rather than PowerShell. This is important because some clients block their users from being able to use PowerShell. PowerShell is a powerful tool, and therefore many antivirus solutions and IT Systems Administrators restrict this application.  

1.21 WebHelp

In Version 9.1.611.058 and up, SAMPro's WebHelp will launch using the user's default browser.  Previously, Internet Explorer (soon to be retired in 2022) was used for WebHelp.

In Version 9.1.611.059 and up, this issue was fixed so users are sent to specific WebHelp. Previously for SAMPro WebHelp, when clicking on the help option, the WebHelp would be sent to the default web instead of content-specific help.

1.22 Icons

MessageBox Icons:

In Version 9.1.611.059 and up, the Microsoft "Information" Icon is now implemented. In previous releases, many of our SAMPro message boxes used the Microsoft "Warning" Icon, when they were not actual warnings. 

1.23 Directory

Cache SAMPro Working Directory: 

In version 9.1.611.059 and up, this release solves an issue by caching the SAMPro base directory at login so that SAMPro can always find the XmlToPdf.jar file. In previous releases, a select number of users were unable to convert a file to PDF or email a file with the message "Error: unable to access jar file". 

1.24 General System Updates

Adobe PDF Printer:

In this release, the Adobe PDF printer will not be displayed in the SAMPro printer list, whether or not it is the default printer. This is the new default behavior. This addresses an issue when customers receive an OS Error 16r6 when selecting "Adobe PDF" when printing. This is due to a new Adobe version update (released 1/12/22), resulting in a failure to post (e.g., Service Invoice) or other issues where a print confirmation is required.

2 Client, Site and Equipment

2.1 Registry Entries

2.2. Reports

2.3 Site Equipment

2.3.1 Main Tab

The Equipment Type Id is no longer cleared when the PCR Table Id is updated. This corrects a problem in TechAnywhere and in manual changes to the Site Equipment record.

New Field: Deny TA Edit
This field should be flagged if TechAnywhere Techs should be allowed to see and add charges to this Equipment, but NOT to edit the equipment details. This would typically be used to prevent technicians from filling in important details into the wrong/generic equipment record.

2.3.2 New Tab - Certifications

This version supports multiple Certifications per Equipment and Site.

This new tab allows users to list Certifications required to work on the selected Equipment in addition to the Certification listed on the Equipment's Main tab.

When TechFinder is launched from the Dispatch Board or Work Order, all Certifications for the Site and the first piece of Equipment on the Work Order will be listed. When TechFinder is launched from New Call, all Certifications for the selected and Equipment will be listed. This list is prepended with an ampersand & so that only those Techs with all the Certifications listed appear in TechFinder.

2.3.3 Site Equipment PM Schedule Tab

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field. The full relationship is validated again when leaving a childline or saving a record.

2.3.3a Site Equipment PM Schedule Lines for Master Contract 'Build Outs'

If a PM Schedule line has a Master Contract reference but no WO Id it came from a Master Contract 'Build Out' (currently supported only by customization). In this release, the user is allowed to edit these lines in order to assign different Parts and/or Task lists when Create PM WorkOrders is run. Note: Lines with a Master Contract Id AND Work Order Id may NOT be edited.

2.3.4 Site Equipment Service Tab

Service Tasks Id:
This field is now used to provide a default for PM's generated from the Master Contract. In previous releases, if a Service Task Id wasn't specified on the Schedule tab of the Master Contract then no Task List was attached to the PM Work Order generated from that line. In this release, if the Service Task Id is blank on the Master Contract, the system now looks to this field instead. This enhancement allows for different Task Lists to be assigned by the Equipment scheduled. If a Service Task List is specified on the Master Contract's Schedule line, it will continue to be used for all Equipment scheduled for from that line.

New Fields: Replacement Equipment Id:   Replacement (Date):
These display fields will be completed if the currently selected Equipment Id was replaced by the Replacement Equipment Id on the Replacement date listed from TechAnywhere. If the selected Equipment has NOT been tagged as replaced, these fields well be blank. See Customer Note 19.7 for additional details.

2.3.5 Site Equipment List

A new Sort Order has been added: ClientSiteEquipmentByIdByBarcode.

2.3.6 Site Equipment Range Screen

New Range Field: Bar Code

2.4 Site

2.4.1 Certification Tab

This version supports multiple Certifications per Equipment and Site.

This new child tab allows users to list Certifications required to work at the selected Site. It will apply to all Equipment associated with this Site. Certifications that are only applicable to certain Equipment at a site should be added to the Site Equipment's Certifications tab.

When TechFinder is launched from the Dispatch Board or Work Order, all Certifications for the Site and the first piece of Equipment on the Work Order will be listed. When TechFinder is launched from New Call, all Certifications for the selected and Equipment will be listed. This list is prepended with an ampersand & so that only those Techs with all the Certifications listed appear in TechFinder.

2.4.2 Site PM Billing Tab

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field. The full relationship is validated again when leaving a childline or saving a record.

2.4.3 User Fields Tab

New Fields - Client Site User 6-10:
Five new User fields have been added for use with custom reporting, analytics, etc.

2.4.5 Site List

The new Sort Order ClientSitesByIdByRn lets the user sort by the Client Site Rn column. This allows the list to be sorted by the newest/oldest record added.  

2.4.6 Site Service Tab

New Field: IVR Instructions
This field is designed for the purpose of IVR instructions for the technician. This field is available for use in escalation emails (using the token ^clntste_ivr^). It is also designed for future use in TechAnywhere.

2.4.7 Main Tab

 This new button may be clicked to launch the Start Alias Update function with the Client Site filled in. This function is used to copy the Alias and Credit Cart information from the selected Site to other Sites sharing the same COP tab Client Id. The user is warned if the launching Site does not have the COP Client completed. See Customer Note 6.8 for details on the Start Alias Update function.

This release corrects an issue where the Map It functionality) that did not work correctly if a newer version of Chrome is the default browser. If the Latitude and Longitude fields are completed, clicking this button once again launches Google Maps with the coordinates completed.

2.5 Client

New Field: Tax Exempt Expiration:
The date the Client's Tax Exempt Certification expires. This field is currently for informational purposes only.

2.5.1 Client Collections Viewer

This release corrects a display error in the High Balance Date field on the Client Collections screen. Previously, the most current invoice date always appeared in the High Balance Date field.

The first column of the Past Due summary box has been re-titled '1-30 Days' for clarity. It was previously titled 'Current'.

The "Invoice Date" field in the summary pane has been relabeled as 'High Balance Date' to better describe its meaning.

When this button is clicked, a customer statement report will be launched with the Client Id completed. By default, Report Customer Statements (RCUSTSTMNT) will be launched, but the following registry option allows a different report to be launched instead.

Id: sys-viewer-vclnt

Setting Key: StatementReportId   Setting Value: report function id

2.5.2 Client Collection Notes

Notes List New Field: Obsoleted
In previous releases, the user was unable to access obsoleted Collection notes. In this release, the Collection Notes List displays these notes so they can be accessed if needed.

The Email button has been added to the Collection Notes viewer to allow these Notes to be emailed directly. If any changes have been made to the note, it must be saved and reopened before it can be sent.

This release supports the use of Common Phrases in the Notes viewer launched from a record. Commons Phrases may be added to the Notes field in the lower half of the screen by typing the Common Phrase Id and pressing Enter.

2.5.3 Client Range Screen

City:  State: Zip:
These new ranges allow the user to filter on the City, State, and Zip Code fields in the Client Mailing Address.

2.5.4 Client List Screen

A new Sort Order has been added, ClientsByClientMailingAddress. The new List displays the Client's City, State, Zip, Street Address, and Client Name.

2.5.5 Client Collections All/Open Invoices List:

The new Customer PO column has been added to the right-hand side of the list. It references the customer's purchase order associated with the invoice.

The Client Collections Screen's center pane can also be used to view paid invoices by clicking the All/Open Invoices button and then using the right-click list pane filtering to filter on 0.00 in the Amount Due column.  

 

2.6 Client Site Import

The Security Id has been added as the 94th column in the spreadsheet used with this function. If completed, it is used to set the Security Id of the Site, Job, Job Billing Item, Job Cost Code, and Site Equipment records.

WARNING: The new Security Id column should NOT be used with Intercompany Security: Client Sites are generally not company-specific so it makes no sense for intercompany users to put something in the new column. In addition, Companies that use the older (non-Intercompany) Security that supports Site and Equipment as global records should NOT specify Security in the 94th column.

2.6.1 Client Site Import Enhancement - SAMPro 9.1.611.058 and Above
