To add a check to ensure the value for the Tax Group on the purchase order General and Inventory tabs match the values on the child lines, a registry has been created:

Id: sys-viewer-vprchseordrlst

Setting Key: ValidateTaxGroupMismatch    Setting Value: (blank), error, warn

When this registry is set to "warn" then on save, an error message will display stating that the Tax Group on all child lines should match that in the header, but the Purchase Order will be allowed to save.

When it is set to "error" - a similar message will appear but the save will NOT complete until the tax group is manually updated on to match.

When blank or disabled, no message displays and saves are allowed.

4.2 Purchasing Reports

4.2.1 Report PO Form

The following Ranges have been added to the Purchase Order Report: Vendor Id, WO Id and PO Date Entered.

This release corrects a spurious 'trim blanks' error when the Windows Printer Dialog box is enabled and the 'PrintConfirmationDisabled' registry entry was not enabled.  

This release corrects the spurious error "You cannot change this Purchase Order because it was spooled to the printer, but it was not marked as being successfully printed" which could occur if the Print Confirmation was disabled by registry entry.

4.2.1a PO Forms Report - Portrait Format

By default, the PO prints in landscape mode. This option will allow it to print in portrait orientation, and will fit in most typical window envelopes when folded. The following registry option enables the portrait format:

Registry Id: sys-printer-dialog-rpofrm

Setting Key: orientation Setting Value: 1

Important Note on Graphics:
If your company changes to the portrait format from landscape you will need to have new graphics supporting the change in place. The existing landscape graphics should NOT be removed (to supported previously archived reports). The new portrait graphics should have a different name, and the bitmaps option of the sys-report-rpofrm registry should be updated with the new graphics name at the same time when the registry enabling the portrait format is enabled

4.2.1b PO Forms Report - Landscape Format

From 9.1.611.058d and up, a new runtime option "Show Estimated Tax" has been added to the SAMPro Purchase Order. When this option is selected, the fields as defined below will display on the standard landscape Purchase Order. This will also be added to the Purchase Order when printed via the web (standard and SubPO) to ensure compatibility.  
If the Show Estimated Tax box is checked:

1. A line for "Subtotal" will label the current total value (without estimated Tax).

2. Added a new line for Estimated Tax.  Estimated Tax is defined as the sum of the following fields:
Inventory Child Tab = prchseordrlst_tx_cst
General Child Tab = prchseordrlstgn_tx_cst
Subcontractor Child Tab = prchseordrlstsb_tx_cst
Important: The Estimated Tax will only appear on the PO if the Tax Group is completed in the PO header.
3. If the Show Estimated Tax box is selected, a line labeled "Grand Total" will also be printed. This is defined as the subtotal prices + total estimated taxes
NOTE: Portrait PO’s
If your system is set up to print SAMPro PO’s in portrait, the Show Estimated Tax option will appear, but will be ignored when the PO is run in this release.

4.2.2 PO Reorder Advice Report

This report now gets Security from Location/GL Entity/Company/Security links if Intercompany is enabled. Previously the report would always try to pull the Security from the Location. This system report does not need to be imported.

4.3 Purchase Order

Previously for a specific user, the tax was included in average cost stopped being accurate after 2019. As a result of the bug, their inventory item average costs are understated by the 8% tax. This update corrects this defect. 

Previously, the markup price on both the Inventory and General tabs for purchased items was calculated on cost without Use tax when the Income Receipts Journal is used to receive items. If the items are received directly on the Purchase Order, the markup is correctly calculated on cost with use tax. This update corrects this defect. 

Previously, when a user ran the Quote Approval Wizard for a quote where a PO needs to be generated, it would result in an error. This update corrects that defect.

This update prevents users from saving a Purchase Order if a tab mismatch has occurred on the page. This is done to prevent the user from saving data with an error in it, forcing the user to reload the tab and re-enter data.

This update displays the Sales Tax Group from the Job in the PO's header or the Work Order's Job from the PO header. This allows users to easily view their tax group if needed.
New Field: jb.slstxgrp-id-dsply

This release eliminates a sporadic error when saving a PO when Unvouchered A/P box is flagged in the Accounting Period and receipts are made directly on the PO.

When a PO record is loaded or saved, the Job Cost Category will be cleared if a Job is NOT specified on a detail line. This release also tightens Job Cost Category / Job validation.

This release corrects sporadic Tab Mismatch errors encountered when a PO was created or edited  for a foreign currency Vendor (e.g., Currency Id set in the Vendor record).

4.3.0 Replaced PO Warning

The user is now warned when the user first accesses a Purchase Order which has been replaced by one with a higher 'tack' number. This warning is designed to prevent the user from wasting time by attempting to make changes to a journal entry record which cannot be saved because it has already been replaced.  For example, if Purchase Orders are used as controlled documents, the following warning would appear:

WARNING: Purchase Order 123456 has been replaced by 123456-01.

This record cannot be changed.

See Customer Note 4.1.2 for a registry to disable this warning globally or by individual viewer.

4.3.1 Purchase Order Inventory Tab

New Field Magnify View: Billable Quantity
This field supports the scenario where a TechAnywhere technician changes the Billable Quantity of an item so that it will be correctly imported into the Work Order. By default this field is set from the Job Quantity Ordered.  Previously, the Billable Quantity always defaulted from the Job Quantity Ordered when the Work Order's Import Costs button was clicked.

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

The rules regarding allowed Cost Category Selection Types have been changed as follows on this tab:

Purchase Order

Revised Cost Category Rules

Old Cost Category Rules

Inventory Tab

ok: mat, oth, eqp
warning: lab,sub

ok: mat, oth
warning: lab, sub
error: eqp

 

4.3.2 Purchase Order General Tab

New Field Magnify View: Billable Quantity
This field supports the scenario where a TechAnywhere technician changes the Billable Quantity of an item so that it will be correctly imported into the Work Order. By default this field is set from the Job Quantity Ordered.  Previously, the Billable Quantity always defaulted from the Job Quantity Ordered when the Work Order's Import Costs button was clicked.

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

The rules regarding allowed Cost Category Selection Types have been changed as follows on this tab:

Purchase Order

Revised Cost Category Rules

Old Cost Category Rules

General Tab

ok: mat, oth, sub, eqp
warning: lab

ok: mat, oth, sub
warning: lab
error: eqp

 

4.3.3 Purchase Order Subcontractor Tab

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

Changing the Job Cost Category Id now defaults the correct GL Account (from the Cost Category's GL Expense Account) into the line. Previously, the GL Account was only set from the Cost Category when it was first selected.

The Job Cost Category validation now allows Equipment types:

Purchase Order

Revised Cost Category Rules

Old Cost Category Rules

Subcontractor Tab

ok: oth, sub, eqp
warning: mat, lab

ok: oth, sub
warning: mat, lab
error: eqp

New Field  (click Magnify) - Order Details:
This display-only field shows data retrieved from the PO Details table generated by a custom PO Analytic. Validation prevents changes to PO-SUB lines that originated in the PO Analytic and have details stored in the PO Detail table.

4.3.4 Subcontractor Tab Taxes

In this release, the Tax Cost (if applicable) is successfully recomputed when the C.O. Amount is changed on an existing line.

Changed Fields: Tax Cost  - Tax Group Id
If a Tax Group flagged as Job Cost is specified on the Purchase Order header, it will now be used to calculate the Tax Cost on the Subcontractor tab: the committed cost will include the tax.  When the AP journal is recorded, the tax shown in the Subcontractor will be job costed on top of the value, and would debit the expense account and credit the tax payable account. In previous releases, this functionality was only supported on the Inventory and General tabs, and the PO header Job's (or Work Order's Job) Tax Group was incorrectly referenced on the Subcontractor tab.

4.3.5 Purchase Order List

A new sort order, PurchaseOrderByJobIDByDescription has been added.  The Job Id will only appear in the Job Id column if it is completed on the Purchase Order Main. No attempt is made to derive the Job Id from the Work Order (if completed) in the PO header.

The PO's "ordered by" field has been added to the sort option PurchaseOrderByVendorAlphaByIdByDescription after the status column. 

4.3.6 Work Order Sub/PO NTE Warning

In previous releases, If the Work Order's Sub NTE field was completed, a warning was displayed if any of the actual / committed costs on the WO exceeded the Sub NTE. In this release, the message will only be displayed if actual and committed costs associated with PO's (of any kind) exceed the Work Order's Sub/PO NTE value. The message itself has been changed to reflect this:

WARNING:  Work Order has a Sub/PO NTE amount of $ #####
This limit is exceeded by its to-date PO costs (actual+committments) of $ #####

4.3.7 Purchase Order Main Tab

Removed Button:

This top button-bar icon opened the Inventory Receipts Journal with the PO Id specified. It has been replaced by a Main tab button with enhanced functionality.

New Button:

Click the Record Receipt Transaction button to open the Inventory Receipts Journal to receive the items on this Purchase Order. If any items are available for receipt, the system will prompt: "Do you want to fully receive all ordered items?"

Click Yes to auto-receive all items that have not yet been received, the system will receive the items, save the Inventory Receipt, and return to the Purchase Order.

Click No if you wish to manually received the items. You will need to save the receipt manually; you will then be returned to the Purchase Order.

Note that the List button is disabled when the Inventory Receipt is accessed via the PO's Record Receipt TRX button. This validation prevents a runtime error when the Inventory Receipt is accessed in this special manner. Note that existing Inventory Receipts may also be accessed via the PO's IMH tab.  

4.3.8 SubAnywhere PO Processing

Version 9.1.611.056 release correctly prevents PO level cancellation of the PO when a subcontractor line has been vouchered / partially vouchered. This validation was previously only supported for PO's with received or vouchered Inventory or General lines, not dollar-based (subcontractor) PO's.

Previous releases added consistency to whether or not Subcontractor PO's are set to released based on the presence or absence of a password in a tech record flagged as Web Access - Subcontractor and Remote Devise Tab - none. If the Password is set in the Subcontractor Tech record, the PO should be set to Unreleased. Previously only PO's generated in New Call were handled correctly.  In this release, Subcontractor PO's generated from selecting a Subcontractor in TechFinder, and from the Work Order, are also set to Unreleased.

4.3.9 Purchase Order - IMH Tab

Version 9.1.611.056 supports opening the IMH record source (e.g., AP Journal, Inventory Receipts) listed on this tab. Double-click on a line to open the record.

4.4 Start Close Open POs 

This release corrects a problem where this function did not always apply Security to the history reversals lines generated by this function.

This function currently does not support scenarios where a PO has receipts entered in the Inventory Receipts Journal viewer; do so resulted in data being incorrectly updated. In this release, this function now automatically excludes POs that have one or more lines with net IRJ receipts <> zero in case it is inadvertently run where receipts are not exclusively made on the PO.

4.5 Start Generate Purchase Order

This function no longer allows you to create POs for Inactive Vendors. In this release, a list of ineligible Vendors and a message will be displayed when the Checklist appears:

The following vendors are inactive,therefore ineligible for Purchase Order creation.

Vendor 1

Vendor 2 ....

In order to complete the Generate Purchase Orders  function, all Inactive Vendors must be removed as Primary Vendors on any of the Inventory Items listed in the Checklist. If a Vendor was marked Inactive in error, switching them back to Active will allow the function to be run.

4.5.1 Start Generate Purchase Orders - Inventory Cost Includes Tax

This release resolves consistency issues for stock PO's generated via Start Generate PO versus stock PO's created manually under the following scenario:

The global (sys-ffv-global-settings) registry has the option InventoryCostIncludesTax=True

Vendor's Sales Tax Group has tax authority set to Job Cost

Inventory group has cost category set to material

Inventory item has Default Vendor

Creating a PO manually creates a tax cost to the line marked as a tax type of prepaid. Previously, the auto-generated PO has no tax cost and a tax type of n/a.  In this release, Start Generate Purchase Orders also results in Tax Costs going to Inventory and a tax type of prepaid given the above settings.

This release also corrects the inconsistency when the InventoryCostIncludesTax=True registry is set but a Tax Group is NOT in the Vendor record. In this case, manually adding a stock PO and auto-generating one both set the Tax Type Id to (space) n/a.

5 Inventory

5.1 Inventory Registries

5.1.1 Inventory Adjustments: Job Cost Burden Applied to Inventory Costs

SAMPro now provides for an option job cost burden to be applied to inventory costs when Inventory Adjustment Journal transactions are generated. To do so, the Burden Rate % field would be completed in one or both of the following places:

In the Inventory Item record

In the Location Rate record (the Apply Location Burden field must be flagged in the applicable Inventory Item Groups)

In addition, the following registry entry is required to specify the income account to be credited with the burden.

Registry Id: sys-viewer-vinvntryadjstmnt

Setting Key: AppliedBurdenGLAccountId   Setting Value: gl account id

where the Setting Value specifies the GL Income Account that will be credited with the applied burden.

5.1.1a  Registry to Error or Warn if a Completed or Cancelled Work Order is Selected

This registry option enables the user to either warn or error if the Work Order they select is closed (Date Closed is set)  and/or has an Escalation Status of Cancelled. This functionality is supported in the Inventory Adjustment Viewer as well as in the Fill Lines Wizard (when the Next button is clicked).

Id: sys-viewer-vinvntryadjstmnt

Setting Key: ValidateWODateClosed   Setting Value: error or warning

Note that the default value is no validation. Warning will warn the user while error prevents the use of the Work Order.

5.1.2  Registry to Limit Writing to Inventory Vendor Tab to Purchasing Agents

Registry  Id: sys-viewer-vinvntryitm

Setting Key: AllowPriceChangesOnlyByPurchaseAgents

Setting Value: true   (default false)

When the above registry is enabled, the following changes to default behavior will be in effect:

 Inventory Item Viewer Vendors Tab

Only Users flagged as Purchasing Agents are allowed to directly alter the Price field. When a change is made, a secure note will be created, and the Change Date and User Id on the Detail view will be update

Users NOT flagged as Purchasing Agents are not allowed to delete lines, add lines, or insert with copy.  They are allowed to update the Description filed.

Purchase Order Viewer

When this registry is enabled, the Purchase Order will no longer update the Price field on existing line on the Inventory Item's Vendors Tab. When buying an Item from a Vendor for the first time, the PO viewer allows the creation of a new line on the Inventory Item Vendor tab, including the Price field.

This functionality is supported for PO's created from the Purchase Order viewer, QuoteMaster / Quote Manager, Start Generate Purchase Orders, and TechAnywhere.

AP Journal Viewer

When this registry is enabled, the AP Journal will no longer update the Price field on the Inventory Item's Vendors Tab.

5.1.3 Compute Corporate Metrics Registry to Refine Turns Calculation

The following registry may be used to refine the Compute Corporate Metrics logic so that so that if an item’s on-hand quantity is <=0 AND the transaction will reduce the quantity on hand further, the transaction is NOT used in the turns calculation. This change is incorporated in both the Inventory and Inventory By Location computations.

Id: sys-corporate-metrics

Setting Key:  Turns-IncludePositiveOnHandOnly   Setting Value: Yes  (default No)

Any value beginning with 'Y' or 'T' (upper or lower case) will turn this option on.

5.1.4 Inventory Receipt Journal Registry to Deny Over Receiving of Stock Items

The over-receiving 'feature' for items purchased to Stock was added expressly to eliminate the requirement that the PO line had to be changed to match the over-receipt before the IRJ could be recorded. The IRJ posting was made smart enough to make the Qty On Order equal zero in this circumstance.  Thus, the user had no reason to go back and sync the PO Qty Ordered with the IRJ Qty Received. Note that over-receiving it NOT allowed on items purchased to jobs.

However, some users may prefer to not allow the over-receipt of stock items. The following registry may be implemented to allow the current warning on the over-receipt to be changed to an error.

Registry Id: sys-viewer-vinvntryrcpt

Setting Key: AllowOverReceiving   Setting Value:  false  (true is default)

5.1.5 Registry to Create Warnings for Exceeding Quantity / Unit Cost Thresholds in Inventory Adjustments.

Id: sys-viewer-vinvntryadjstmnt  

Setting Key: QuantityNotToExceed   Setting Value: threshold quantity

When this option is set and the quantity entered exceeds the value,  a warning will display: 'Warning: Quantity entered exceeds limit entered in Registry'

Setting Key: UnitCostNotToExceed   Setting Value: threshold cost

When this option is set and the unit cost manually entered exceeds the threshold cost value a warning will display: 'Warning: Unit Cost entered exceeds limit entered in Registry.'

5.2 Inventory Reports

5.2.1 Inventory Receipt Journal - Report Purchasing Packing Slip

New Button:

This button calls a new report, Report Purchasing Packing Slip (RPOPCKNGSLP.rpt). Note that this report must be installed and assigned to the appropriate user groups.

The report shows received items from the purchase order deriving it's data from the inventory receipts journal. If the report is launched from the Inventory Receipt Journal, the input fields Beginning Date / Ending Date and Inventory Receipt Id be automatically completed by the system.  This portrait-style report includes space for a company bitmap (1.25" high by 5.25" wide_. The report includes details such as the Purchase Order Id, Work Order or Job Id (from the PO Main tab Site Name/Address, Date Received. All items received are listed with their quantities received and item description.

Previously in the User Groups record, when filtering to a smaller subset of items and then saving, only the “yes” for the items in the filtered list would save and everything outside of that reverted from “yes” to “no.” This update corrects this defect. 

5.2.2 Stock Status Report

In previous releases, the Report Stock Status excluded entries for locations that have a zero on hand amount (imhstry_qntty_on_hnd - imhstry_qntty_rcvd_jb). As an example, if 0 were on hand but 2 on order for stock, it did not show on the report. In this release, if any of the following columns that are on the report have values that could affect the On Hand amount, then the Location should be shown: On-Hand, Allocated, Cust BO, Shop BO, Reorder and On-Order. Note that this is a system report and does not need to be installed in the system.

This release corrects a minor rounding problem resulting in the sum of individual Location Totals not adding up to All Reported Locations Total. This system report does not need to be imported.

5.3 Inventory Adjustment Journal

This update adds the following popup warning for when a quantity picked is greater than the on-hand quantity to COP Pick Tickets: "Warning: The quantity picked is greater than the quantity ordered. Press OK to continue."
For lot-controlled inventory items, if the quantity picked is greater than the quantity available in the specified lot number, a pop-up warning appears: "The quantity picked exceeds the quantity available in the specified lot number. Press OK to continue."

Validation has been added that ensures that the GL Entities in the From & To lines are for the same company in Adjustment type entries. Validation also checks that the Job/Location entity matches the GL Entity in the From & To lines for Adjustment type entries. This validation was previously added to Loc-to-Loc; Loc-to-Job; Job-to-Loc and Job-to-Job transaction in version 9.1.611.047.

This release properly validates that the From GL Entity is required for Intercompany installations. This corrects an issue where the Security was not always written to IM History on Inventory Adjustments.

This release corrects issues with unbalanced GL entries: extended costs are now correctly rounded instead of being truncated.

When Location adjustments are edited, the GL Account and Entity from the Inventory Item's Group are updated if needed when the Inventory Item is changed.

IM Adjustments Journal viewer: 
Version 9.1.611.059 and up requires the “from” location field to be completed and does not allow any data entered in the job or work order fields. In previous releases, the IM Adjustment Transaction Type did not require a “from” location and allowed data to be entered in the job or work order fields. 

5.3.1 Optional Job Cost Burden Applied to Inventory Costs

SAMPro now provides for an option job cost burden to be applied to inventory costs when Inventory Adjustment Journal transactions are generated. A registry entry (see Customer Note 5.1.1) as required to specify the income account to be credited with the burden.

This functionality is currently supported by the following functions and processes that emulate the journal:

Fill Lines Wizard (button in IM Adjustments Journal parent)

Start Work Order Material Pickup

Start Import Inventory Adjustments (custom)

This functionality will be extended to other records/functions in a future release.

New Field: Material Burden Unit Cost
This display-only field will be calculated by the system when the adjustment involves a Job transfer and

The Inventory Item and/or Location has the Burden Rate % field set

The Inventory Item's Inventory Group has the Apply Location Burden? field checked (and the Location's Burden Rate % field is set)

The calculated unit burden is added to the inventory unit cost for Job History, debits COS and credits the registry set income account (see registry below) when the Inventory Adjustment Journal entry is recorded.

5.3.2  Transfer From / Transfer To Lines

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

Cost Categories with a Selection Cost Type of Equipment or Material are now supported.

Inventory Adjustment Journal

Revised Cost Category Rules

Old Cost Category Rules

lnventory Tab

ok: mat, eqp
error: lab, oth, sub

ok: lab, mat, oth, sub
error: eqp

 

5.4 Inventory Item Record

5.4.1 Pricing/Costing Tab

Changed Field: Unit Cost Average
This release computes an Item's overall Average Unit Cost as the Weighted Average of each Location's Average Unit Cost. The Average Unit Cost for each Location that has quantity on hand > zero will be included; the system will then compute the weighted Average Unit Cost for all Locations. Obsolete Locations cannot be excluded because the date a Location became obsolete is not known.  It is the user's responsibility to clear on hand balances for all Items from each obsolete Location. Previously, the Inventory Item Average Unit Cost was determined via a running total, which could lead to inaccurate results if the cost was entered incorrectly in one or more locations at some point.

New Field: Burden Rate %
If this field is completed, it will be will be used to calculate the Unit Burden Cost in Job History when an Inventory Adjustment Journal entry is created which involves a Job / WO transfer.  If a Burden Rate % is specified in both the Inventory Item and Location Record, the cumulative Burden Rate total will be applied. A registry entry (Customer Note 5.1.1) specifies the income account to be credited.

5.4.2 Locations Tab

New Field - Obsolete:
Obsolete Locations are now displayed at the bottom of the Inventory Item Location tab. The Obsolete flag has been added as a column on the far right of the tab.

5.4.2.a Locations Tab

Changed Fields: Average Cost - Last Cost

In previous releases, loading the Inventory Item viewer suffered poor performance for items that had a history for many Locations.  This was the result of computing the Last and Average Cost for presentation on the Location tab.  

By default  the Average and Last Cost calculation is no longer applied when loading the viewer. To improve performance, the Average and Last Cost will only be calculated on each line when clicking "Show Computation" on the detail view.  The Average and Last Cost columns will display as "Needs Compute" until they are individually computed.

Note that the overall costing information for the Inventory Item is displayed on the Pricing/Costing tab as usual.

The following registry may be enabled to display the Average and Last Costs on the Location tab as in previous releases:

Id: sys-viewer-vinvntryitm

Setting Key: DelayInvItmAvgLastCost   Setting Key: false (default true)

5.4.3 Inventory Item List View

The Inventory Item's Extended Description columns have been added to the InventoryItemByGroupByIDByExtendedName Inventory Item list.

A saved range can be added to enable the user to search on the first Extended Description column: sql=(invntryitm_dscrptn_extndd like '%text%')

5.4.4 BOM Tab

A CVS file is generated by the BOM-CVS button. The column heading for the Master Inventory Item Description has been changed from "Description" to "MasterDescription" to avoid conflict with the Component Inventory Item Descriptions which also has a column heading of "Description".

5.4.5 Inventory Item Purchasing tab

Changed Field - Vendor Id:  
The user is now warned "Purchase Orders cannot be created for Inactive Vendors" if an Inactive Vendor is referenced. The user will not be able to save the record if the Vendor they just selected is Inactive.

New Field: Vendor Status
The Vendor Status (Active, Inactive or Mail List) is now displayed to the right of the Vendor Id.

5.4.6 Inventory Item Availability Tab

Previously when processing a Physical Count, if the quantity for a Lot Controlled Item needed adjusting (up or down), the system would throw a message that the Quantity for Serialized Inventory cannot be greater than 1 and would not let the user continue or leave the field or Save the record. User would have to refresh the viewer and then lose all other quantity adjustments entered.  Now the Physical Count viewer allows for the adjustment of Lot Controlled quantities. 

Previously when a user would adjust the on-hand inventory below -1,000,000, it would cause an error. This update corrects this defect.

The Security Id has been added to the Inventory Item Availability child tab that queries IMH and presents totals by Location for the Item in the viewer to support the use of Security (including Intercompany) and identify the items available for Fill Backorders.

5.4.7 Inventory Item Purchases Tab

In previous releases, if a Vendor's Id/Name were changed, the Inventory Purchases tab continues to display the original values written to history. In this release, this tab has been refined to display the Vendor Id and Name as it is currently set.

5.5 Inventory Group

5.5.1 Job Cost Burden

New Field: Apply Location Burden?
If this field is checked, the Burden Rate % in the Location record will be used to calculate the Unit Burden Cost in Job History when an Inventory Adjustment Journal entry is created which involves a Job / WO transfer. Note that if  a Burden Rate % is specified in both the Inventory Item and Location Record, the cumulative Burden Rate total will be applied. A registry entry (Customer Note 5.1.1) specifies the income account to be credited.

5.6.1 Cost Category

A Cost Category with the Selection Cost Type of Equipment is now supported.

Inventory Group

Revised Cost Category Rules

Old Cost Category Rules

ok: mat, eqp
error: lab,oth,sub

ok: mat
error: eqp, lab, oth, sub

5.6 Location Record

Import Stock Levels:
When the Import Stock Levels button is clicked, the system validates that a valid Location Id is selected.  The user may double-click on the field to select an Id.

LocationItems Tab
The LocationItem tab has been repositioned as a parent tab so that the information on this tab is only assembled/displayed when the tab is clicked. This enhances performance when the user only wishes to access / edit the Main tab when the Location includes a very large number of items.

5.6.1 Job Cost Burden

New Field: Burden Rate %
If this field is completed AND the Apply Location Burden flag is checked in the Inventory Group, it will be will be used to calculate the Unit Burden Cost in Job History when an Inventory Adjustment Journal entry is created which involves a Job / WO transfer.  Note that if  a Burden Rate % is specified in both the Inventory Item and Location Record, the cumulative Burden Rate total will be applied. A registry entry (Customer Note 5.1.1) specifies the income account to be credited.

5.6.2 Special Handling of Obsolete Locations

Changed Field - Obsolete?
In addition to the standard references checking, when a user flags the Obsolete field and saves the record, the system will also check to see if there are any references to this Location exist on the Inventory Item's Locations tab. If Inventory Item Tab entries for this Location are found with 0 quantities (On Hand, On Order, Cust BO, Shop BO, Pick and Rejected) the system will ask if you wish to remove these entries:

'Would you like to remove ** items with zero quantities for this Location from the Inventory Item''s Locations tab?'

If you click Yes these lines will be removed; clicking No retains the Inventory Location lines.

 

5.7 Inventory Receipts Journal

Previously, the unit price for inventory items marked as “Use Price Levels with valid Unit Prices” were being changed to cost times markup/multiplier/margin when received for a Purchase Order using the Inventory receipt journal, which had a direct work order attachment. When the inventory receipt journal was used to receive the items from the PO, the job rate schedule pricing method was used to calculate the unit price (revenue) for the work order when the item’s unit pricing should be used.This only affected builds 9.1.611.057a to 9.1.611.061d. This update corrects this defect. 

Version 9.1.611.056 corrects an issue with missing revenue from PO-GEN lines on Job-based PO's. The Billable quantity is now set from the Job quantity received. In addition, if the global registry InventoryCostIncludesTax is enabled, the system now correctly includes prepaid - use tax when calculating markup on General lines received in the Inventory Receipts Journal.

Prior to this correction, if a PO line description received an edit during Inventory Receipt Journal recording the quantity received evaluation could get confused and prevent "reversal" or undoing of the transaction.

The List button is disabled when the Inventory Receipt is accessed via the PO's Record Receipt TRX button. This validation prevents a runtime error when the Inventory Receipt is accessed in this special manner. Note that existing Inventory Receipts may now be accessed via the PO's IMH tab.   

Auto Set Quantity Received Button: The use of this button is denied if one or more items are flagged as Serialized since the validation to require a serial number is not supported. If any serialized lines are detected, the error message will indicate which lines refer to serialized items.

This release corrects an issue where some general items not referencing an Other Rate wrote to Job History with Labor as the jchstry_type if the Auto Set Quantity Received button was used.

This release refines the precision in used in cost calculations to correct a problem where received POs could not close at AP voucher due to pennies left committed.

Important: Un-receipted lines are no longer displayed to enforce the requirement that a new Inventory Receipt entry must be created to re-receipt items.

This release corrects a sporadic Tab Mismatch error receiving quantities via the Auto Set Qty Rec'd  button.

A warning is now displayed when the user first accesses a Journal entry which has been replaced by one with a higher 'tack' number. This warning is designed to prevent the user from wasting time by attempting to make changes to a journal entry record which cannot be saved because it has already been replaced. See Customer Note 1.1.2 for a registry to disable this warning globally or by individual viewer.

Changed Field: Cost Category

The Job Cost Category validation now allows Equipment Selection Cost Types. The Cost Category field is display-only and is set from the Purchase Order.

Inventory Receipts Journal

Revised Cost Category Rules

Old Cost Category Rules

Receipts Tab

ok: mat, oth, sub, eqp
warning: lab

ok: mat, oth, sub
warning: lab
error: eqp

5.7.1 New Tab: Summary

PO Id:  Vendor Id:  Tax Group Id:
These display-only fields default from the Purchase Order's Main tab. Note that the Tax Group Id will only be completed if it is completed in the Purchase Order's Main tab.

Subtotal:
This field displays the expected Vendor Invoice cost total based on this Inventory Receipt.

Tax:
This field displays the tax anticipated to be assessed on vendor's invoice from this Inventory Receipt. This field will ONLY be completed if a Sales Tax Group with "job costed" authorities exists on the Purchase Order Main Tab.  If a Tax Group is not specified on the PO Main Tab, or if one is specified but it is NOT "job costed", this field will NOT display the calculated tax.

Total:
Displays the Subtotal + anticipate Tax (if calculated),

5.7.2 Registry to Disable Summary Tab

This tab may be disabled via the following registry if the cost summary should not be displayed for security reasons. When this registry is in place, the Main tab will be displayed, but the Summary tab will not.

Id: sys-viewer-vinvntryrcpt

Setting Key: ParentTabs  Setting Value: Main

5.7.3 Re-Receiving a Serialized Item

In previous releases, if a serialized item was received and then unreceived, its serial number could not be reused. In this release, the following procedure may be employed to re-receive a serialized item:

1. Access the View Lot Master record for the serialized item to be re-received.

Verify that the Quantity on Hand = 0.

Change the Lot Status to Reuse S/N.

Save the record.

2. Create a new Inventory Receipt entry to re-receive the item. You will be warned that the serial number already existed but you will be allowed to save the Inventory Receipt.

5.7.4 Receipts Tab

Description:
Prior to this correction, if a PO line description received an edit during Inventory Receipt Journal recording the quantity received evaluation could get confused and prevent "reversal" or undoing of that receipt transaction.

5.8 Start Import IM Adjustments

Purpose:

Used to import Inventory Adjustment entries from a Database table or a csv file. The import file can be created by a custom barcode program that writes to a database table or manually entered in a spreadsheet.  

Usage:

When this function is run, the date effective (from the .cvs file or database table) is used to get a valid Accounting Period which includes that date. If no valid Accounting Period is found,  an error message 'Effective date has no valid Accounting Period' is displayed and the adjustment will be rejected.

Range Screen:

Import From: Database - Text CSV File

Choose whether you will be importing from a database table or a csv file.

If you choose to import from a table, the checklist will appear with available (unposted) transactions.

If you choose to import from a csv file, you will browse and choose the file and the checklist will appear.

Select the transactions to be posted and hit Go.

A message will display when the import is complete.  

If there are failed transactions, a file containing those transactions will be created and the location of the file will be displayed in a message box.  The Email-to address define in the registry will also receive an email.  A user needs to go to that file and fix the errors which will be noted in the file.

The user should then run the manual function selecting the csv file, and browse to and choose the fixed file.

Start Import IM Adjustments (Automated) may be used to run this function as a scheduled event:  

Spreadsheet Format:

The import expects a header row; the file must be comma delimited. The specifications are as follows:

Date - date(10) (if blank today's date) format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Transaction Type  - char(10) values Loc-to-Loc, Loc-to-Job, Job-to-Job, Job-to-Loc
Inventory Item      - char(30)
Serial Number      - char(30) (If the use serialized inventory)
Quantity              - decimal (12,6)
Unit Cost             - decimal (10,3) (ill default from SAMPro if empty
From-Workorder    - char(10)
From-Job              - char(15)
From-JobCostCode  - char(30)
From-JobBillItem    - char(15)
From-CostCategory - char(15)
From-Location        - char(10)
To-Workorder         - char(10)
To-Job                  - char(15)
To-JobCostCode    - char(30)
To-JobBillItem       - char(15)
To-CostCategory  - char(15)
To-Location          - char(10)

Database Table Format:

If the import is from a database table, see your Support Rep for assistance.

Registry:

Id: sys-start-simprtimadjstmnt

This registry is used by both Start Import IM Adjustments and Start Import IM Adjustments (Automated).

Importing from a Database Table:

Setting Key: UseDataBase   Setting Value: true (default is false)  

Use this if you will be importing the entries from a database table.

Importing from a Spreadsheet:

Setting Key: csvfile   Setting Value: filename

Specifies the filename to import. This option is required for Start Import IM Adjustments (Automated).

Setting Key: importDirectory   Setting Value: directory with import file

Specifies the default directory containing the import file. If an import fails, the system will also use this directory to deposit the failed entry information. This option is required for Start Import IM Adjustments (Automated) and recommended for Start Import IM Adjustments.

Email Failed Records:

Setting Key: email-to   Setting Value: email address

Setting Value: email-from  Setting Value: email address

The system will automatically email failed record information to the email-to address if the above options are set. Note that both the email-to and email-from entries must be set. In Version 9.1.611.058, if there are failed transactions, the file containing those transactions will be emailed to the user defined via registry.  Previously, the file was saved and the location of the file was noted in the email.  

5.9 View Inventory Restock List

This function now sets the Inventory History Security for Intercompany databases. It also prevents selecting the To and From Locations from different Companies.  

Restock Pick List Report: This report is now ordered by the Bin/Location and then the Inventory Id. The Transaction Id and Date Printed has been added to the report.

5.9.1 Item Tab

New Fields

Stocked:
This display field will be checked if the Item is flagged as a Stocked Item.

Reorder Level:  Order Up To:
These fields display the current Reorder Level and Order Up To quantities in the Restock To Location.

Inventory Item Name:
This display-only field has been added to help users confirm their stocking list.

5.10 Inventory Adjustments Journal

Additional validation has been added to this viewer to prevent incorrectly entered 'Adjustment' transaction types from generating out of balance GL and/or Job History entries.

When a line is copied and the Inventory Id is changed, the Tax Cost will be re-evaluated for Use Tax jobs.  Previously, the Tax Cost was not recomputed from the line it was copied from.

This release corrects a rounding issue that caused the amount expensed/relieved from inventory to differ from Intercompany transactions.

This function now supports the 'creation' of serialized item records (via an Adjustment entry) for Intercompany users.  

This release corrects posting to GLH if single company Intercompany is enabled. Previously, this posting was only correct if the AppliedBurdenGLAccountId was enabled.  

5.10.1 Adding Serial Items

This release corrects the validation so that Serial Numbers can be added from an Adjustment both for Intercompany (where the "To" line's GL Entity is completed) and non-Intercompany (where the GL Entity should be blank). Note that the following registry must be enabled to allowed the addition of serial items:

Id: sys-viewer-vinvntryadjstmnt

Setting Key: CreateNewSerialNumber  Setting Value: true

When this registry is enabled, the adjustment would be made with the Location on the 'To' line completed. The GL Entity would be required on the 'To' line if Intercompany was enabled.   

Note that the following procedure must be used to create the Item.

1.Enter the Period Id and Effective Date, and set the Entry Type to ‘Adjustment’.
2. Enter the Inventory Item Id of the serialized item.
3. If the number does not exist, click Yes to create it.
4. Enter a Quantity of 1 and the appropriate Unit Cost.
5. Select the ‘To’ Location where you want the new Serial item to be created. The GL Entity should default for Intercompany installations; the GL Account must NOT be entered.
6. When you save the journal entry, the new item will be available at that Location.

5.10.2 Intercompany Validation

Validation has been added that ensures that the GL Entities in the From & To lines are for the same company in Adjustment type entries. Validation also checks that the Job/Location entity matches the GL Entity in the From & To lines for Adjustment type entries. This validation was previously added to Loc-to-Loc; Loc-to-Job; Job-to-Loc and Job-to-Job transaction in version 9.1.611.047.

5.11 View Inventory Physical Count

This release corrects an error when the Load on Hand button was clicked if serialized items were brought in.   

The Inventory module must be enabled in order to access this function.

5.12 Return Authorization

This viewer now supports Intercompany Security; the Company's Security is correctly written to inventory history.

5.13 Inventory History

This release corrects an issue where just changing the Work Order Name could cause a reversal and forwarding of gl and inventory history entries using the original items date effective and accounting period (even if the accounting period was closed). 

6 Accounts Receivable

6.1 Accounts Receivable Registries

6.1.1 AR Cash Receipts Journal - Set GL Entity for Intercompany Installations

If Intercompany is enabled, the balance sheet GL Entity is not 'sticky'. Customer Note 1.14 details the new registries for setting the Default Balance Sheet Entity for this journal or globally.

6.1.1a AR Cash Receipts Journal - Force GL Bank Account from Payment Type

The following registries may be enabled to force the GL Bank Account to be set from the corresponding field in the Payment Type record. When the following registries are set:

1. Do not allow user to manually enter a GL Bank Account Id.

2. Do not allow transaction to save without a Payment Type Id.

3. Always default GL Bank from selected Payment Type.

Id: sys-viewer-varrcptslst

Setting Key: BankGLFromPaymentType   Setting Value: true (default false)

Always set the Bank GL Account from the Payment Type.

Setting Key: RequiredFieldsParent    Setting Value: pymnttype.id

Require that the Payment Type is set.

Setting Key: DisabledFieldsParent   Setting Value: gl-bnk: glaccnt.id

Disable manual entry to the GL Bank Account field to prevent the user from attempting to do so and getting an error.

Important: If credit card processing is enabled the specified Payment Type must have the Bank GL Account field set. Preferably, all active Payment Type records should have the Bank GL Account field set.

6.1.2 AR Sales Journal - Set GL Entity for Intercompany Installations

If Intercompany is enabled, the balance sheet GL Entity is not 'sticky'. Customer Note 1.14 details the new registries for setting the Default Balance Sheet Entity for manual entries in this journal or globally.

6.1.2a AR Sales Journal Registry - Require Work Order for Service Compute Jobs

Jobs indicated as "Service Compute" get billed by the Work Order, yet we allow costs to be entered and posted to Jobs w/o reference to any specific work order, leaving these unbilled costs in limbo. This feature may be activated to warn or error if a Work Order is not specified for Jobs flagged as 'Service Compute' when manual entries are recorded.

Note: This setting may also be made globally in the sys-ffv-global-settings registry. If so, the local setting by Journal will trump the global entry.

Registry Id: sys-viewer-varslslst

Setting Key: NeedWOInServiceComputeJobs  Setting Value: Error, Warning or Neither (default Neither)

When the Setting Value is set to Error, the user will be alerted when leaving a line lacking a Work Order Id and will not be able to save the record. Note that implementing Error on an existing system impacts your ability to edit existing entries. It should be implemented with caution.

When Warning is implemented, the user will be alerted when leaving a line lacking a Work Order Id but will be able to save the record.

If Neither is implemented (or the registry option does not exist) the user will not be alerted if a Service Compute type Job lacks a Work Order reference.

6.1.3 OpenEdge / Global Payments Credit Card Processing - Option to use DBXChange Payfields Portal

Previously, the UserID column in Open Edge did not populate in reports due to OpenEdge integration no longer supporting their 'User Defined' fields through their new APIs.
The following updates have been added to the following fields:

User ID: Provides SAMPro or TechAnywhere User ID depending on if it is created via SAMPro or TechAnywhere
Invoice Number: Customer Notes:  Provides invoice numbers for TechAnywhere, cash receipts for single and multiple invoice, and Create PM Billing Adjustments.

Previously, when a client used USAePay to negative credit card charge (credit), the processor was posting it as a positive charge against the credit card account. This update corrects this defect and negative credit card charges will now be a credit.

By default, SAMPro's interface with OpenEdge / Global Payments continues to be managed by OpenEdge's X-Web portal. However,  this functionality will ultimately be sun-setted. The following registries are required to use DBXchange instead to PayFields portal for OpenEdge transactions (TechAnywhere already uses this functionality).

The following registry entries are required to run OpenEdge with the new Payfields portal; we recommend running this in your test system first. Note that company-specific registries may be made if needed. Data-Basics' DBXchange will be used in conjunction with an updated version of SAMPro Secure Communication. Please contact Data-Basics Support for assistance with the installation. Note that company-specific registries may be made if needed.  

The registry to control whether the old vs new portal is used is the sys-ffv-global-setting's defaultpaymentprocessor. To use the new Open Edge portal it must be OEDBX. To use the old portal they should either leave it blank or use OE (as it has always been in the past).

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: defaultpaymentprocessor  Setting Value: OEDBX  (OE or blank uses the old portal)

If the value is blank or OE the old X-Web portal will be used.  If the new Payfields portal (hosted on DBXChange) the Setting Value should be OEDBX.

The following registry entries are required to run OpenEdge with the new Payfields portal (hosted on DBXChange). Note that company-specific registries may be made if needed. They should be used if the global settings registry defaultpaymentprocessor is set to OEDBX.

Id: sys-payment-processor

Id: sys-payment-processor-company:CompanyId  

For example, the OpenEdge payment processor registry for Company 01 is:  sys-payment-processor-company:01

To set up for Company-Specific processing, the Company-specific registries could contain either  

All required options for sys-payment-processor  

Or only the options that distinguish the companies, with the remaining settings in the basic directories (sys-payment-processor

New Settings for OEDBX:

Setting Key: Auth   Setting Value: EncryptedValue From DBXchange Inspector

OpenEdge will supply an Auth Key, Terminal ID, and Merchant ID. These values must be entered in the DBXchange Inspector application for encrypting into 1 value for Auth. There is also a Live or Test option to select to decide which OpenEdge environment to point to.

Setting Key: content-type  Setting Value: application/json

 

Existing Settings  which may need to be changed:

Setting Key: directory   Setting Value: paymentProcessing

Note that this subdirectory MUST EXIST on the main SAMPro directory containing the SAMPro executable. A list of payment results will be written to this directory.  

Setting Key: paymentProcessor   Setting Value: SamproSecureCommunication/SSL

Value is defaulted to SamproSecureCommunication/SSL if not set

Setting Key: server   Setting Value: Server Hosting SamproSecureCommunication

The internal IP address or name of the web server hosting your SAMPro Secure Communication.

Setting Key: port   Setting Value: Server Port Hosting SamproSecureCommunication

The TCP/IP port of the web server hosting your SAMPro Secure Communication.

Setting Key: WebSiteName   Setting Value: Full URL to your web hosted DBXchange

Ex. http://SERVER:8080/dbxchange

Ex. https://192.168.1.100:8181/dbxchange

Setting Key: PMBillingPaymentCode  Setting Value: PaymentTypeId

It is recommended that you create a new Payment Type record with the Id set to OpenEdge or CRDCRD and the GL Bank Account set to the appropriate bank or sweep account for OpenEdge Payments. This will be used for recurring payment processing for preventative maintenance.

Obsolete Settings: these registries should be disabled or for the New Portal (OEDBX):

Setting Key: merchantId   Setting Value: IdProvidedByOpenEdge
Setting Key: XWebId   Setting Value: IdProvidedByOpenEdge
Setting Key: AuthKey   Setting Value: KeyProvidedByOpenEdge
Setting Key: terminalID   Setting Value: IdProvidedByOpenEdge
Setting Key: SpecVersion   Setting Value: XWeb3.5 or as specified by OpenEdge
Setting Key: SpecVersionAliasPayment  Setting Value:  XWebSecure3.5 or as specified by OpenEdge
Setting Key: URL    Setting Value:  https://gw.t3secure.net/x-chargeweb.dll
Setting Key: Industry   Setting Value: MOTO  

User Interface Changes:

End users will notice a different user interface when specifying and alias or processing a payment.  Instead of the Open Edge X-Web portal appearing, the Payfield portal hosted on DBXChange will appear, as shown below. The user will simply enter the credit card number, expiration date, CVV code and then click the Submit button.  Note that the Country field (defaulted from the ZIP or Postal Code) is required for a successful submission.

In 9.1.611.059 and up, this release allows a smoother procedure in OpenEdge Processing when the User Id contains a space.

6.1.4 Registry Id to Enable Intercompany support for OpenEdge / Global Payments Processing

This release supports Company-specific functionality for OpenEdge / Global Payments processing. A new  Interco v.cus file must be installed (which includes the Company Id on Start Create PM Billing) and Company-specific registry settings must be created to support this functionality. If all Companies will be using the same settings only the base registry is needed.

These Company-specific registries are identified by a special suffix on the Registry Id to define that the Company Id is being referenced.  The general form of the suffix is:

Id: sys-payment-processor-company:CompanyId  

For example, the Open Edge payment processor registry for Company 01 is:  sys-payment-processor-company:01

To set up for Company-Specific processing, the Company-specific registries could contain either

All required options for sys-payment-processor

Or

Only the options that distinguish the companies, with the remaining settings in the basic directories (sys-payment-processor).  

6.1.5 AR Terms Processing To Enable Decimal Places in The Discount Percent

The AR Terms Discount % field is an integer field that did not support fractional percentage amounts (e.g., 1.5%) by default. This release supports a registry setting to implement an implied Decimal Place in the AR Terms Discount % Field which will allow the user to specify one (e.g, 10.5%) or two (e.g., 7.25%) decimal places.

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: ARTermsDecimals   Setting Value: 1 or 2  (default is 0 - registry absent)

IMPORTANT: Reset the AR Terms Discount Percent After Entering the Registry and Logging In Again
The user MUST review all AR Terms records and reset the Discount percent as needed after entering the Registry and logging in again. If the registry was set to 1, for example, an AR Discount previously set to 7.00 would now be changed to 0.70% and must be manually adjusted as needed.

AR Terms Viewer - Changed Field: Discount Percent
The AR Terms viewer now displays the Discount Percent as 000.00 but validation will prevent setting the decimal places unless the above registry is set. Validation also controls the hundreds / tens settings (XX0.00) in AR Terms when the registry is set.

6.2 Accounts Receivable Reports

6.2.1 Report AR Aging

The DARAGE report (drill down aging) currently uses the Branch specified in the Client Site (of the COP order) for filtering COP orders. The revised report date 2017-09-19 uses the branch specified in the COP order itself and if blank steps defers to the Branch specified in the Site.

The revised report dated 2017-09-18 now includes logic to get the customer's PO# from the Job if PO is blank in Invoice Master or on the Work Order. This corrects a problem where the PO# was not always shown for RININV3 Invoices.

The revised Report AR Aging (DARAGE.rpt) dated 2016-04-05 now gets the PO from the Work Order if the PO is blank in the invoice. It also supports the following enhancements:

New Option: Show Collection Notes

New Option: Age By - Invoice Date - Date Due
Previously, this report always aged by the Invoice Date.  The user may now select the option to age by the Date Due instead.

New Range: GL Entity Id
This range allows the user to filter within AR Control Accounts

6.2.2 Report Customer Statement  (RCUSTSTMNTv80b048.rpt)

New Field: Print Statements With Balance Over
The revised report dated 2017-11-15 replaces the Print Zero Balance Statements option with a Print Statements With Balance Over option. By default, this field is blank (zero) so that only positive balance statements will be generated. If a user wants to include zero balance statements they would enter $.01- in the Print Statements with Balance Order field. If a user wants to include credit balance statements they would enter $99999.99- (or some negative value) in the new input field.

The revised report dated 2017-10-06 prints the consolidated invoice description for consolidated invoices.

Report revised 2016-06-16 adds an option to Omit Invoice Description.

This also supports an option to include the PDF'd invoices referenced on the statement as part the PDF version of the statement report. Both job/service based invoices (document category INVOICE) and COP Invoices (document category COPINVOICE) will be included.

If invoices were not originally saved as PDF's, the Start Document Archive Maintenance function may be used to convert these document types to PDF.

Important:  Only the PDF'd Statement Includes the Attachments
The .dbr version of the Customer Statement will not display the attached invoices; it does display a list of attached files. Only the PDF'd version of this report includes the 'package' of invoice attachments.

Required File:

A whitesquare.bmp file (available from support) should be added to the directory where your bitmap graphics are stored.

Required Registry:

Id: sys-report-rcuststmnt  

Setting Key: IncludeInvoiceDocuments   Setting Value: Y    (default N)

This option is required to implement the new ' invoice package' functionality.

Setting Key: sectionbackerbitmap   Setting Value: Pathname\whitesquare.bmp

This registry is recommended to prevent the invoice bitmap from 'stepping on' the attached documents. The bitmap may be obtained from support. Note that ONLY the bmp version of this file should be installed.

Additional Registries:

These reports support auto emailing.  The appropriate registry entries should be made to implement this functionality if invoice documents are included:

Setting Key: emailbysection  Setting Value: true

Setting Key: autoemail  Setting Value: true  

6.2.2b Client Status

The revised report (RCUSTSTMNTb80v048.rpt) dated 2016-08-26 includes the following new features:

New Range: Client Status
This field defaults to Active so to limit this reports to Client with an Active status. It is recommended that this range remains set to Active if the Print Zero Balance Statements? field is flagged. Setting the Range to Active,Credit Hold will include both Active Customers and those on Credit Hold on the report.

There is a registry associated with this report that controls the text that appears when a zero balance statement shows on the report. By default, 'Zero Dollar Statement' will appear. The following registry overrides this default.

Id: sys-report-RCUSTSTMNT

Setting Key: ZeroBalanceText

Setting Value: Text to appear on report    (100 Character Maximum)

Also adds an option to Omit Invoice Description

6.2.2c Revised Report Customer Statements (RCUSTSTMNTv80b048.rpt dated 2020-10-02 or later)

New Detail Option: By Site By Job

New Filter: Site Id

Replace: Omit Description: Y/N with Invoice Description:  Yes or No or PO#

Important Note - Scheduled Reports: The change to the Invoice Description setting from Boolean to Button has potential to interfere if the prior definition is scheduled as a recurring report. In this case, the scheduled event for the report simply requires "updating" under Scheduling options.

6.2.3 Report Customer Statements 2 (RCUSTSTMNT2.rpt)

The revised report dated 2016-08-15 includes the following new features:

New Field: Print Zero Balance Statements?
Flagging this field enables the user to print a zero balance statement for the selected client or clients on this report.  Clients with a total outstanding dollar balance in AR History equal to zero will be included on the report, subject to the setting of the other ranges.

New Range: Client Status
This field defaults to Active so to limit this reports to Client with an Active status. It is recommended that this range remains set to Active if the Print Zero Balance Statements? field is flagged. Setting the Range to Active,Credit Hold will include both Active Customers and those on Credit Hold on the report.

There is a registry associated with this report that controls the text that appears when a zero balance statement shows on the report. By default, 'Zero Dollar Statement' will appear. The following registry overrides this default.

Id: sys-report-RCUSTSTMNT2

Setting Key: ZeroBalanceText

Setting Value: Text to appear on report    (100 Character Maximum)

6.2.4 Report Credit Card Expiration for OpenEdge / EPI Users

This new report (RCCEXPRTN.rpt) dated 2016-10-10 is designed to alert users to upcoming Credit Card expiration dates in the Client Site for payment processing. The report lists the Site Id and Name, Contact Name and Phone Number, Masked Credit Number and Expiration Date for each Site with an expired Credit Card.

Start Date:   End Date:
At least one of this fields must be completed.

If the Credit Card Expiration Date falls on or after the Start Date, the Site will be included on the report.  

If the Credit Card Expiration Date falls on or before the End Date, the Site will be included on the report.

Client Site Id:  Account Manager:
These ranges permit Sites to be filtered by the Site Id or Account Manager.

6.2.5 Report Credit Card Expiration for Master Contract

This report  (RCCEXPRTNMSTR.rpt) is designed to alert users to upcoming Credit Card expiration dates in the Master Contract for payment processing. The report lists the Master Contract Id and Description and the associated Masked Credit Number and Expiration Date for each Master Contract with a Credit Card Payment Alias.

Start Date:   End Date:
At least one of these fields must be completed.

If the Credit Card Expiration Date falls on or after the Start Date, the Master Contract will be included on the report.  

If the Credit Card Expiration Date falls on or before the End Date, the Master Contract will be included on the report.

Master Contract Id:  Account Manager:
These ranges permit Sites to be filtered by the Master Contract Id or Account Manager.

6.2.6 Report AR Cash Receipts Journal Receipt

This report supports the new Print button in the AR Cash Receipts Journal. This button allows the user to print and email a receipt to the customer for the credit card payment processed from this viewer.  The following report must be installed to support this functionality:

New Report:  Report AR Cash Receipts Journal Receipt (RARRCPTSTCKT.rpt)  

This new report is designed for use with Credit Card processing.  A registry entry for the report may be used to specify a general or header graphic at the top of the report.

The report will display the Client's Name and Address, Date Paid and Payment Type. The Invoice Number, Invoice Date, Invoice Amount, Amount Paid and Balance Due and Total.

If the user clicks the Email button from the Report display, the Email To will automatically be set to the Client Contact Email address. The report will be attached and the Email's Subject will use the following format:

Cash Receipt Id 10230 was paid using Payment Processing with Id 000000007768

6.2.6a Revised Report AR Cash Receipts Journal Receipt

The Revised Report AR Cash Receipts Journal Receipt (RARRCPTSTCKT.rpt) dated 2021-04-19 includes the following enhancements:

Support for Credit Memos
Refinement when Receipt date precedes Invoice date
Supports multiple applications to the same invoice on same day and additional refinements.

6.2.7 Report Lien Waiver Fillable (AR)

SAMPro's new Fillable Form functionality allows an AR Lien Waiver to generated as a fillable PDF.  This uses the boilerplate information included in a standard AR Lien Waiver to be combined with the information from SAMPro to quickly and easily generate the document. This Lien Waiver may then be emailed to the customer when payment is received. The Conditional option of the report indicates the current payment on the Job, and allows disputed amounts to be identified.  The Final option provides the formal release of the lien in and would be provided when the work is complete and all payments have been received.

Important: Note that this feature requires use of the XmlToPdf[2019-01-16 Java 8-11].jar file (or higher). 

The following tasks are support the above functionality:

1. The Report Lien Waiver Fillable (AR) must be installed.

2. The following Registry must be implemented:

Id: sys-report-RLNWVRFLLBLEAR

Setting Key: autosavefiletype   Setting Value: PDF

Setting Key: autosavefilename   Setting Value: =^sectionkeyvalue^,^date^,^time^

The ^sectionkeyvalue^ token consists of the Job Id-Invoice Id followed by the type of waiver specified when the report is run (conditional or final). In this example, the sectionkey is followed by a date and time stamp; if the date and time tokens are not included, a registry to allow autosaveoverwrite should be added.

Setting Key: autosavebysection Setting Value: true

This option is used to save the report sections as individual files.

Setting Key: autosavedirectory Setting Value: path   

Where path is replaced by full path to the existing directory that you want your reports stored in.

Setting Key: fillableform   Setting Value: true

Required for fillable forms.

Setting Key: sectionfillableform  Setting Value: true

Required for fillable forms to be generated by section.

Setting Key: sectionfillableformflatten  Setting Value: Y

This optional setting allows the PDF to be 'flattened' so that it may not be edited after creation.

Setting Key: FillableFormPathConditionalProgress

Setting Value: path\ConditionalWaiverAndReleaseOnProgressPayment.pdf

This entry provides the full path to the pdf template used for the conditional waiver and release.

Setting Key: FillableFormPathConditionalFinal  

Setting Value: path\ConditionalWaiverAndReleaseOnFinalPayment.pdf

This entry provides the full path to the pdf template used for the final waiver and release.

Do Not Open PDF

Setting Key: showdocumentfillableform   Setting Value: false (default true)

If this registry entry is not in place,  clicking the Fillable Form  button to generate the formatted, PDF version of the report will open the PDF. If the following registry is in place his, the PDF will be created but not opened.

3. The template PDF files must be located in the directory specified by the Setting Values above. Sample templates may be obtained from Data-Basics.  The text and signature graphic of the Claimant may be adjusted as needed.

Important: Be sure that the sample template is approved for your state; some states require a notary. The individual/attorney responsible for Lien Waivers at your firm should carefully review the proposed template before it is implemented.

Running The Report Lien Waiver Fillable (AR)

Usage:

A Job needs to be marked as Lien Waiver Required to be included on this report.

The Through Date on the Conditional Progress Payment form is populated from the Job record's Billed Through Date.

The following information from the database will be used when you when you run the report:

Name of Claimant and Check Payable To: CompanyName (from the Company record (multicompany) or the companyname registry

Name of Customer and Maker of Check: Client Name

Job Location: Site Address

Amount of Check: Net Invoice

Additional fields will be completed on the report range screen as listed below.

Important Fields:

Beginning Date: Ending Date:
This Date range must include the Date Invoiced of the invoice to be included on the report.

Lien Waiver Limit:
The Invoice Amount of the Invoice the waiver is being issued for needs to be greater than or equal the  Lien Waiver Limit.

Owner:
Enter the property Owner's name as it should be printed on the report.

Claimant Title:
The Claimant's title in your Company as it should appear on the report. This will appear below the Claimant's Signature when the fillable form is generated.

Conditional Progress - Date(s) of Waiver and Release
Enter the appropriate date(s) as they should appear on the Conditional version of the report.

Conditional Progress - Unpaid Progress Payments
Enter the total Amount Unpaid as it should appear on the Conditional version of the report.

Conditional Final - Document Does Not Affect the Following
Description of any exceptions, i.e. "C.O.'s 1 thru 3".

Conditional Final - Disputed Claims for Extras
Total amount of disputed claims.

Lien Waiver: Conditional Progress  -  Conditional Final

Select Conditional Progress if the Job is partial billed.

Select Conditional Final if the Job if final billed.

 Click the Go button to start the report.

Report Viewer

When the report is first run, the information that will be inserted in the fillable form template will appear.

If the information that appears in the report preview appears correct, click the Fillable Form button to generate the formatted, PDF version of the report. The PDF will be displayed when it has been opened (unless disabled via registry).

6.2.8 New Report Customer Statements 3

The new Report Customer Statements 3 (RCUSTSTMNT3.rpt) created 2021-03-24 is based on the existing Customer Statement report but includes the customer's PO number (based on WO or Job or Client Order accordingly) on the detail lines as the standard. The following fields are displayed on the detail lines:

Invoice Id - PO - Invoice Date - Amount Owed - Age - Due Date - Amount Past Due - Days Past - Description

Like the original Report Customer Statements report, Report Customer Statements 3 supports the 'packaging' of PDF'd invoices and TechAnywhere receipts (specified as runtime options/via registry) as well as auto-emailing (enabled via registry).  This report uses the Client Id as the sectionkey and the Client Collections Email Address for auto-emailing.

6.3 AR Cash Receipts Journal

Previously when processing a negative payment and using a payment alias, a text window would appear indicating that "an error occurred" even though the response was Approved. This update corrects this defect. 

Previously, when processing a credit card payment and a user closed out of the AR Cash Receipts screen or exited SAMPro before the process was complete, returning and completing the process would result in two transactions for the client and one transaction in SAMPro. This update prevents the viewer from closing while the payment is processing and removes the Cancel button from the progress bar.

This update gives users permission to make field changes and delete child lines for saved records with processed payments. With the enabled registry, this allows the user to zero out the A/R child rows for "incorrect" invoices and insert the new rows with the "correct" invoices, so long as the total against the processed payment matches. 
Note: If the wrong amount was processed, the users must refund the CC transaction and reprocess it.

Id: sys-viewer-varrcptslst

Setting Key: AllowChangeToProcessedReceipt    Setting Value: true

This release corrects a problem where invoices with non-intercompany security did not load when Client Id was entered and the user tabbed out of the field. This release also refines the "autofill" AR Cash Receipt logic regarding Other Tab entries so that appropriate enters will be available for the Bank Deposit Journal.

This release tightens Job Cost Category / Job validation.

A warning is now displayed when the user first accesses a journal entry which has been replaced by one with a higher 'tack' number. This warning is designed to prevent the user from wasting time by attempting to make changes to a journal entry record which cannot be saved because it has already been replaced. See Customer Note 1.1.2 for a registry to disable this warning globally or by individual viewer.

The 'Receipts Entered' field is correctly updated when lines on the Other Tab are added or deleted.

6.3.1 AR Lines

Credit Card Processing: Edits and deletions to AR lines for Credit Card paid entries are not allowed for Full users. Only Special (support) users are allowed to edit or delete. 

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field (for example, when entering an Unapplied Deposit).  The full relationship is validated again when saving the record.

6.3.2 OpenEdge Credit Refunds

Edits and deletions to AR lines for Credit Card paid entries are not allowed for Full users. Only Special (support) users are allowed to edit or delete. However, Credit refunds may now be processed via Open Edge in the Cash Receipts Journal. To do so:

1. Select a Credit Memo in the AR Cash Receipts Journal, and enter the Total Receipt as a negative number.

2. Verify that the customer has their credit card ready, and then click the Process Payment button.

3. Click through the usual messages; when the x-web portal opens, enter the customer's credit card number (without spaces or dashes) and expiration date and click Submit.

4. If the card is approved, the web portal will display "Approval" in red and the customer's card will be credited with the refund.  If it is not approved, check the number and expiration date and try submitting it again.

Previously, when Open Edge used USAePay to negative credit card charge (credit) was sent to the processor, the processor was posting it as a positive charge against the credit card account. The 9.1.611.062 update corrects this defect and negative credit card charges will now be a credit.

6.3.2a Allow Client Site Aliases to be Used for AR Cash Receipts

When an Invoice or Invoices have been selected for payment, the following will now happen when the Process Payments button is clicked:

Determine the Client Site associated with each Invoice that has been selected for payment in the transaction being recorded.

If an eligible alias token is NOT found, SAMPro will simply display a message reminding you that you will only have 60 seconds to enter the information; click Yes to continue.  

If one or more Aliases are found, the system will display a list of the eligible Payment Alias/Token values found in the above list of Sites.  To be eligible, a Site's Alias/Token must have an expiration date greater than or equal to the current system date. 

If No Selection is highlighted and the Select button clicked SAMPro will display a message reminding you that you will only have 60 seconds to enter the information; click Yes to continue.  Another message informs you that the journal entry will be added before Payment Processing; click Yes again.  

If an existing Alias is highlighted and the Select button clicked, the system will send the information to Open Edge; if approved, the Credit Card fields will be completed and the Cash Receipt saved.

If the Cancel or red X button is clicked, the list will be closed SAMPro will display a message reminding you that you will only have 60 seconds to enter the information; click Yes to continue or Cancel to opt out of the payment processing.

6.3.2b Print Credit Card Receipt

If the Report AR Cash Receipts Journal Receipt is installed, clicking this button launches the receipt report for the credit card payment processed in this entry. When the Email button is clicked in the Report display, the Email To will automatically be set to the Client Contact Email address. The report will be attached and the Email's Subject will use the following format: Cash Receipt Id 10230 was paid using Payment Processing with Id 000000007768.

6.3.3 Unapplied Deposits

When an Unapplied Deposit is entered in the AR Cash Receipts journal, the Invoice Master fields are now set as follows:

Currency Id: Defaults from the Client; this field was previously blank.

Effective Date: Defaults from the Cash Receipt's Effective Date; this field was previously blank.

Entry Type: Now set to Unapplied; it was previously set to Unknown

Status: This is now set to Posted; it was previously set to New,

When a database conversion is triggered, previously entered Unapplied Deposits will have their Effective Date, Entry Type and Status reset to the new values.

Note that when entering an Unapplied Deposit, the user should fill out the Description indicating the Invoice that the overpayment was made to if this is known; this will be displayed in AR Cash Receipts Journal's the new Invoice Description column.

6.3.4 Open Invoice List

New Field - PO#
This new column appears to the right of the Work Order Id column. It displays the customer's Purchase Order specified on the Work Order's PO# field.

New Field - Invoice Description:
The Invoice Description for each Invoice, CM or Unapplied Payment is displayed in this new column on the right-hand side of the list.

6.3.4a Filter on the Open Invoice List

This release employs the new list filtering functionality (see Customer Note 1.9.3) in the AR Cash Receipts Journal so that the user can easily filter on the invoices to be paid. To use this functionality in the Cash Receipts Journal:

Enter the Client Id and tab out of the field.

Right-click on the column title in the Open Invoices list that you wish to filter on.

When the Column Filter popup appears, enter an appropriate filter for the selected column and click OK to apply the filter.

More that one filter may be applied if needed. The Running Balance on the Open Invoice List is updated after column filters are applied to the list.

When Open Invoice list has been filtered to match the customer's payment, click the Auto-Fill Transactions button. Only the invoices in the filtered list will be selected.

6.3.5 Apply Overpayments to Original Invoice
