ValidOHJobId must reference a valid Job with its Overhead flag set to be used when Overtime entries are generated for Jobs in this Branch.

Setting Key: CostCodeId  Setting Value:  ValidOHCostCodeId

ValidOHCostCodeId must reference the Job Cost Code Id (belonging to the Overhead Job referenced in the previous entry) to be used when Overtime entries are generated this function.

Note that if the Job Cost Code Id is the same for all overhead jobs, it may be specified in the base sys-start-scmpteovrtme.

Existing Compute Payroll Registry Entries Required to Support Compute Overtime

Id: sys-compute-payroll

Setting Key:  AllocateOTPremium    Setting Value: true  

This entry is required to enable distribution of the OT Premium to the various non-overhead jobs when Compute Payroll is run.

Setting Key: AllocatedOTPremiumDescription  Setting Value: Allocated OT Premium

This registry specifies the description used by the system when the overhead premium is distributed by Compute Payroll.

12.1.21a Compute OT - Registry to Override RegPayTypeId and OTPayTypeId

Registry Id:   sys-start-scmpteovrtme

Setting Key: UseEmployeePayTypes  Setting Value: true  (default false)

With the above registry in place, the Employee Record provides overrides for the RegPayTypeId and OTPayTypeId settings. The decision to the Employee's Direct Pay or Indirect Pay defaults is based on the Job. If the Job is tagged as Overhead, the Indirect defaults are used. The Employee Direct Pay default are used if the Job is not Overhead.

12.1.22 Designate PR Period to be Standard Cost Only

Version 9.1.611.058 supports a method to designate specific PR Periods as evaluating only Earnings Ids types "Standard Cost" during Labor/WO Labor post. Labor posted to these periods would never be processed for Payroll and all earnings ids that are not Standard Cost will be ignored for JCH / GLH posting by the Journal. This provides a way to post JobCost Only labor (Standard Cost) entries within an installation where actual Payroll (Wage, Fringe, Burden) will also be entered and processed.

The following registry and Payroll Period setup are both required.

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: PostStandardCostEarningsOnly

Setting Value: pyrllprd_usr1 (or pyrllprd_usr2)

Payroll Period Setup
To implement the above registry and functionality, Payroll User1 or 2 must be set to true. If the Pay User 1 or 2 is field is false or blank the Payroll Period will NOT be handled as Standard Cost Only .

IMPORTANT: Payroll Periods for Standard Costing should NEVER be set as the Default Payroll Period.

12.2 Payroll Reports

12.2.1 Print PR Checks

*VOID* is once again printed in the signature field for non-MICR direct deposit checks. This corrects an issue in recent releases.

Modified print of EFT checks to only print 1 Void line on 1st signature line of MICR checks.

This release corrects an issue in the PR Check stub where the Amount field was missing the leading digit.  

Print PR Checks supports the Hard Block Branch logic (implemented by the global registry  BranchFilterWithHardBlock option) in this version.  The Hard Block on Branches is maintained regardless of how the Branch filter range is set.

New Field - Check Print:  All Checks - Physical Checks - EFT Checks
This field may be used to separate EFT and Physical Checks. The All Checks option prints both Physical and EFT checks.  Select Physical Checks to only print live checks, or  EFT Checks to live the run to EFT's.

12.2.1a Bonus Payroll Checks - Preferred Method for Version 9.0 and Up

The new Federal Tax Rate and State Tax Rate overrides on the Labor Journal Hours Tab Detail allow large Bonus Checks to be generated without the need change the Employee Record's Taxes tab. See Customer Note 12.17.4 for additional information on using the new fields.

1. Establish a new PAYROLL PERIOD for bonus checks. Example: 2017-Sept-B.

Note:  Unless overridden via registry, BONUS amounts (entered on the Labor Journal) will NOT Accrue/post to the GL, regardless of how the Accrue to GL field is checked in the Payroll Period.

 

Note: PTO Accrual and Bonus Pay Periods
Typically, PTO Hours would not be accrued on bonus payroll periods. Do NOT check the Accrue PTO or the Remote Technician Applet boxes on you Bonus Payroll Period.

2. Establish a new PAY TYPE if one doesn't already exist.

Pay Type Id:  Bonus  Description:  Bonus    Check Label:  Bonus 

Rate Factor:  1.000    Show Rate on CK: optional

Hours Type:  Other     GL Acct Id:  GL for Wages or Bonus Wages

Earnings Grp Id:  n/a

3. In the LABOR JOURNAL, enter all bonus amounts using the new bonus Pay Period Id setup in step 1 above (example: 2017-Sept-B).

After inputting zero hours to an overhead Job and your Bonus Pay Type, double click on the MAGNIFY GLASS of the line. Confirm and edit as follows:

Hours:   000.00

Salary?  (not checked)

Extra?   (not checked)

Pay Type Id:  Bonus

Bonus Amount:  Enter Bonus Dollars to Pay this Employee

Federal Tax Rate:
State Tax Rate:
These fields provide a flat rate override to the Federal / State Income Tax rate brackets in the Employee's Federal (FED-M or FED-S) and State Tax Tables. These fields are intended to be used for Bonus pay only. If these field are blank, the Federal / State Tax Table will be used as before. Enter the appropriate rate for bonuses prescribed by the tax authority.

Important Notes On Usage:

1. The overriding federal and/or state tax rates are applied directly to the Bonus Amount with which they are associated.  Taxable wage reductions (125, 401k, etc) are NOT applied to the Bonus Amount before computing FIT/SIT using the special tax rates. Tax is on Total Earnings when using this option. If this is not desired, the old methodology of changing the Employee record's Tax tab to specify a flat tax FED-bonus entry may be used instead.

2. Taxable wage reductions will eventually reduce the Taxable Wages so payroll reports, including W2s, will have the correct info.

Consider the example where an employee received a $10,000 bonus with 20% special FIT tax rate, 10% special SIT tax rate and 5% 401k deduction.  In the event special tax rates have been specified, the following is the order in which the calculations occur:

Gross Wages = $10,000

FIT = $2,000 (10,000 x .2)

SIT = $1,000 (10,000 x .1)

401k = $500 (10,000 x .05)

Taxable Wage = $9,500 (10,000 - 500)

4. Run the COMPUTE PAYROLL function for the new bonus Pay Period Id and the print the PAYROLL WORKSHEET before printing your checks to confirm your bonus checks are correct for the new bonus Pay Period Id.

Tip: Use Pay/Deduct Cycle Code XXXX to skip all deductions!

12.2.2  Print PR Miscellaneous Deduction Checks

Corrects extraneous printing of 'Void' on 2nd signature line.

This release corrects an issue on checks grouped by Vendor; the total is now correctly printed according to the detail lines on check.

This report supports the Hard Block logic (implemented by the BranchFilterWithHardBlock global settings registry option) in this version.  The Hard Block is maintained regardless of how the Branch filter range is set.

12.2.2a  PR Miscellaneous Deduction Checks - GL Entities

This release supports GL Debit and Credit posting for Deductions withholding (PR Check) & relief (PRMD Check) using the following GL Entity posting precedence:

1. As per Employee GL Entity reference if present, else

2. As per Deduction Code GL Entity reference if present, else

3. As per Respective Check processing "Bank " GL Entity referenced

12.2.3  Revised Report Payroll Worksheet

New Option: Include Dir Deposit Section?
The revised Report Payroll Worksheet (RPRWRKSv90b001.rpt) dated 2017-11-14  includes a Direct Deposit section which is enabled by checking this option. For employees with no check issued for the pay period, the section will show the appropriate info from the Direct Deposits tab in the Employee record. For employees with a check issued for the pay period, the report will show direct deposit info from the check table.

This report also includes the Branch Id as a filter, and supports the Hard Block logic (implemented by the BranchFilterWithHardBlock global settings registry option) on the report.  Note that report filters will not display the User's branch filters but the Hard Block is handled by the report.  

12.2.4 Executive PR Processing - Revised Reports to Install

Executive PR processing has been added to the following reports via the following filter:

New Filter - Executive PR:
If you are an Executive Payroll user, this field will default to Y; to run this function for all employees (Executive or not) clear this range. If your User record is not flagged as Executive Payroll, you will only be able to run this function for other non-Executive users even if you clear the filter.

12.2.5 Report ADP Export

Version 9.1.611.056 corrects an issue with the calculation of negative reimbursements when using the Kaback / KabackADP format.

New Filter - Executive PR:
This function is now sensitive to whether the user has Executive PR privileges. If you are an Executive Payroll user, this field will default to Y; to run this function for all employees (Executive or not) clear this range. If your User record is not flagged as Executive Payroll, you will only be able to run this function for other non-Executive users even if you clear the filter.

12.2.6 Report PR Export

Version 9.1.611.056 corrects an issue with the calculation of negative reimbursements when using the Kaback / KabackADP format.

New Filter - Executive PR:
This function is now sensitive to whether the user has Executive PR privileges. If you are an Executive Payroll user, this field will default to Y; to run this function for all employees (Executive or not) clear this range. If your User record is not flagged as Executive Payroll, you will only be able to run this function for other non-Executive users even if you clear the filter.

See Customer Notes 12.1.14 - 12.14c for registries impacting this function.

12.2.7 Report PR 401 (k) Reporting

This system report supports Executive PR and Security (Intercompany).  

New Filter - Executive PR:
This report is now sensitive to whether the user has Executive PR privileges. If you are an Executive Payroll user, this field will default to Y; to run this function for all employees (Executive or not) clear this range. If your User record is not flagged as Executive Payroll, you will only be able to run this function for other non-Executive users even if you clear the filter.

12.2.8 New Report PR Check Reconciliation - RCKRECN-PR

This new report, dated 2015-08-19, excludes AP and PRMD checks. Only PR checks (both Executive and non-Executive PR) will be listed.

12.2.9 Canadian T4 Forms

See Customer Note 12.2.16a for details on Company Record support for the Canadian PR T4 Standard and Summary reports.

See Customer Note 12.2.16 for updated information on the T4 (Standard) reports which do not require a Native PCL printer.

This release supports an enhancement to allow Earnings records to be set up with a W2 Category of OI:40 and an Earnings Type of Wage.

Earlier fixes to T4 fields include:

1. Union Dues reporting in Box 44
2. Employee and Company Registered Pension Plan contributions in Box 52
3. Any Earning or Deduction specifying an Other Information Box # (W-2 Category = OI:xx eg OI:40.

This release corrects an issue with the Employer EI Premium being overstated on the T4 Summary.

12.2.10 Report W-2 Forms

The 4-up options of BC2, 1x4 & Dx4 have been removed. These options were previously deprecated due to alignment issues.  

The release modifies the logic to skip print of Local Line 2 in Copy 2 or all copies of the W2 (registry enabled) so that line 1 taxes are displayed correctly.

The W2 Year is now printed below the Copy label on the Plain Paper Copy version of the report.

12.2.10a W2s / W3s - Intercompany - Change to Default Behavior

If Intercompany processing is enabled then the following W2 Employer Info will now come from the appropriate Company records, NOT the registries:

Company Name
Company Address
Company Federal EIN

In previous releases, it was necessary for Intercompany users to generate multiple registries to support this information: companyname-securityid, companyaddress-securityid, companyfederalEIN-securityid.

12.2.10b - Report PR W2's / Report PR W2's (Standard) Copy 2 Residual Tax

If Residual Tax Withholding is used, Local tax may be overstated on Line 2 of the W2's. The following new registry entry will omit the print of Local Line 2 on the W2's.

Id: sys-report-rw2

Setting Key: OmitLocalLine2  Setting Value: true (default is false)

To omit Local tax only on Copy 2, the following registry may be used instead.

Setting Key: OmitCopy2LocalLine Setting Value: true   (default is false)

12.2.10c Report PR W2s / Report PR W2s (Standard) Registry to Process 'Other' Tax Tables as 'Local'

Some customers are configured to use Local Tax Authorities for Counties and Other Tax Authorities for Cities.  This registry should be enabled to include Cities (flagged as Other) in the W2 Copy 1 & Copy 2 for localities.

Id: sys-report-rw2

Setting Key: ProcessOtherAsLocal  Setting Value: true   (default is false)

12.2.10d Alternate W2 12:DD (HSA Employer Costs) Processing

Some users wish to set up an Earnings Id to process W2 12:DD (HSA Employer Costs) and include this Earnings Id in regular PR processing. This procedure populated both prhstryernngs_amnt_ernngs & prhstryernngs_amnt_fringe fields. The W2 report sums (prhstryernngs_amnt_ernngs + prhstryernngs_amnt_fringe) which is cause the amount in box 12:DD to be overstated. 

NOTE: This processing does not follow the instructions in the Data-Basics EOY document.

In this release, setting the Earning record's User2 field to a value of FringeOnlyW2 changes the default behavior to only include prhstryernngs_amnt_frnge in the calculation for specific earnings on W2's which corrects the overstatement.

12.2.11 Report EFT Payroll

Checks over 1 million are now supported; previously, the leading digit was truncated from amount field in the ACH file.

This release corrects the landscape formatting of the printed Electronic Payment Register report generated when Report EFT Payroll is run to produce the electronic file for direct deposit.

12.2.11.a Options to Set the Default GL Account And/Or GL Entity

This registry sets the default GL Account / GL Entity when the printed EFT register is run. A separate registry (sys-eft-glaccountid) is required for the output of the ACH file

Id: sys-report-reft

Options to Set the Default GL Bank Account (use one or the other)

Setting Key: DefaultGLBankAccount   Setting Value: GLAccountId  or
Setting Key: GLBankAccount   Setting Value: GLAccountId

The GLBankAccount and DefaultGLBankAccount options provide a means of defaulting the bank account when these reports are run. Use of GLBankAccount and DefaultGLBankAccount should be thought of as mutually exclusive even though the Registry viewer won't prevent it. Do not use both!

Intercompany Processing Note: If the DefaultGLBankAccount option is set, the GL Bank Account specified in the registry (e.g, sys-report-raft-securityid) defaults when the user selects the Company (or it defaults if only one Company has been specified in the database). The Account will be cleared if the user selects a different Company for which the registry is not set.

Options to Set the Default GL Entity  (use one or the other)

Setting Key: DefaultGLBankEntity   Setting Value: GLEntityId  or
Setting Key: GLBankEntity   Setting Value: GLEntityId

The rules for Entity defaulting and validation are similar to the above description for GL Accounts.

12.2.12 Report AFT Payroll

Checks over 1 million are now supported; previously, the leading digit was truncated from amount field in the electronic file.

This release corrects the landscape formatting of the printed Electronic Payment Register report generated when Report AFT Payroll is run to produce the electronic file for direct deposit.

12.2.12.a Options to Set the Default GL Account And/Or GL Entity

This registry sets the default GL Account / GL Entity when the printed AFT register is run. A separate registry (sys-aft-glaccountid) is required for the output of the ACH file

Id: sys-report-raft

Options to Set the Default GL Bank Account (use one or the other)

Setting Key: DefaultGLBankAccount   Setting Value: GLAccountId  or
Setting Key: GLBankAccount   Setting Value: GLAccountId

The GLBankAccount and DefaultGLBankAccount options provide a means of defaulting the bank account when these reports are run. Use of GLBankAccount and DefaultGLBankAccount should be thought of as mutually exclusive even though the Registry viewer won't prevent it. Do not use both!

Intercompany Processing Note: If the DefaultGLBankAccount option is set, the GL Bank Account specified in the registry (e.g, sys-report-raft-securityid) defaults when the user selects the Company (or it defaults if only one Company has been specified in the database). The Account will be cleared if the user selects a different Company for which the registry is not set.

Options to Set the Default GL Entity  (use one or the other)

Setting Key: DefaultGLBankEntity   Setting Value: GLEntityId  or
Setting Key: GLBankEntity   Setting Value: GLEntityId

The rules for Entity defaulting and validation are similar to the above description for GL Accounts.

12.2.13 Report PR Deductions Detail

The revised report (RPRDEDDTL.rpt) dated 2017-08-30 includes a new filter range for the GL Entity ID which relates to the GL entity assigned to the employee records.

12.2.14 Report PR Miscellaneous Deduction Check Detail

Corrects a problem where duplicate lines appeared if the Employee Deductions Tab included multiple lines with the same Deduction Id for different date ranges. This system report does not need to be installed.

12.2.15  New Report PR W-2s (Standard) and Report PR W-3s (Standard)

The 4-up options of BC2, 1x4 & Dx4 have been removed. These options were previously deprecated due to alignment issues.  

The new Report PR W-2s (Standard) and Report PR W-3s (Standard) do not require a printer that supports native PCL printing with a PCL 5 or 5c printer driver. These report may required some changes to your existing registry entries, but are much simpler to run. If you still have the same printer / printer driver that you used for your W2’s last year, you may use the old version of Report PR W-2.

Step 1. Once the new version has been installed, run Start Function List Update to add the new reports (Report PR W-2s (Standard) and Report PR W-3s (Standard) to the Report menu.

Step 2. Go to the User Group (versions 9.0 and 9.1) or User Groups and Functions (version 8.2) record for the users who will run these reports and give them access to the new reports.  They must log off and back on to access the reports.  Note that if you are running under User Group All you must also log off and on to run the new reports.

Step 3.  The new Report PR W-2s (Standard) and Report PR W-3 (Standard) use the same registries as the old reports – review or create these registries/records as needed:

companyEINfederal (see Help for details)

Company Record: If Intercompany processing is enabled then the following W2 Employer Info will now come from the appropriate Company records, NOT the registries:  Company Name, Company Address, Company Federal EIN

sys-report-rW2 (also sets contact info for the W-3 – see Help for details)

Changes for W2 Printer Registry

sys-printer-w2 (sets margin adjustments)

Tip:  Most printers require negative margin adjustments for the new Report PR W-2s (Standard).  We recommend starting with the following settings and adjust as needed following your alignment print:

Id: sys-printer-w2
Setting Key: marginx  Setting Value: -0.05
Setting Key: marginy  Setting Value:  -0.6

Reminder: Negative margin setting values move the report text closer to the upper left-hand corner.  Setting values without the negative sign move the report text to the right (marginx) and down (marginy).

Note: it is not necessary to specify a default printer in this registry if you are using the new Report PR W-2s (Standard) report.

New Registry for W3 Printer

The following registry may be used to specify margin adjustments on the W-3 if they are different from the W-2. Most printers require negative margin adjustments for the new Report PR W-3s (Standard).  We recommend starting with the following settings and adjusting as needed following your alignment print:

Id: sys-printer-w3
Setting Key: marginx  Setting Value: -0.05
Setting Key: marginy  Setting Value: -0.72

Step 4.  Unless your support representative updated your Folders view or made the appropriate Function Substitution, you will need to run the new reports from the Report Menu.  Run Report W-2 (Standard) and print a test alignment of your tax forms for one or two employees before running all copies. You will be prompted to run the W-3 (see the W3 Printing Tip below), although Report PR W-3s (Standard) may be also be run stand-alone.

Make any adjustments needed to the horizontal or vertical positions via the sys-printer-W2 and/or sys-printer-W3 registries and recheck for alignment as needed.

Step 5. Once you are happy with your alignment, run the necessary copies of your W-2 and W-3 forms (see Help for details).

W3 Printing Tips:
The Copy A option of Report PR W-2s (Standard) allows the printing of a W3 form at the end of the report. The system will print the Copy A’s and summary page as usual, and then pause. The following message box will appear:

 Print W3 Form? Insert W3 Form Now.

If you want to print the W3, DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS MESSAGE IMMEDIATELY. To print the W3 form, the user should verify that all Copy A’s plus the summary page have been printed, and then load the W3 form in the printer.

After the W3 form has been loaded, the user should then click Yes in the message box to display and then print the W3 form. Note that if taxes for more than one state have been assessed, an X will be printed in the State portion of Box 15, and the Employer’s state ID number will be blank.

12.2.16 Report PR Canadian T4 (Standard) for Standard Printers

The Executive Payroll status of the Payroll Period is no longer considered when printing T4's.  Employees flagged as Executive Payroll will only appear on the report if the User running the report is flagged as Executive P/R.

This release supports an enhancement to allow Earnings records to be set up with a W2 Category of OI:40 and an Earnings Type of Wage.

The new Report PR Canadian T4s (Standard) and Report PR Canadian T4 Summary (Standard) do not require a printer that supports native PCL printing with a PCL 5 or 5c printer driver. These reports may require some changes to your existing registry entries, but are much simpler to run. If you still have the same printer / printer driver that you used for your T4’s last year, you may use the old version of Report PR Canadian T4.

12.2.16a Setting up and Running the New T4 Reports

Step 1: Once the new version has been installed, run Start Function Update to add the new reports (Report PR Canadian T4s (Standard) and Report PR Canadian T4 Summary (Standard) to the Report menu.

Step 2: Go to the User Group (versions 9.0 and 9.1) or User Groups and Functions (version 8.2) record for the users who will run these reports and give them access to the new reports.  They must log off and back on to access the reports.  Note that if you are running under User Group All you must also log off and on to run the new reports.

Step 3.  The new (Report PR Canadian T4s (Standard) and Report PR Canadian T4 Summary (Standard) the same registries as the old T4 reports – review or create the registries listed below as needed.

Changes for T4 Printer Registry

This registry manages the margin adjustments to enable the report to align correctly on the form.

Tip:  Most printers require negative margin adjustments for the new Report PR Canadian T4s (Standard).  We recommend starting with the following settings and adjust as needed following your alignment print:

Id: sys-printer-t4
Setting Key: marginx  Setting Value: -0.63
Setting Key: marginy  Setting Value:  -0.85

Reminder: Negative margin setting values move the report text closer to the upper left-hand corner.  Setting values without the negative sign move the report text to the right (marginx) and down (marginy).

It is not necessary to specify a default printer in this registry if you are using the new Report PR Canadian T4s (Standard) report.

New Registry for T4 Summary

The following registry may be used to specify margin adjustments on the T4 Summary (Standard) if they are different from the T4 (Standard). Most printers require negative margin adjustments for the new Report PR Canadian T4 Summary (Standard).  We recommend starting with the following settings and adjusting as needed following your alignment print:

Id: sys-printer-t4summary
Setting Key: marginx  Setting Value: -0.55
Setting Key: marginy  Setting Value: -0.95

Step 4. Unless your support representative updated your Folders view or made the appropriate Function Substitution, you will need to run the new reports from the Report Menu. Run Report PR Canadian T4 (Standard) and print a test alignment of your tax forms for one or two employees before running all copies. You will be prompted to run the T4 Summary (although Report PR Canadian T4 Summary (Standard) may be also be run stand-alone).

Make any adjustments needed to the horizontal or vertical positions via the sys-printer-t4 and/or sys-printer-t4summary registries and recheck for alignment as needed.

Step 5. Once you are happy with your alignment, run the necessary copies of your T4 forms. A message will be displayed while the forms are still printing:

Print T4 Summary Form? Insert Form Now.

If you want to print the T4 Summary, DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS MESSAGE IMMEDIATELY. The user should verify that all T4's have been printed, and then load the T4 Summary form in the printer.

After the T4 Summary form has been loaded, the user should then click Yes in the message box.

12.2.16b Additional Registries for T4 Forms

Registry for Setting Contact Info for the T4 Summary

Id: sys-report-rT4

Setting Key: t4contactperson  Setting Value: Firstname Lastname

Setting Key: t4telephone  Setting Value: aaa   eee   nnnn  

(Note: you must include 3 spaces in between each set of numbers)

Setting Key: t4extension  Setting Value : nnn

Setting Key: t4sin1   Setting Value : # # # # # # # # #

Setting Key: t4sin2   Setting Value : # # # # # # # # # (if applicable)

 

Setting the Company Name and Address for the T4 and T4 Summary

Id: companyname

Contents: Your Company Name

The Company Name printed on the T4 and T4 Summary Reports is derived from the companyname registry. The name may be entered in the header Contents field: a Setting Key and Value are not required.

Id: companyaddress

Setting Key: Line1   Setting Value: Street Address

Setting Key: Line2   Setting Value: City, Prov, Postal Code

12.2.16c .Important Notes on Other Viewer Settings:

Tax Authority Records

For any provincial Tax Authority Records, you need to put the province code in the ‘Prov:’ field.

Deduction Records

For the deduction records for Union Dues or Charitable, need to populate field ‘Deduction User 1’ with Dues or Charitable, respectively.

Employee Records

For any employee that is CPP, EI or PPIP exempt, in the Employee Viewer, on the ‘User Fields’ tab, need to populate Employee User 8, 9 or 10 respectively with a ‘Y’.

12.2.16a Canadian PR T4 Standard and Summary - Company Record Support

The Canadian T4 reports have been revised to use the Company record / Company Registry tab to specify the Company Name and Address and other registry settings required for these reports.

Company Name, Address: These reports will use the Company Name & Company Address from the Company Record Header info if available.

Company Registry Tab Fields: Fields not defined in the Company Record header may be added to the Company record's Registry Tab.  For example, the t4sin1 for the Summary report.

First look for the Company Record's Registry entry. If not found,
Second look for the sys-report-rT4 If the registry is blank or not found,
Third look for the company specific companyname registry setting (e.g., companyname-1) and use that.  
If none of the above are available, the string 'companyname' will be used in the report instead of leaving it blank.

12.2.16b Canadian PR T4 Standard and Summary - Covid Reporting for 2020

This release supports Covid 19 reporting for 2020. This is implemented with special, year-specific earnings processing. The Other Information boxes will be used to print totals / codes as follows based on the Check's Effective Date:

Code - Check Date Range

57 -  2020-03-15 through 2020-05-09
58 - 2020-05-10 through 2020-07-04
59 - 2020-07-05 through 2020-08-29
60 - 2020-08-30 through 2020-09-26

12.2.17 Report W2 Electronic File

The revised Report W2 Electronic File (RW2EFb72vb105.rpt) dated 2018-02-16 supports the following options:

Philadelphia W2's

To support Philadelphia Electronic W2 filing the following additional registry options must be enabled:

 Id: sys-w2-ef

Setting Key: reEmployerContactName   Setting Value First Name Last Name

Setting Key: reEmployerContactPhoneNumber  Setting Value:

Enter the area code and phone number without parentheses or hyphens.

Setting Key: reEmployerContactPhoneExtension  Setting Value: if applicable

Setting Key: reEmployerContactEMail   Setting Value: email of the contact at your firm

Setting Key: reEmployerContactFax   Setting Value: fax of the contact at your firm

S etting Key: rsStateControlNumber   Setting Value: as supplied by the state of PA

NOTE:  The registry entry for rsStateControlNumber should only be enabled for Philadelphia W2 reporting. This registry must be disabled when generating electronic W2s for other authorities.

Oklahoma W2's

To support Oklahoma State Electronic W2 filing the following additional registry options must be enabled:

 Id: sys-w2-ef

Setting Key: rsOKWithholdingAccountNumber   

Setting Value: as supplied by the state of Oklahoma

12.2.18 Payroll Reports

Report PR 941 Quarterly Summary (State) (RPR941SSTE.rpt)
This new report is designed to assist the user in completing the Employer’s Quarterly State Tax Return. The user specifies the PR Year, PR Quarter and State when running the report.

Report Payroll Employee Data (RPREMPD.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

Report PR Payroll Register (RPRREGR.rpt):
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and signed total fields.

Report PR Summary (RPRSUMM.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

Report PR Federal Tax (RPRTAXF.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

Report PR Local Tax (RPRTAXL.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

Report PR Other Tax (RPRTAXO.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

Report PR State Tax (RPRTAXS.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

Report PR Workers Compensation Summary (RPRWCIS.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and the addition of a Total Earnings column.

Report PR Union By Employee (RPRUNNE.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-13 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

PR Union By Employee 2 (RPRUNNE2.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-13 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

The revised report dated 2018-12-13 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements.

NOTE: If you are running a custom version of the Certified Payroll Report (with the extension USE, UHC, WHD, DeBella) please contact your support representative to see if you need an updated version.

Report PR Worksheet (RPRWRKSv90b001.rpt)
The revised report dated 2018-12-12 supports Intercompany Security and other refinements as well as a Direct Deposit section.

12.2.19  Payroll Reports Supporting Company Record Settings

Report W2 Electronic File (RW2EFv82b01.rpt dated 2020-01-17 or later)

Report StateUnemployment Electronic File (RSTTEUEv82b01.rpt dated 2020-01-17 or later)

The above reports have been revised to use the Company record / Company Registry tab to specify the Federal EIN, Company Name and Address and other registry settings required for these reports. This will reduce the need for multiple registries entries by Company Security. The new Company Record overload logic supercedes Registry values when/if present.

Company Record Name and Address Fields: For the following reports the Company Name & Company Address are populated from the Company Header info if available. Registry entries for raCompanyName and raCompanyAddress will be superceded by the Company Registry information if present.

Company Registry Tab Fields: Fields not defined in the Company Record header may be added to the Company record's Registry Tab.

For example, in Report W2 Electronic File (may be listed as Report PR W2 Electronic File) supports the reEmployerName registry option. The report processing will:

First look for the Company Registry entry. If not found,

Second look for sys-w2-ef registry entry. If the registry is blank or not found,

Third look for the company specific companyname registry setting (e.g., companyname-1) and use that.  

If none of the above are available, the string 'companyname' will be used in the report instead of leaving it blank.

12.2.20 941S Report with FFCRA Covid 19 Support

Purpose:

This report is designed to assist the user in completing the Employer’s Quarterly Federal Tax Return which includes Covid related information (if applicable). This report is generated with Payroll History data as well as user values entered on the Report Range screen.

Usage:

The updated PR 941 Quarterly Summary (RPR941S.rpt) report dated July 28, 2020 or later supports the modifications discussed in Customer Note 12.2.20a.  SAMPro Version 7.3 or higher is required.

Registry:

See Customer Note 20.2.20a  for the required registry and data setup needed to support the COVID-19 Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) fields.

The revised 941 report has been modified to utilize the 3 new Pay Type User fields to determine the following values for these new lines on the form. If these procedures are followed, the following fields will be completed on the printed report:

5a - Taxable SS Wages - excludes the new amounts in columns 5a  (i) and (ii) 

5a.i – Qualified Sick Leave – see CUSTOM Pay Type User fields:    CV-SELF and CV-PTO

5a.ii - Qualified Family Leave – see CUSTOM Pay Type User fields:   CV-FML

Important Fields: Report Range Screen

PR Year: PR Quarter:
The year and quarter you wish to run this report for.

(5b) Social Security Tips
SAM Pro does not track Social Security Tips. This data entry field may be completed by the user if Social Security Tips should be reported.

(8) FICA Sick Pay Adjustment.
(9) FICA Other Pay Adjustment
Adjustments (not reflected in PR History) to FICA Sick / Other Pay for this quarter should be entered in these fields.

(11a) Qualified Small Business Research Credit:

Credit Qualified small business payroll tax credit for increasing research activities.

(11b) Nonrefundable Qualified Sick/Family Leave Credit:

Nonrefundable portion of credit for qualified sick and family leave wages from Worksheet 1.

(11c) Nonrefundable Employee Retention Credit:

Nonrefundable portion of employee retention credit from Worksheet 1.

(13a) Total Deposits, Including Prior Quart Overpayments:

Total deposits for this quarter, including overpayment applied from a prior quarter and overpayments applied from Form 941-X, 941-X (PR), 944-X, or 944-X (SP) filed in the current quarter.

(13b) Deferred Employer Social Security Tax:

Deferred amount of the employer share of social security tax.

(13c) Refundable Family Sick/Family Leave Credit:

Refundable portion of credit for qualified sick and family leave wages from Worksheet 1.

(13d) Refundable Employee Retention Credit:

Refundable portion of employee retention credit from Worksheet.

(13f) Total Advances Received (Form 7200):

Total advances received from filing Form(s) 7200 for the quarter.

Note: The above lines will be used to calculate the various totals to determine the Balance Due on line 14 or Overpayment on line 15 of the printed report as well as 13e and 13g.

Description:
Enter any text that you wish to appear on the report header in this field.

12.2.20a Registry and Data Requirements for PR 941S Summary with Covid 19 FFCRA Reporting

Families First Coronavirus Response Act

In response to the COVID-19 Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) this notice is to inform SAMPro users how to track employees that you pay Emergency Sick Pay & Emergency Family Medical Leave due to the Coronavirus.    

IRS Updates

The IRS website https://www.irs.gov/coronavirus/coronavirus-tax-relief-for-businesses-and-tax-exempt-entities has detailed information on the Coronavirus Related Paid Leave for Workers and Tax Credits for Small- and Mid-Size Businesses and well as the Employee Retention Credit. We strongly suggest familiarizing yourself with this information and how it pertains to your company’s current situation.

Tracking Information in SAMPro

Your firm’s ability to obtain any applicable tax credits depends accurately tracking the Coronavirus PTO.  We recommend that SAMPro users create at least three (3) new pay types to track this information to assist you in determining any future Tax Credits for employer FICA taxes. 

These new Pay Types would be used when entering a person’s Emergency Paid Time off or Emergency Family Leave into the Labor Journal.   These new Pay Types should not be used to enter paid time off that is not directly related to the Coronavirus pandemic.  As needed, please advise anyone allowed to enter Indirect (non-Job & Overhead) related time for themselves about these new Pay Types when using other products that feed the Labor Journal (e.g. Time Anywhere, Tech Anywhere, CPP Import, etc.).

Registry to Specify Field Used for Covid Categories

Id:  sys-viewer-vpytype

Setting Key:  CovidCategoryField      Setting Value: pytype_usr5 or pytype_usr2 (version 8.2 and below)

This registry defines the Pay Type User Field that will be used by the 941S report to determine the Covid credits.

Updating/Creating Pay Types for Covid Support

Three new Pay Types are needed to support this new legislation. Please note the setting of the Pay Type User field in the following instructions. SAMPro Versions 9.0 and 9.1 support five User fields; Versions 7.0 – 8.2 support two.   A Pay Type User field will be used in planned SAMPro reporting to assist in determining any future credits. The above registry will specify which Pay Type User field you have selected for use with Coronavirus reporting.  If you have already added new Pay Types, be sure to update your selected Pay Type User fields with one of the new User values (CV-SELF, CV-PTO or CV-FML). Be sure to complete the Pay Type User fields exactly as specified below.

1.    1.Pay Type Id:  CV-SELF       Pay Type Description: Emergency Sick Pay - Self

  1. This pay type is for employees taking emergency paid sick leave because they themselves are sick.

  2. This pays out at 100% of the rate of pay (Rate Factor 1.000).

  3. There is a daily limit of $511 and a total limit of $5,110 (80 hours)

  4. In Pay Type: set Hours Type to PTO and Category as Other

  5. In Pay Type: set your selected User field to:  CV-SELF

Note: Be sure to sure the same Pay Type User field to code your CV Pay Types.


2. Pay Type Id: CV-PTO        Pay Type Description:  Emergency Sick Pay - Family/Dependent

    1. This pay type is for employees taking emergency paid sick leave because a family member is sick or their kid’s school or daycare has closed.

    2. The earning pays out at 2/3 of the rate of pay entered (Rate Factor .666)

    3. There is a daily limit of $200 and total limit of $2,000 (80 hours)

    4. In Pay Type: set Hours Type to PTO and Category as Other

    5. In Pay Type: set your selected User field value to:  CV-PTO

 

  1.  Pay Type Id: CV-FML   Pay Type Description: Emergency Family Medical Leave

    1. This pay type is for employees taking emergency family medical leave because they need to take care of children whose schools or daycares have closed or for absences related to COVID-19.

    2. This earning pays out at 2/3 of the rate of pay entered (Rate Factor .666)

    3. There is a daily limit of $200 and a total limit of $10,000 (10 weeks)

    4. In Pay Type: set Hours Type to PTO and Category as Other

    5. In Pay Type: set your selected User field value to:  CV-FML

 

Additional Notes on setting up the new Coronavirus PTO Pay Types:

Pay Type Id’s:   When adding these new Pay Types, you can use these same ID’s (CV-SELF, CV-PTO & CV-FML) or create your own ID’s.   If you want to use these same Pay Type Id’s that we have suggested, then just rename those ID’s to be CV-SELF, CV-PTO & CV-FML.  *TIP:  If you create your own ID’s use the same prefix so you can run reports using just the prefix (e.g.  CV% or COV%).   As needed, you may expand these Pay Type Id’s to be by branch or by department.  For example:

CVNY-SELF, CVNJ-SELF, CVNY-PTO, CVNJ-PTO, etc

CV-SELF-ADMIN, CV-SELF-SERVICE, CV-SELF-INSTALL, CV-PTO-ADMIN, CV-PTO-SERVICE, etc

GL Expense Account Id:   
Optional usage.  Either leave this account blank or enter the GL Expense account this new type of pay should be charged (debited) against.  Check the setup of your other PTO related pay types to determine if you are currently tracking paid sick time in your general ledger using a different GL Expense Account(s).  If you are not, you may continue to follow suit since the SAMPro payroll reports will provide you with this information (in hours and dollars on various payroll reports).     You may also want to discuss this issue with your CPA to determine what they recommend for you.   If you do setup a GL Expense Account, it will requires using a COST CAT during Labor Entry where the GL Expense Account is blank or is setup with this same GL Account.   You can use the Employee Rate Test Viewer to view the GL impact of entering 8 hours of labor using these new Pay Types & an Overhead job.  

Pay Type User Field for Coronavirus:
The revised PR 941S report as well as possible future Data-Basics reports will look to the Pay Type’s User fields (as specified via registry) to determine if the recorded PTO hours are related to the applicable COVID-19 leave.  To ensure that the field is coded correctly, we recommend using the Custom Fields functionality to specify the allowable values entered in this field.   If you had already created Pay Types for tracking this information prior to this notice, please update your existing COVID related Pay Types with one of these new values. 

To access the Custom Fields functionality, go to the Pay Type viewer and right-click on the Pay Type User field you want to use for the Corona Virus coding. If you have access to the Custom Field functioning, the following message will appear. Select Customize Field (if Customize Field is not an option your IT/Admin user may be able to do this for you).

The Custom Fields viewer will open when you select Customize Fields. The following shows this setup used for the Pay Type User3 field. Notice that we have set the Custom Field Label to ‘Corona Virus:’ and entered each of our codes in the Values tab.

Once this information has been setup, the user can double click when at this field to see the list of available codes to pick from. This also ensures that these are the only values that can be entered in the selected Pay Type User field.

PRS Pay Codes:  For ADP, Paychex and Paycor users that have added new Earnings Codes into these payroll systems for tracking Emergency Paid Time Off and Emergency Medical Leave will need to also update this field with the appropriate codes.   See the on-line help for additional information on usage.

Job Use:  These new Pay Types should only be used on Overhead (indirect) jobs.

Union Exempt:   Check this box if fringes or Union Fringes & Union Deductions are exempt.

 

Applying the New Pay Types

·         For those employees that go on Emergency Family Leave for 10 weeks, and they earn more than the daily limit ($200 day is 52K per year or 25/hr) - you can (as needed) stop their old salary or hourly amounts and setup new amounts that do not exceed these daily limits for the next 10. weeks - but do NOT check the option:  ‘Add Pay Rate Factor’ on their employee earnings tab.  Salary and Hourly examples are shown below.

 

Salary Example:

Hourly Example:


 

Hourly Example using Pay Type Overrides:

·         For those users who are familiar with using Pay Type overrides on Hourly employees and have access to this field in the detail view of the Employee Earnings tab,  this feature may be used instead of changing the employees actual pay rates for Employees who exceed the daily limits.  See example below for hourly example using Pay Type Overrides.

·         On those employees who earn less than these daily limits, if you want the system to figure out 2/3 of their hourly wage, then on the new pay types set the pay type rate factor to .666 & just be sure that the employees hourly wage is checked ‘Add Pay Rate Factor’.   No additional setup is needed.  Employees who earn in excess of 37.54 per hour would be over the $200 daily limit (37.54 x .666 = 25.00).

·         As needed, salary employees can be paid these daily limits using the bonus amount box in the detail view of a Labor Journal, providing the Salary check box is unchecked on all their labor lines/labor entries.  A registry setting is needed to enter bonus amounts with hours.  This setting requires being on specific versions of the software (9.0.572.053+ or 9.1.611.038+). Using this feature allows the user to pay wages for a payroll period using a mix of the persons salary and a daily limit without having to change the employees earnings tab information.  This feature can only be tested by using the Labor Journal.  If you do elect to use this feature, you may wish to update the Payroll Periods to “Accrue Bonus Pay” to avoid reconciliation problems if you don’t print & post P/R Checks in SAMPro.  Note: 9.0.572.044+ users must set User2 of the Payroll Period to true & create a new ffv-global registry setting (AccrueBonusPay=true).  Using this feature for other non-salary situations may create unforeseeable payroll problems.

If you do elect to change pay rates on an employee, please verify that the new pay rate is accurate prior to printing or posting their checks.   The Employee Rate Test viewer is a quick way to show how much the person will be paid for 1 or 8 hours of PTO, using one of these new Pay Types.  It will also show you the GL postings if you use the Accrue to GL options.  It won’t show bonus or deduction info.   Enter the current date along with their appropriate Overhead job, cost code, cost category, new pay type & labor rate (for indirect time)  to see their current pay rate and GL Postings that a Labor Journal would make.

12.2.21 Report PR W-2 Box 14 Covid Addendum

The IRS notes additional reporting requirements for the W-2 in its “Guidance on Reporting Qualified Sick Leave Wages and Qualified Family Leave Wages Paid Pursuant to the Families First Coronavirus Response Act.”  This specifies that employers either provide a statement with the W-2 specifying COVID related wages for 2020 or print the information in W-2 box 14 (not feasible due to size issues on the W-2 for a number of reasons).  

Data-Basics’ Report PR W-2 Box 14 Covid Addendum should be installed and run to support this requirement if any wages were paid applicable to the Families First Coronavirus Response Act.  This report uses the same information as the revised 941 Summary report. See Customer Note 12.2.20 for details.

The SAMPro Report PR W-2 Box 14 Covid Addendum (RPRCOVID.rpt dated 2021-01-26 or later) supports SAMPro versions 8.2 and above. A version for pre 8.2 users is also available (RPRCOVID [pre-82].rpt revised 2020-01-26 or later).

12.2.22 Report PR Canadian T4 Electronic

This release extends Covid19 reporting for 2020 to the electronic format. This is implemented with special, year-specific earnings processing. The Other Information fields in the electronic file will be completed as follows based on the Check's Effective Date:

Field - Check Date Range

empt_inc_amt_covid_prd1 -  2020-03-15 through 2020-05-09

empt_inc_amt_covid_prd2 - 2020-05-10 through 2020-07-04

empt_inc_amt_covid_prd3 - 2020-07-05 through 2020-08-29

empt_inc_amt_covid_prd4 - 2020-08-30 through '2020-09-26

12.2.23 Report PR Certified Payroll - PDF for the Federal WH-347 Form

This report allows the user to automatically complete the WH-347 fillable form from the Department of Labor for weekly payroll.

The following steps are required to implement this functionality in SAMPro 9.1.611.055 and above.

1. The xmltopdf.jar file must support Java 8 (remember the file must be rename XmlToPdf.jar):

Java 8-11: TLS 1.2 and Uses Javamail 1.6.2 (XmlToPdf[2019-04-05 Java 8-11].jar) or

Java 8-11: TLS 1.0:  XmlToPdf[2019-01-16] Java8-11].jar

2. This functionality is dependent on database functions; contact your support person to deploy script attached to Devops t4427.  

3. Install Report PR Certified Payroll PDF (RPRCRPRPDF.rpt dated 2021-02-08 or later and assign to appropriate User Groups.

4. Copy the PDF template files, drop the wh347section1.pdf and wh347section2.pdf files in an appropriate templates directory on your server.

5. Registry Setting

Id: sys-report-rprcrprpdf

Setting Key: fillableform  Setting Value: true

Setting Key: sectionfillableform  Setting Value: true

Setting Key: SaveFillableBySection  Setting Value: false

Note that this setting allows the two-part fillable WH 347 to be saved as a single document.

Setting Key: sectionfillableformwh347p1  Setting Value: fullpath to template\wh347section1.pdf</Line>

Setting Key: sectionfillableformwh347p2  Setting Value: fullpath to template\wh347section2.pdf</Line>

These options specify the templates for page 1 and 2 of the report.

Setting Key: sectionfillableformflatten  Setting Value: false

Setting Key: autosavebysection   Setting Value: false

Note that this setting allows the two-part report to be saved as a single document.

Setting Key: autosavedirectory  Setting Value: fullpath to save directory

Setting Key: autosavefilename   Setting Value: wh347 [^date^^time^]

Setting Key: signatory  Setting Value: Name of Signatory to appear on report

Setting Key: title     Setting Value:  Title of Signatory to appear on report

Setting Key: contractor   Setting Value: Name of contracting company (optional)

Running the Report

This report allows the user to automatically complete the WH-347 fillable form from the Department of Labor for weekly payroll. If the report is not 'flattened' via registry, the user will be able to update the PDF as needed.

Usage:

A check must have been issued for an employee's hours to appear on this report.

Range Screen:

Job Id:
This field must be completed so that the report is run 1 job at a time.

Ending Date:
Enter the "end date" from the Payroll Period you wish to report on.

Form Style: Federal wh347
This report currently supports the Federal WH 347 report.

The SAMPro base report will initially be displayed: click the Fillable Form button to launch the PDF. Unless auto "flattened" per registry setting, the resultant file may revised as a Fillable Form and then saved or flattened once finalized.

12.2.24 Payroll Reports - Option to Suppress SSN on Select Payroll Tax Reports

New Option: Show SSN?

When this box is blank, the report will hide all but the last 4 digits of the employee's Social Security Number from displaying on the report (XXXX-XX-1234). If the box is checked, the employee's full Social Security Number will be displayed. These reports support US employees.

The following reports, all revised on 2021-02-08, include this option.

Report PR Deductions Summary (RPRDEDS.rpt)

Report PR EEOC Summary (RPREEOC.rpt)

Report PR Employee Data (RPREMPD.rpt)

Report Federal Tax Report (RPRTAXF.rpt)

Report PR Other Tax (RPRTAXO.rpt)

Report State Tax Report (RPRTAXS.rpt)

Report Local Tax Report (RPRTAXL.rpt)

Report PR Union by Employee  (RPRUNNE.rpt)

Report PR Union by Employee 2 (RPRUNNE2/rpt)

The following registry option may be used for each of these reports to initialize the Show SSN box to checked:

Setting Key: InitialValueFor~p_shw_SSN  Setting Value: true

12.2.25 Report PR Certified Payroll -WHD  

The revised Report PR Certified Payroll -WHD (RPRCRPR-WHD.rpt) revised 2021-03-31 corrects an issue where standard and OT hours were only displayed for the last employee listed. It also corrects an SQL error if the employee's record did not reference an Earnings Group.  This report supports SAMPro version 9.0 and above.

12.2.26 Report State Unemployment Electronic File

The revised Report State Unemployment Electronic File (RSTTEUEv82b01.rpt) date 2021-04-08 or later includes special processing to support Colorado's revised quarter format. Output for CO will now produce 202101,202102,202103,202104, according to Year/Quarter.  The general format for other states will continue to use 032021, 062021, 092021,122021 according to Quarter End Month/Year.

12.3 Safety Incident Tracking

12.3.1 Supervisor Viewer

Purpose:

This new record allows a Supervisor to be specified when Labor is entered. This information is written to Job History so that a record of the Supervisor responsible for each labor entry line is maintained; this information may be used to support a custom Safety Incident Analytic.

The Supervisor Id may be specified in the detail lines of the following journals: Job Journal, Labor Journal, Time Labor and Work Order Labor. The Magnify button must be used to access the Supervisor field in these records.

Usage:

The Supervisor is set when time is entered via a specific custom time entry screen; this information is imported to SAMPro so that it is included in Job History. TimeAnywhere may be customized to support the entry of the Employee's Supervisor; contact your Account Manager for additional information.

Important Fields:

Supervisor Id:  Supervisor Name:
These fields identify the Supervisor.

Contact Id:
The Contact record associated with this Supervisor. The phone, fax and email contact information shown below defaults from the Contact record.

Employee Id:
The Supervisor's Employee Id.

12.4 Labor Journal

SAMPro now defaults into the Labor Journal the correct Workers Comp category from the security that matches the employee's security for the following tabs: Employee Rate Test, Labor Journal, WO Labor Tab, and import from Labor Journal into WO, based on the Job Cost Category "Workers Comp" tab and the Workers Comp's State from the Job.

This update makes the GL Entity ALWAYS required with InterCo v.cus when Intercompanyenabled is true.

Validation in a previous release corrected the gap in Payroll Period validation by revising the test for an inactive accrual accounting period. Unfortunately, this validation prevented users from fully accessing previous entries because the validation was applied when changing focus from line to line. In this release, validation is only applied when the user changes a field, allowing earlier entries to be inspected.

Corrects a sporadic 'Runtime Error: illegal character in format' issues experienced by some users in Labor Journal posts from TimeAnywhere.

This release corrects validation for the scenario where the Pay Period is "active", Accounting Period is "inactive" and Accrual Accounting Period is <blank>.  

When Intercompany is enabled and a detail line contains a Job Id, any changes to the line's GL Entity are validated to ensure that the new GL Entity belongs to the same company as the Job.

A warning is now displayed when the user first accesses a journal entry which has been replaced by one with a higher 'tack' number. This warning is designed to prevent the user from wasting time by attempting to make changes to a journal entry record which cannot be saved because it has already been replaced. See Customer Note 1.1.2 for a registry to disable this warning globally or by individual viewer. 

Previously, a user should receive a warning message when trying to access a Computed or Paid Labor Journal but the warning message did not appear. This update corrects this defect.

PR-to-GL Accruals:

In previous releases, accruals were skipped for Standard Cost type Earnings record when an Overhead Jobs was specified. In this release, accruals are correctly posted for Standard Cost Earnings for Jobs that are not Direct.

Previously, changing certain values (Hours, Pay Type, etc) didn't always cause the GL Accrual Info to be recalculated.  The Accrual Info is now correctly set in the Employee, Labor Journal, Payroll Period and Work Order viewers, and in Compute Payroll.

Labor Journal Viewer:

 In version 9.1.611.059 and up, this release supports a registry-controlled emulation for including Earnings and Deduction Groups from the Employee Recurring Wages tab for Recurring Labor entries.

In version 9.1.611.060 and up, the WO ID on the labor lines from the labor journal does not re-load or overwrite the TA source RN when changing the WO Id so that the TA source RN carries over to new transactions. Overriding the WO Id was caused by changing the WO ID on some of the technician labor journal lines because it was created for the wrong client site.

12.4.1 Labor Journal Hours Tab

Version 9.1.611.057 corrects a validation error that did not allow the user to enter time if the primary Accounting Period was Inactive and but the Accrual Accounting Period was Active.  Time may now be entered for dates in the Accrual Accounting Period when the Payroll Period is active.

Earlier releases include the following corrections and changes:

A spurious 'Please clear line '#' and re-enter Bonus Amount') message when using Insert/Copy to enter multiple lines with the Bonus field completed has been removed.

Changed Field - Cost Category:
When entering hours for a field employee for a indirect (overhead) job, the Cost Category from the Labor Rate is cleared if the previously auto-loaded Cost Category of the selected job would cause a job/cost category error . This allows an appropriate Cost Category to easily be entered manually.  For a field employee, when entering hours for a direct job the cost category defaults from the Labor Rate in the employee record as in previous releases.

This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

(Magnify view)

New Field - Supervisor Id:
If completed, this field specifies the Supervisor responsible for the work in this entry.

Changed Field - Bonus:
Since a Bonus should never be entered on a line which also records hours, validation prevents the user from entering hours and a Bonus on the same line.

The Local, State and Other Tax Authority fields also default from the Employee record when a Bonus amount is entered. If a Field type Cost Code is then selected, the fields are overridden from the Job record. This defaulting works the same as when hours are entered.  

12.4.1a  Special Federal/State Tax Rates for Bonus Pay

Labor Journal Hours Tab Detail View

Note: a new v.cus file may be needed to see these fields if a data-conversion was not triggered when upgrading to this version.

This enhancement eliminates the need to edit the Employee record before and after bonus checks are run in order to apply a Federal Income Tax (and if needed, State)  flat rate to bonus pay.  See Customer Note 12.2.5a for additional Usage instructions and details to running Bonus Check with this newer methodology.

New Fields:

Federal Tax Rate:
State Tax Rate:
These fields provide a flat rate override to the Federal / State Income Tax rate brackets in the Employee's Federal (FED-M or FED-S) and State Tax Tables. These fields are intended to be used for Bonus pay only. If these field are blank, the Federal / State Tax Table will be used as before. Tax is on Total Earnings when using this option. If this is not desired, the old methodology of changing the Employee record's Tax tab to specify a flat tax FED-bonus entry may be used instead.

 12.4.1b Special Bonus Posting And Accrual Configuration (Union Wages) - Versions Prior to 9.1.611.057

IMPORTANT: See Customer Note 12.4.1.d for a simplified configuration supported by SAMPro Version 9.1.611.057 and Above

This configuration addresses the scenario where an employee doesn’t get wages over and above the union wages (Earnings Group) specified in the Employee record's Default Tab. When entering a Bonus amount in the Labor Journal, the following special process is required so that their bonus amount will post:  

Create a special Pay Type record (e.g., OnCall for On Call Bonuses).

In the OnCall Pay Type Record, set the Default Earning Group to an OnCall group that has one line with $.01 as the pay rate.

The OnCall Pay Type should also reference a Deduction Group with no child lines.

 

When the Bonus is entered in the Labor Journal using the OnCall Pay Type, the penny will be ignored when the flat rate Bonus is entered.

12.4.1c Change Field: Bonus

A negative Bonus now posts to the GL correctly:  Debit to Accrued Payroll and Credit to Expense. Computing Payroll relieves Accrued Payroll correctly for amount of Gross Wages including Credited Bonus. This allows the user to enter bonus line with a negative amount to account for having to reduce a salaried employee's gross pay.

12.4.1d  Special Bonus Posting And Accrual Configuration (Union Wages) - Version 9.1.611.057 And Above

In previous releases, the bonus accrual did not work if the Employee Earnings tab had no wages; it was necessary to follow the procedures described in Customer Note 12.4.1.b when entering a Bonus amount in the Labor Journal.

In this release all that is needed is to set up the employee with an Earnings Id for $.00 on his Employee record - thus eliminating the need for that special Earnings Group for $.01. This Earnings Id will provide the information needed to derive the posting accounts. This enhancement eliminates the requirement that an hourly rate must be determined for posting values to populate from the bonus amount.  

12.4.2 Labor Journal Other Tab

Changed Field - Cost Category:
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

12.5 Employee Viewer

Users (with access to Employee records) must have Executive P/R flagged in their User record in order to access Employee records flagged as Executive Payroll.

12.5.1 Paid Time Off Tab

New Field - Max Hours:
This field supports PTO based on a Annual Maximum Balance (or Cap) for companies with a “Use it or Lose it” PTO policy. This field specifies the Cap or maximum total PTO hours 'in the bank' that  this employee is allowed to accrue for the specified Pay Type Id/Sate range.  When Compute Payroll is run, the accrued hours may be limited so that the Max Hours Cap is not exceeded.

Setup:
Typically, the  PTO tab would need to be set up based on the employees date hired (anniversary date) and Years of Service (i.e. 1-4yrs, 5-9yrs, 10-14yrs, 15+).

12.5.2 Rate Test Tab

New Fields:

Employee Viewer Rate Test Tab:
New Field: Select Rate Method to Test
By default, the Rate Method will be set to configuration currently in use (see table below). Switching to a different Method will automatically reset the Rate Tab to the values which would be obtained if that method were in effect.

Method

Implemented  Via

7687

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key:  LaborRatesAndAccrualMethod  Setting Value: 7687

6654

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key: LaborJobCostRateMethod    Setting Value: New

4124

Registry Id: sys-ffv-global-settings

Setting Key:LaborJobCostRateMethod  Setting Value: BurdenOnWagesOnly

989

Pay Type implemented as an option in the Employee Earnings and Earnings Group List tables

 

Pay Amount:
This field displays the result of the Pay Rate times the Hours specified.

Amount Cost:
This field displays the result of the Unit Cost times the Hours specified.

12.5.3 Defaults Tab

New Fields:

Direct Pay:

Overtime:
This field is only used to provide the default Overtime Pay Type Id for direct jobs on a specific custom time entry application. The field is limited to Pay Types set to a Job Use type of All or Direct and a Category of Overtime.

Doubletime:
This field is only used to provide the default Doubletime Pay Type Id for direct jobs on a specific custom time entry application. The field is limited to Pay Types set to a Job Use type of All or Direct and a Category of Doubletime.

Indirect Pay:

Overtime:
This field is only used to provide the default Overtime Pay Type Id for indirect (overhead) jobs on a specific custom time entry application. The field is limited to Pay Types set to a Job Use type of All or Indirect and a Category of Overtime.

Doubletime:
This field is only used to provide the default Doubletime Pay Type Id for indirect (overhead) jobs on a specific custom time entry application. The field is limited to Pay Types set to a Job Use type of All or Indirect and a Category of Doubletime.

Labor Rates:

Overtime:
This field is only used to provide the default Overtime Labor Rate on a specific custom time entry application.

Doubletime:
This field is only used to provide the default Doubletime Labor Rate on a specific custom time entry application.

12.5.4 Employee Recurring Wages Tab

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter.

12.5.5 Employee Recurring Other Tab

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter.

12.5.6 Employee User Fields Tab

New Fields - User 11-20:
Added User fields 11-20 for informational and reporting purposes.

12.5.7 Employee Taxes Tab

Tax for Authorities not marked 'Always Withhold' are only assessed for labor on Jobs referencing that Tax Authority, correcting a problem in recent releases.

12.5.8 Employee Deductions / Earnings Tabs

Registries are now required to automatically sort the Employee's Earnings and Deductions tabs, and the Earnings Group and Deduction Group child tabs. See Customer Note 16.6.3.

12.5.9 Employee Viewer Registy

Previously when the following registry was enabled, a warning would appear in the Employee Viewer when there were duplicate Social Security Numbers for other employees. This occurred every time the user saved, even if the SSN was not changed. Now, the warning only appears if the user edits the SSN field with a duplicate SSN. 
Id: sys-viewer-vemplye
Setting Key: AllowDuplicateTaxId    Setting Value: true

12.6  Compute Payroll

This release implements performance improvements in this function.  

This release corrects the setting of the Earnings Id where a 'fixed' earning amount type is specified (such as a Bonus amounts entered on the Employee Recurring Wages tab).  

New Display Only Field: Deduction Cycles
This display field the default Deduction Cycles specified in the selected Payroll Period.

Changed Field: Pay/Deduction Cycles To Include
This field now defaults from the Deduction Cycles field in the Payroll Period.

If a Pay Type is flagged as Union Exempt, the Employee's Earnings Group will NOT be written to PR History for this Pay Type when Compute Payroll is run.  This corrects an issue in previous releases where Union Exempt pay types appeared on Union reports.

This release corrects a sporadic virtual stack overflow error when OT Premiums are allocated.

This release implements intercompany processing for employer taxes (etc) allocated during the compute.

Payroll:

Payroll 941S updated to support larger quarterly wage/tax amounts fields. Previously, wages of more than $9,999,999.99 in a quarter were subject to truncation, now support $99,999,999.99. Tax fields added another character of precision. Release date: 11-15-2021

Compute Payroll:

In version 9.1.611.059 and up, this release refines Compute Payroll processing to allow for negative earnings AND negative taxes (except for annualized taxes e.g. federal & state tables) when the following existing registry is set.

In version 9.1.611.060 and up, this update resolves an issue with the Job Cost posting the regular rate instead of the BLENDED rate when an employee has accumulated over time. Before, posting to GL correctly used the BLENDED rate but posting to JobCost used the REGULAR rate from the employee record.

Previously in versions 9.1.611.057 and prior, SAMPro rounded the non-annualized taxes up by a penny. Versions 9.1.611.058 and up are no longer rounding the non-annualized taxes up by a penny. The 9.1.611.062 update now rounds the taxes up by a penny.

12.6.1 Hard Blocking by Branch

Compute Payroll now supports the Hard Block logic (implemented by the BranchFilterWithHardBlock global settings registry option) in this version.  The Hard Block is maintained regardless of how the Branch filter range is set.

12.6.2 Use It or Lose It PTO

Compute Payroll now supports PTO based on a Annual Maximum Balance (or Cap) for companies with a “Use it or Lose it” PTO policy. When Compute Payroll is run, the accrued hours may be limited so that the Max Hours cap (specified on the Max Hours field of the Employee's Paid Time Off tab) is not exceeded. If PTO hours are 'lost' to the Max Hours cap being exceeded, the hours and earning lost will be written to the PTO Hours Lost and PTO Earning Lost in Payroll History.

12.6.3 Refinements to Extra Withholding

In previous releases, if annualized Gross Pay was not high enough to qualify for a taxable rate line on an applicable Tax Table, extra withholding would not be applied. This release corrects this issue and allows the specified extra withholding to be applied. Note that if the extra withholding would result in negative net pay, the compute will return an error. This must be corrected (e.g., by temporarily reducing the extra withholding) before a check can be produced.

12.6.4 Garnishments

This release refines the disposable pay garnishment calculations for US and Canadian Payroll users where the garnishment is a percentage of disposable pay. These are now based on the settings of the new Disposable Income fields in the Deductions record.  See Customer Note 12.15.1 for details on these new fields.

12.6.5 Work Order Labor Reversal

This release better handles scenarios where the Work Order Labor tab is used to move hours from one Job to another. Previously, the system would sometimes post pennies to Job Cost for Work Order labor fixed-type fringes that were reversed, creating unbilled costs for the Work Order.

12.6.6 Start Compute PR - Intercompany Security

This release adds InterCompany Security to the Compute PR functionality. When using InterCompany, if an Employee's GL Entity is switched (on the Employee record) to a different Company/Security during the calendar year, Compute Payroll will now calculate payroll taxes with the correct annual limits and tax amounts for the new company or companies if multiple company moves are done during the year.  Tax types with annual limits include:  FUTA, SUTA & FICA (SS & MCAD).

A registry setting is NOT required to enable this new default behavior when using InterCompany.  No setting is required if Intercompany is NOT enabled.

Id: sys-compute-payroll

Setting Key: UseEmployeeCompanySecurity   Setting Value: true (true is the default)

*Warning*:  It should never be set to false when using InterCompany.

12.7 Start CPP Time Import

This update adds the Bonus Amount to the Start CPP Time Import function so users can import Taxable Reimbursements for their employees who receive different amounts each month for Vehicle usage.

The Security is now set using the same logic as manual Labor Journal entries.
Negative hours (with a leading minus) are supported in this version.

12.8 Earnings Viewer

New Fields - Earnings User3-5
These additional fields may be used for payroll setup.

Earnings Record Changed Fields - GL Debit changed to GL Debit (Indirect):

GL Account
The GL Account expense account earnings / accruals are posted to for Overhead (Indirect) Jobs when the Payroll and Post Payroll to GL functions are run.

GL Entity:
The Entity charged for expense for Overhead (Indirect) Jobs.

New Fields - GL Debit (Direct)

GL Account
The GL Account expense account earnings / accruals are posted to for Direct Jobs when the Payroll and Post Payroll to GL functions are run.

GL Entity:
The Entity charged for expense for Direct Jobs.

The database conversion process completes these new fields by from the original GL Debit fields.

12.8.0 Recent Update - Labor-to-GL Postings

This release corrects an issue where PR GL Accruals did not always select the correct Debit Direct GL Entity. This release modifies the setting of the Debit Direct GL Entity as follows:

If the Earnings record's GL Debit Direct GL Entity is blank, it is now set from the Job Cost Code on the Labor line. Previously, the GL Debit Indirect GL Entity in the Earning's record was used.

If the Earnings GL Debit Direct GL Entity is set, it will be used for Direct Jobs as before.

IMPORTANT: Completing the GL Entities in the Earnings records is not advisable for someone using Intercompany unless they establish multiple earnings id's for EACH COMPANY.

12.8.1 Earnings Viewer - Job Cost Hourly Rate Calculations (CIP Discounts)

In the original implementation, all N/A-type earnings were subject to CIP Discounting.  In this case, a flag has been added to the Earnings record to allow selection of specific N/A earnings to discount.

New Field - CIP Discount?
If this field is flagged and the Earnings Type is N/A, CIP Discounts will be applied to this Earning record.

Upgrade Note: If CIP Discounts were implemented in Version 9.0, this box MUST be flagged for the discounts to continue to be taken.

12.8.2 Earnings Record - Special Processing of W2 12:DD (HSA Employer Costs)

Some users wish to set up an Earnings Id to process W2 12:DD (HSA Employer Costs) and include this Earnings Id in regular PR processing. This procedure populated both prhstryernngs_amnt_ernngs & prhstryernngs_amnt_fringe fields. The W2 report sums (prhstryernngs_amnt_ernngs + prhstryernngs_amnt_fringe) which is causing the amount in box 12:DD to be overstated. 

NOTE: This processing does not follow the instructions in the Data-Basics EOY document.

In this release, setting the Earning record's User2 field to a value of FringeOnlyW2 changes the default behavior to only include prhstryernngs_amnt_frnge in the calculation for specific earnings on W2's which corrects the overstatement.

12.9 Deduction Groups

Registries are now required to automatically sort the Employee's Earnings and Deductions tabs, and the Earnings Group and Deduction Group child tabs. See Customer Note 16.6.3.

New Field - Classification Id:
This field has been added for reporting purposes at the level of distinction "by Union Classification."

New Fields: Deduction Group User3-5
These additional fields may be used for payroll setup.

12.9a Earnings Groups

Registries are now required to automatically sort the Employee's Earnings and Deductions tabs, and the Earnings Group and Deduction Group child tabs. See Customer Note 16.6.3.

12.10 Payroll Period

Users (with access to Payroll Periods) must have Executive P/R flagged in their User record in order to access Payroll Period records flagged as Executive Payroll. This release adds validation preventing a Payroll Period from being flagged as both Default and Executive Payroll.

12.10.1 Hours Tab

The Hours Tab is now filtered based on the User's Executive PR and Branch Filter fields. Data for Executive Payroll Employees (Executive P/R flagged in the Employee record) will only be displayed if the Executive PR? box is checked in their User record.

Filtering based on the User's Branch Filter only comes into play when the hard-block filtering option is turned on via the following registry setting:

Id: sys-ffv-global-settings
Setting Key: BranchFilterWithHardBlock    Setting Value:true

12.10.2 Main Tab

New Field: Executive Payroll
When this field is flagged, only users who have the Executive Payroll field flagged in their User record can:

Access the Payroll Period Record
Access Labor Journal Transaction for Executive Payroll Periods
Run Compute Payroll for Executive Payroll Periods
Print Payroll Checks for Executive Payroll Periods
Print PR Miscellaneous Deduction Checks for Executive Payroll Periods

The Executive Payroll status of the Payroll Period is NOT considered when printing W2's or T4's.  Employees flagged as Executive Payroll will only appear on these reports if the User running the report is flagged as Executive P/R.

Important Note: If the Executive Payroll box is checked, validation prevents the Default Payroll flag from being set.

 

New Field: Deduction Cycles
If completed, this field provides the default values for Start Compute Payroll's Pay/Deductions fields so that Deduction will not be accidentally skipped. Deduction Cycle information is maintained in the Deductions Group record (for union payroll) and the Employee Deduction tab (non-union). Up to five Deduction Cycles may be specified; they should NOT be separated by commas.

Examples:

If a Deduction Code of M is used for Monthly deductions, it would be entered in the Deduction Cycle of Payroll Periods used for Monthly pay.

If Deductions Codes are not used for Bonus pays, the Deduction Cycle could be set to XXXXX to prevent all Deductions from being taken. A Deduction will not be taken unless its cycle is specified; if a Deduction Cycle is blank in the Employee or Deduction Group, it will be taken if one of the Deduction Cycle fields in the Payroll Period is blank. Setting all fields to X or another character never used for Deduction Cycles will prevent this.

New Field: Accrue Bonus Pay
This box should be flagged if Bonus Pay entered for this Payroll Period should be accrued.

IMPORTANT:
If Bonus Pay should NEVER be Accrued, disable this field via registry.

This box may ONLY be checked if the sys-ffv-global-settings registry option LaborRatesAndAccrualMethod is set to 7687.

The sys-ffv-global-settings registry option AccrueBonusPay and Payroll Period User2 fields may be used to enable Bonus Pay Accrual instead of checking this box.  

12.10.3  Payroll Period Post History Button
