Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

The rules regarding allowed Cost Category Selection Types have changed as follows on this tab:

Work Order

Revised Cost Category Rules

Old Cost Category Rules

Required Resources Tab

ok: mat, oth, sub, eqp
error: lab

Inventory Item must use a Cost Type of material or equipment

ok: mat, oth, sub
error: lab, eqp

Inventory Item required a Cost Type of material.

 

In version 9.1.611.060 and up, this patch corrects an issue where manual adjustments to the Work Order Revenue Adjustments tab's Rate field did not properly update the Amount field the Rate included a percentage point.  The patch corrects this by copying the Rate field before dividing by 100 to prevent truncation of decimal points.

16.3.7 Work Order Main Tab

Previously, when a user had a Gross Margin tab open and made changes to the Labor, Inventory, or Other tabs and save, the Gross Margin tab did not display the changes made. This update corrects this defect. 

The Email address from the Site's upper Contacts tab is now displayed below the Site's Phone and Fax numbers.

Changed Field - Sub NTE:
The Field Label 'Sub NTE' has been changed to 'Sub/PO NTE' to better define it's meaning.

Changed Field - Work Requested:
This field has been expanded from 3000 to 6000 characters.

Master Contract Id: (requires a special v.cus file to display this field)
This field will be completed for Work Orders associated with Master Contracts when Create PM Work Order and Create PM Billing is run. It will also be set from New Call if the selected Equipment is associated with a Master Contract that is currently open or will be open in the future. This field supports custom reporting/analysis of full service contracts.

New Field: Email Address
When a Site is selected in New Call, the Client Site's Email field is now defaulted to the Work Order Email field. The user may manually update this field if desired before adding the Work Order. Escalations for the new Notification Source 'Work Order' will be sent to this address.

The Email address for the Scheduled Events is set when the WO is generated. Changing it in the Work Order after creation will not propagate the change to the Events themselves. See Customer Note 16.10.2 for additional information concerning this field.

16.3.7.1 Field Position Changes on Main Tab

The following fields have been repositioned on the Main tab to minimize scrolling on the wider screen monitors employed by most SAMPro user:

Moved from near the bottom of the Main tab to just below the Original WO field in the third column of fields:

Account Manager Id, Sales Manager Id, Dispatcher Id:

Display Fields moved from below the Original WO to the fourth column below the Return to Inventory button:

Esc. Profile Id, Gross Margin Id, Rate Schedule Id:

The Security Id and Company Id have been moved from near the bottom of the Main tab to the left of the Return to Inventory button.

16.3.7.2 Work Order Main Tab XOi Link

To further the SAMPro-TechAnywhere/XOi integration, an Open XOi Vision Info link button has been added to the Work Order's Main tab. When clicked, this button will launch a link/URL (with the use's default browser) to XOi's page, to display XOi "Jobs" linked to the selected Work Order (these are not SAMPro Jobs).This release allows the user to view Public (customer facing) or Full (contractor facing) data from this link. Previously only Public content was displayed.

The user will be alerted if XOi is implemented but XOi "Jobs" are not associated with this Work Order. If XOi is not implemented, nothing will happen when the button is clicked. This functionality is supported in MS SQL installations.

Implementation Details:

The way this works is that SAMPro will talk with Sampro Secure Communication on a local GlassFish/Payara web server. Sampro Secure Communication will then talk to DBXchange. DBXchange to XOi, and then back down the chain to SAMPro. This will require the following setup:

1. Installation/upgrade of the latest SamproSecureCommunication WAR file. It can be found in the usual location \\shares\FTP Updates\SAMPro Secure Communication\ . The SamproSecureCommunication2.1.zip or above is required.

 2. Installation of DBXchange (this should be in place because this integration is used for TechAnywhere).

Registry:

Id:  sys-dbxchange:

Setting Key: websitename  Setting Value: Full dbxchange URL   (ex. http://SERVER:8080/dbxchange)

Setting Key: server  Setting Value: Server/IP/DNS that hosts SamproSecureCommunication   (ex. SERVER)

Setting Key: port  Setting Value: Port that hosts SamproSecureCommunication     (ex. 8080)

Important: The registry entries for sys-dbxchange are cached and only take effect after logging out of SAMPro and back in.

16.3.8 Work Order Import Flat Rate

If the registry DeferTaxStatusDecision is set to true, the Flat Rate Revenue line imports correctly. Previously, only the costs were imported.

16.3.9 Work Order Call Script Tab

New Field - Tech Id:
The new Tech Id field is set with the Technician's Id if the Call Script is updated from TechAnywhere.

16.3.10 Work Order Equipment Tab

Version 9.1.611.058 corrects a spurious "Registry entry Error no such field exists" when right-click opening a list of Equipment. This release fixes the issue with registry entries for both required and disabled fields in other viewers as well.

New Field: Under Contract
This display-only field defaults from the Site Equipment's Under Contract box.

Changed Field - Cycle Code Filter: When manually adding a line, the Cycle Code's 'CC' filter is now pulled from the line's Work Code to filter the Metrics lines that are automatically added. This release correctly sets the Cycle Code Filter when Equipment is manually added with a Work Code referencing a Cycle Code. This will prevent TechAnywhere sync issues resulting from an incorrectly formatted filter.  

Changed Field - Work Requested:
This field has been expanded from 3000 to 6000 characters.

Changed Field - Work Perform:
This field has been expanded from 3000 to 6000 characters.

16.3.11 New Work Order Tab: Milestones

The Milestones Tab was initially designed to be populated the Project Work Order Generator. This release allows Milestones to be added to any Work Order for reporting purposes.

Tip: If using the Milestones on a manually created Work Order, first set the Date Must Complete and the Time Must Complete and SAVE the Work Order before added the Milestones. The Milestone's End Date/Time are controlled by the Days/Time Offset fields and the Work Order's Date/Time must complete.

Also in this release, if the user changes the Milestone's End Date/Time, the Days/Time Offset fields will automatically be updated (if the Fixed Date / Time boxes are not checked).

See Customer Note 16.17.4 for additional information on using this tab.

16.3.12 Work Order Technician Tab

In SAMPro 9.1.611.061 and above, this update adds an "UpdateTechStatus" as a new option/button that can be launched from the left-hand side of the Work Order Viewer. When selected, a modal window will display with two input fields: “From” and “To.” If all tech lines on a work order have the same status, the From field will be pre-populated with the status. Otherwise, a drop-down list appears to let the user select a "From:" status. For the To: field, a drop-down list appears to let users select a "To:" status and only a single status may be selected.

In SAMPro 9.1.611.058 and above, when the user adds a new Tech line, the New Call (sys-newcall) registry keys DefaultStartDate and DefaultStartTime will be used to provide a default date and time scheduled.

The following tech Statuses have been added with their corresponding Work Escalation Status: Parts Backorder, Parts Issue and  Parts Shipped. These new statuses fall above Parts Received and below Parts Ordered in precedence.

A new tech Status, Wait Tracking, has been added; it has a corresponding Work Order Escalation Status of Wait Tracking (Status Category Completed), This new status falls above Completed and below Over Budget in precedence.

A new tech Status, Over Budget, has been added; it has a corresponding Work Order Escalation Status of Over Budget (Status Category Completed), This new status falls above Completed and below Wait Paperwork in precedence.

'Purchases Blocked' subcontractor Technicians may NOT be selected on the Tech tab. Previously, this validation was only applied to "Payments Blocked" technicians. See Customer Note 16.16.1 for details.

This release refines the update of the Purchase Order if one Subcontractor Tech (with a referenced PO) is changed to another. The AP Term in the PO is forced to match the terms from the Vendor record, even if blank (unless overridden by customization). The PO's Sales Tax Group is updated from either the Vendor (by default) or Job record (if the DefaultPOTaxGroupFromJob is set to true in sys-viewer-vprchseordrlst registry).

16.3.13 Work Order Purchases Tab

Previously, the Work Order Purchases Tab always displayed the quantities Received and Vouchered as 0.00 (zero) if a Purchase Change Order was created after PO Receipts, even if the items had been received. In this release, the quantities Received and Vouchered are always displayed correctly.

16.3.14 Work Order List

This release corrects a display problem in Work Order List views that included the Work Order Work Requested on the list. In earlier versions of 9.1 certain fields on the list would appear blank.

When searching for Work Order Techs with the WorkOrdersByBranchIDByWorkOrderID' list enabled, only the Primary Tech will be included in the search. The Primary Tech has been added to the list to avoid confusion.

16.3.15 Work Order Log Tab

This release corrects an issue where the Map It functionality) that did not work correctly if a newer version of Chrome is the default browser.  If the Latitude and Longitude fields are completed, clicking this button once again launches Google Maps with the coordinates completed.

When Service Compute is run, an entry to the WO's Log Tab will be made: set the Status to Billed, the Date Logged and Work Date to today's date, and the User Id to person running the Compute.

16.3.16 Work Order Get Costs / Import Costs Wizard

The Work Order's Get Costs function now works differently depending on whether or not it has been quoted. The decision as to whether or not a WO has been quoted looks for Quote Scope records with a status of Accepted or Approved.  It also restricts the list to only those Scopes that are for the WO currently in the viewer.  

IMPORTANT: This enhancement should reduce the need to manually adjust imported revenue on quoted Work Orders. However, note that it is always important to review the billing details on a Work Order before it is invoiced.

Importing Costs if the Work Order has been Quoted

If the Work Ordered has been Quoted:

Costs will be imported at $0 Revenue to avoid double-billing.

The user will not be asked about importing Revenue Adjustments to avoid changing any special adjustments from the Quote.

Importing Costs if the Work Order has NOT been Quoted

The following registry may be implemented to prompt the user if they wish to import revenue adjustments when importing costs to a Work Order that is not associated with a Quote. If the user clicks Yes (to import revenue adjustments), it will have the same result as clicking the Adjust Revenue button on the Gross Margin tab.

Registry:

Id: sys-viewer-vwrkordr

Setting Key: PromptForRevenueAdjustmentsWhenImportingCosts  Setting Value: true (default false)

16.3.17 Work Order View Reports Button

The new View Reports button been added to the sidebar of the Work Order viewer. When enabled, it will allow users to select from a list of appropriate reports for the viewer. The following registry settings allow you to specify one or more reports to be run from the Work Order. One registry would be made for each report to be accessed from the Work Order.  

If only one report is specified, it will be launched when the button is clicked with the selected Work Order Id inserted in the report's Work Order Id range.  If more than one registry has been generated, a list of reports to select from will be selected.

Registry Id: sys-rprt-vwrkordr:report name

A separate Registry Id must be made for each report.  Note the colon that separates the first part of the Id field from the report name.

Setting Key: MenuTitle    Setting Value: report name or other text

This option defines the title displayed on the Menu for this report if multiple reports are specified.

Setting Key: FunctionId  Setting Value: user-defined function Id of report

This key specifies the user-define function associated with the report.

Setting Key: Range~wrkordr.id  Setting Value: wrkordr.id

The registry specifies that, when the report is launched, the report's Work Order Id range will set with the selected Work Order Id it was launched from.

Example: Entry for Work Order Profitability

Registry Id: sys-rprt-vwrkordr:Report Work Order Profitability
Setting Key: MenuTitle    Setting Value: WO Profitability
Setting Key: FunctionId  Setting Value: DWOPRFT
Setting Key: Range~wrkordr.id  Setting Value: wrkordr.id

Note: Initial Values and Graphics
The standard sys-report-functionId registry should be used to set initial report values other than ranges. Initial values and bitmap registries are not supported from the sys-rprt-vwrkordr:report name registry.

16.3.18 Work Order Other Info tab

Changed Field - Work Order Escalation Status:
The Work Order Escalation Statuses of Travel, Onsite and On Break have been added to support additional granularity in Scheduled Events and reporting.   These statuses were previously grouped together as Active. When the a Work Order is escalated in this release, the Work Order Escalation Status will be set to Travel, Onsite or On Break (as applicable) if previously it would have be set to Active.  This may impact existing range settings, reports and analytics.

16.3.19 Work Order Quoted and Revenue Adjustment Lines  - CHANGE TO DEFAULT BEHAVIOR

This change addresses an issue with the Quoted Revenue lines on a Work Order and how they are feeding the Job EOM function.  In previous releases, the Effective Date on Work Order's Quoted Inventory and Other lines was the origination date of the Quote; Quoted Work Order Labor lines were set to the Quote's approval date. Since the origination date could be months in the past, this caused issues with recognizing revenue way too early through the Job EOM function.

In this release, when the Work Order is set to Invoice Ready and saved, the Effective Date of Quoted lines will be updated (or not) as follows:

1. If the Work Order Date Work Completed is blank (set to 1900-01-01), Quoted lines will not updated.

2. If the Date Work Completed was set, Quoted lines will have their Effective Dates updated to the Date Work Completed.

3. Lines that are not Quoted will not be impacted.

4. The Effective Dates on the Quoted lines DON'T change after the Work Order is billed if the user changes the Date Work Completed.

If the Date Work Completed is set, this code will also update Revenue Adjustment lines with the Date Work Completed when the Work Order is set to Invoice Ready with the following exceptions:

1. If the Revenue Adjustment's Description is blank do not update the date.

2. If the Revenue Adjustment has been billed (the Invoice Id is set in the line), do not update the date.

3. If the Revenue Adjustment is a special *Accrual* line (for PreventiveMaint Work Orders) to not update the date.

4. Don't adjust RevAdj Effective Date unless line has a dollar value (prevents setting the date on an 'empty' line)

Registry to Required Date Work Completed

A registry entry is available to require that the Work Order Date Work Completed is completed when the WO is marked Invoice Ready.

Id: sys-viewer-vwrkordr

Setting Key: RequireDateCompletedToInvoiceQuotes  Setting Value: true (default false)

NOTE: This registry should NOT be added unless the company has chosen the option 2 method of handling T&M work in the Job EOM registry:

Id: sys-job-eom

Setting Key: T&M Setting Value: Revenue

Time & Material Alternatives:

Option 2. Increase Period Revenue (T&M=Revenue)

Income for ‘unbilled’ T&M activity is ‘recognized’

 DR=WIP  CR=INCOME

16.3.20 Work Order COD Tab

Process Payment Button - New OpenEdge/Global Payments Functionality: This change applies only if the new Open Edge payment processing is enabled via the global registry setting Setting Key: defaultpaymentprocessor  Setting Value: OEDBX.

If the Client Site has a payment alias stored, and the user clicks the Process Payment button on the WO COD tab, they will be asked if they want to run this WO COD payment using that credit card on file. If they click yes, it will process the payment then and there and CC transaction information will write back to the WO COD line. If they click No to the question, they will be taken to the usual manual cc entry screen. The old idea behind a work order payment alias and charging a projected invoice amount (the way this used to work) has been discontinued. This change will NOT impact users running the old Open Edge functionality or EP users.

CC Trx: Checks applied to the Work Order COD tab from TechAnywhere no longer set the CC Trx field with the Check Number. After invoicing this resulted in Cash Receipts being ineligible for editing.

Changed Field - GL Entity:
Previous validation logic associated with manually entered WO-COD lines used the Job's primary GL Entity instead of the A/R GL Entity. In this release, the Job's A/R GL Entity is defaulted first.

Work Order Viewer: 

In version 9.1.611.059 and up, users can now use a payment alias or decline to use an alias and manually provide credit card numbers. In previous versions, Work Order COD did not have a functional option to store and use a credit card from the client site.

16.3.21 UWO Tab  for Taylor Universal WOs

This update adds the option of Travel (“T”) as a Unit of Measurement to the Other Rate IDs used on the Work Order Other tab. This is a customized for Taylor Universal Work Order.

This update adds a field on the Work Order UWO tab to accommodate the six (6) digit numerical value for the Factory Authorization number, when applicable.
New Field: uwo.fctry-athrztn-nmbr

The following validations will only be performed if the Work Order is flagged as a UWO Work Order by setting the WO Type field on the UWO tab. Note also that, consistent with other UWO validations, these validations are performed only when the Save Record is attempted.

The system does not allow a Work Order to be saved if the “Recall Due To” field on the UWO tab is other than “N/A”  but the “Work Order Type” field on the Main tab is other than “Call Back” (i.e. the Work Order is not a Recall).

The system does not allow a Work Order to be saved if the "Rewrite Parts Received" field on the UOW tab is other than "N/A" but the "Original WO" field on the Main tab is blank (i.e. the Work Order is not a Rewrite).

The system does not allow a Work Order to be flagged as both a Rewrite and a Recall.

16.4 TechFinder

16.4.1 Multiple Certification Support

Certification tabs have been added to the Equipment (see Customer Note 2.3.2) and Site (see Customer Note 2.4.1) records. Also see Customer Note 16.1.9 for a Registry to add Work Code Certifications to TechFinder

When TechFinder is launched from New Call, the Certification from the Equipment's Main Tab is listed on the Certification range (along with those from the Equipment's and Site's Certifications tabs and the Work Code). This list is prepended with an ampersand & so that only those Techs with all the Certifications listed appear in TechFinder.

When TechFinder is launched from the Dispatch Board or Work Order Tech tab, all Certifications from the Work Order's Site, first Equipment Id, and Work Code (if registry enabled) will be listed. This list is prepended with an ampersand & so that only those Techs with all the Certifications listed appear in TechFinder.

16.4.2 New Work Order Escalation Statuses

By default, TechFinder looks at the escalation status of the work order as well as the individual tech statuses when determining which work orders to display.  In version 9.1.611.052, the escalation values supported (in the absence of a registry) included 'active' but not the new statuses of 'travel', 'onsite' or 'on break'. In Version 9.1.611.053, the new statuses of 'travel', 'onsite' and 'on break' have been added to the default work order escalation statuses supported in TechFinder.

16.5 Master Contract

In 9.1.611.061c and up, this update corrects a defect when registries to enable master client site equipment tables are activated, the association with what equipment is covered was broken.

In 9.1.611.061 and up, this update corrects a defect where, in the Master Contract, the billings and earnings were not correctly displayed due to a missing reference. Now the billings/earnings display as they should. 

Previously, Master Contracts were allowed to be created for multiple sites, which produced a warning. Now when a master contract is created for duplicate sites, it produces an error and does not allow duplication.

When PM's are generated for contracts with TimeofServiceBill? box flagged, the Cost Category will always be set on the WO Other tab.

16.5.1 Site List Tab

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

16.5.2  Main Tab

Changed Field: Cost Category
This field now supports enhanced filtering provided by the Cost Code's Job Cost Category Usage Filter. Cost Categories are validated (relative to Cost Codes) during data entry upon leaving the Cost Category Id field.  The full relationship is validated again when leaving a child line or saving a record.

New Field: Original Start Date:
This informational field may be used to record the original Start Date of the Master Contract.

16.5.3 Schedule Tab

Changed Field: Date Scheduled - Leapday Not Allowed
February 29th (leapday) can cause issues with the new Master Contract Equipment functionality as well as with scheduling / billing into coming years that are not leap years. February 29th is no longer allowed to be entered as a date in the Adv. Bill or Schedule tabs, or the Master Contract saved with February 29th in the Adv. Bill or Schedule tabs; the error "Invalid Month Number Entered" will be displayed if this date is found.

By default,  you can't adjust scheduled or billed lines that have been generated but the following registry allows you to do so if absolutely necessary to change 2/29 to 2/28 so a record can be saved:

Id:  sys-viewer-vmstrcntrct

Setting Key: RemoveValidations  Setting Value: true

Changed Field: ScvTasksId:
In previous releases, if a Service Task Id wasn't specified on the Schedule tab of PM Master Contract then no Task List was attached to the PM Work Order generated from that line.  In this release, if the Service Task Id is blank, the system now looks to see if there is one specified in the Client Site Equipment. This Service Task will be defaulted to the Client Site Equipment PM Schedule and then to the PM Work Order itself. This enhancement allows for different Task Lists to be assigned by the Equipment scheduled. If a Service Task List is specified on the Master Contract's Schedule line, it will continue to be used for all Equipment scheduled for from that line. See Customer Note 16.1.6 for a registry to disable the new behavior.

16.5.4 Time of Service Earned Enhancements

This release allows for handling of multiple sites when TimeOfService Earn? is set to Y. Additionally, when Revenue Values as %? is set to Y along with TimeOfService Earn? users may specify a percentage value in Revenue Per Visit on each Schedule line of the contract.

When only TimeofService? is set to Y and multiple sites are specified - the system will evenly prorate the revenue on the corresponding RevAdjust lines that are added to the Preventive Maintenance Work Orders generated through Start Create PM Workorders.

When both the TimeOfService? and Revenue Values as %? fields are set to Y with multiple sites specified - the system calculates the percentage of revenue specified in the Revenue Per Visit field based on the Site Contract Value. This percentage is reflected in the RevAdjust lines on the Preventive Maintenance Work Order generated through Start Create PM Workorders. The sum of the Revenue Per Visit on all Schedule lines must equal 100% in the Master Contract record. If the user fails to enter a percentage in the Revenue Per Visit field the system will evenly prorate the revenue.

Note - the Advanced Billing will still be prorated evenly across all months set to Bill? on the Setup/Renew tab of the Master Contract.

16.5.4a Recent Update to PM Work Orders 

Inconsistent Behavior for Revenue Adjustment lines on PM Work Orders

This update corrects a defect where revenue adjustment lines on PM work orders would not appear for PM Contracts because of one of the following scenarios:
If a Site Contract value was not specified for the Time of Service Earn 
If multiple PM Contracts were processed in a batch in which one PM Contract was Time of Service Earn and its individual Schedule lines did not specify an Amount Earned value.

Create PM Work Orders for Master Contracts with Revenue Values as % and Scheduled Hours as %

For Master Contracts flagged as Time of Service Earn? and Revenue Values as % the contract earnings are now correctly distributed among the preventative maintenance work orders for active equipment associated with the Master Contract and active equipment flagged as under contract when Create PM Work Orders is run.  Previously, the Revenue Values were incorrectly calculated based on ALL Equipment flagged as Under Contract, include inactive Equipment and Equipment associated with a different Master Contract.

This release also corrects the allocation of Hours for Master Contracts flagged as Scheduled Hours as % to active Equipment associated with the Master Contract and active Equipment flagged as under contract (but not associated with another Master Contract). 

16.5.4b Recent TOS Updates

In Version 9.1.611.058 and above, if all Schedule lines for the Site have $0 Revenue Per Visit, TOS Earned is checked  and the Revenue as Percent box is blank, the Site's Total Contract amount is treated as evenly distributed across the Equipment's PMSchedule Contract Values for Scheduled lines. This corrects a problem in previous releases where, if the Time Of Service Earned box was checked but the Revenue as Percent box was blank, NO revenue adjustment was written to the Work Order so that the deferred revenue was never earned.

16.5.5 Master Contract Equipment Tab

Users may now edit the Under Contract status of Equipment records without the list being resorted. This makes it easier to work with very large contracts.

16.5.6 Master Contract Setup / Renew Tab - Auto Populate Button

This enhancement makes the Setup/Renew functionality on the Schedule tab work similarly to the ADV Bill tab. Where possible, the system will now maintain existing values when a Schedule line corresponding to the <Inspect?> selection is already present instead of regenerating the whole tab from scratch.  This allows the user to update the Schedule tab on an existing Master Contract, or a cloned contract without having to manually reset individual fields.

The system performs the match relative to the inspection MONTH only, even if the Day is also updated.

For the PartType Flag setting & SvcTaskId - use the current values on the Schedule tab when Setup/Renew is pressed.

For Hours, Work Code, EscProfile - when corresponding Parent Setup/Renew tab fields are NOT set, use the existing Schedule tab values.

For Work Code, EscProfile.values - when corresponding Parent Setup/Renew tab fields ARE set use them to reset lines that do not have corresponding values.  

Always Refresh <Da> value per designated Wks. Day setting on parent and Hours if set in the parent.

16.5.6a Master Contract -Setup/Renew Tab - Contract Total and Amount By Site

Changed Field - Contact Total:
This field was previously unlabeled. This display field calculates the total amount of the contract for all Sites when Auto Populate is hit. It is maintained by the system based on how the contract is configured - Amount By Site X the number of Sites on the Site list, OR the sum of the Values fields on the Site tab.

Changed Field: Amount By Site (was Contract Amount):
This field should only be used for Single Site contracts OR if multiple Sites do NOT need differing amounts specified by Site. If there are values on the Site list the system does not allow entry into this field. When this field is completed, it is used to generate the values on the Advanced Billing tab when Auto Populate is clicked. Since this field itself is not saved, the user will be reminded to Auto Populate when saving the record if it is greater than zero but the sum of the Advanced Billed lines is zero.

This field no longer attempts to calculate the average of Site List Contract Values which resulted in a "Site Contract and Bill Amounts are both used" error message in previous releases.

16.5.7 Master Contract Equipment Table Enhancement

In previous releases, Site Equipment records could only be specifically associated with one Master Contract at time.  This enhancement allows Client Site equipment to be associated with multiple Master Contract records by the addition of the new Master Contract Equipment table.  In addition, this allows a Master Contract to be 'cloned' with all of its equipment when the contract is renewed; previously it was necessary to change all of the old equipment over on the Master Contract's Equipment tab when cloning.

This enhancement is available for MS SQL database installations; Sybase is not supported.

Setup and Conversion

Your support representative will need to use the revised Advanced Analytics Installer Script to create the new Master Contract Equipment table and create or update the Stored Procedure associated with it.

A global registry setting turns on the new feature but the necessary preparation with the script must be completed first by your support representative.

Id: sys-ffv-global-settings   (this must ONLY be set in the base registry!)

Setting Key: UseMasterContractEquipmentTable  Setting Value: true

Master Contract Tab Registry: The system will check if the registry Setting Key ChildTabs exists in sys-viewer-vmstrcntrct. If so, the user will be alerted that 'this must be disabled or adjusted to accommodate the new Master Contract Equipment child tab'. To display the equipment child tab, if the registry sys-viewer-vmstrcntrct has the registry key “childtabs”, it needs to include ‘mcequipflp’. All available child tabs:  

sitelist,advbill, schedule,listequipment,listWOopen,listWOother,mcequipflp

Data conversion to generate the new Master Contract Equipment (MCE) table is performed when initially activating the new feature as discussed above.  This conversion loads the MCE table with data based on each Client Site Equipment(CSE) record’s current association to a Master Contract(MC) either in the Equipment record or as part of the Client Site Equipment PM Schedule.  

Master Contract Viewer

When the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry set to true, it effectively allows for a single Client Site Equipment (CSE) record to have simultaneous associations to multiple Master Contracts (MC).  By using this new feature, the historical perspective of all MC-CSE associations can be maintained rather than having to switch equipment from one Master Contract to another when one ends and another begins. The data conversion process populates the new MCE table based on references to MCs found in CSE records.  Additional processing also creates additional MCE rows based on references to MCs found in CSE PM Schedule lines.  

Master Contract -  Equipment Child Tab

When the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry set to true, the previous version of this tab is replaced by a newer, more functional list-type tab.  It still serves the basic purpose of identifying covered CSE records. When a Master Contract record is loaded into the viewer, this tab will be populated with every active CSE record from every Client Site (CS) listed on the Site List tab.  The user will never have the option of manually entering CSE Ids.

Covered:
If this column is set to 'Yes' the Equipment is covered by this Master Contract. This tab uses the right-mouse click as the toggle switch for identifying Covered vs non-Covered CSE records as in previous releases.  Double-clicking a line will open the selected CSE record.

Site Id:  Site Name: Equipment Id:  Equipment Name:  Mfg: Model: Serial No: Type: MCErn: SCEru:

This tab also includes CheckAll and ClearAll buttons.  It should be noted that CheckAll and ClearAll are sensitive to any filtering that has been applied to the list.  Only the filtered rows are affected by the check buttons.  For example, filtering to a single Site and pushing CheckAll makes all CSE from that Site Covered.

Master Contract Site List Child Tab

Validation now prevents adding the same Site multiple times. The Line Insert w/Copy action clears the Site Id to prevent accidental duplication of Site Ids. Adding a new Site Id adds all active CSE records for the Site to the new Equipment tab.  Each added CSE record defaults to not Covered.

Removing or changing a Site now has validation that prevents its removal if the Site or any of its CSE records have posted references to the MC.  These references might exist on either the CS-PMBilling or the CSE-PMSchedule child tabs.  When posted MC references exist, the Site cannot be removed but the individual CSE records can still be set to NOT Covered on the new MSE child.  See below for definitions of posted. Note: similar validation and messaging occurs if an attempt is made to delete a child row that violates the above.

Posted Client Site - PMBilling Tab

References to the Master Contract found on the Client Site - PMBilling tab are considered posted when either the PM Invoice Id contains an Invoice Id or the Posted to GL flag is True.  

Posted Client Site Equipment - PMSchedule

References to the Master Contract found on the Client Site Equipment - PMSchedule are considered posted when the PM WO Id field contains a Work Order Id.  

Master Contract Schedule Child Tab

hen the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry is set to true, entry in the line’s Cost Per Visit field is not allowed.  The message "This database is configured to use the Master Contract Equipment table. Use of this field is not permitted" will be displayed.

Master Contract. Provider Rates Child Tab

Revenue: When the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry is set to true, entry in the line’s Revenue field is not allowed. The message "This database is configured to use the Master Contract Equipment table. Use of this field is not permitted" will be displayed.

Master Contract Billing History Parent Tab

When the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry is set to true, this list is built using the Advanced Analytics function with the following additional column:

Source:

The Source column indicates where the information is being pulled from:

'MC' indicates a predicted event based on the current definition in the Master Contract.

'CS' identifies lines already written to the Client Site's PM Billing tab.  This is the result of running the Start Create PM Billings function.

Master Contract InspectionHistory Parent Tab

When the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry is set to true, this list is built using the Advanced Analytics. It includes the additional Source column:   

Source:
When the Source is 'MCE', the line is predicted based on the Master Contract definition.

When the Source is 'CSE', the line exists on the Client Site Equipment PM Schedule tab.

Master Contract Main Tab

The MC viewer’s Main form now includes the Build Out PM WOs button. It will be available to all installs using the Master Contract Equipment table in a future release. The Build Out button may be disabled via registry if needed.

Additional Changes to Support the Master Contract Equipment Table

The following changes will be made to several viewers to support this enhancement.

Client Site Viewer Changes

Client Site - SiteEquipment Tab

With the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry set to true, processing for the SiteEquipment list has changed slightly so that the Contract Start and End Dates are displayed and a Status column added.

Equipment Id:  Name:  Contract#: Starts:  Ends:   Mfg: Model: S/N:

This tab displays active Client Site Equipment associated with this Site. It also lists the Master Contract or Contracts the equipment is associated with. You may double-click on an Equipment line to launch the Client Site Equipment viewer for that record.

Status:

The Status column indicates the status of the Master Contract (if any) associated with the Equipment. If multiple contracts exist for a piece of equipment, multiple equipment lines may be displayed.

Active:  Today's date falls within the Master Contract Start and End Dates. If a Master Contract's Date Cancelled falls after today's date it will appear as Active.

Pending:  Today's date falls before the Master Contract Start Date.

NoContract: The equipment is not assigned to a Master Contract

Expired: The equipment is assigned to an expired Master Contract - today's Date falls after the End Date of the Master Contract.  Note that status filtering must be set to show Expired Contracts.

Cancelled: The equipment is assigned to a cancelled Master Contract - today's Date falls after the Cancelled Date of the Master Contract.  Note that status filtering must be set to show Cancelled Contracts.

Client Site Equipment Viewer

MasterSchedule tab

With the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry set to true, processing for the MasterSchedule list is produced as noted below using the Advanced Analytics function.

Contract Id:
Lines without a Contract Id were entered on the Client Site Equipment PM Schedule tab. Lines with a Contract Id were manufactured from a Master Contract Id.

Source:
When the Source is 'MCE', the line is predicted based on the Master Contract definition.

When the Source is 'CSE', the line exists on the Client Site Equipment PM Schedule tab.

Work Order:
When a 'CSE' line has a Work Order Id, it has already been through the Create PM Workorder process. 'CSE' Lines with a Contract Id If but no Work Order Id were manufactured through the Build Out Process but have not yet had the PM Work Order generated.  

Start Create New Billing Schedule from Old
Start Create New PM Work Schedule from Old
Start Renew Service Contracts

With the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry set to true, each of the above starter functions has been changed so that lines from the Old schedule are ignored when they have references to Master Contracts. In the case of Start Create New PM Work Schedule From Old, lines will NOT be copied if the Client Site Equipment parent record references a Master Contract even if the lines in the old schedule do not. Lines referencing MCs will get replicated in other ways.

Create PM Work Orders

When the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry set to true, this function assigns total estimated hours and TOS$ to the first Equipment record (by ID) on each Master Contract-based PM that includes multiple Equipment.

Create PM Work Orders Checklist

By default, the 'Do' box may NOT be cleared for Master Contract lines to assure that associated costs and revenues are in sync with Master Contract values. It may still be cleared for non Master Contract lines. The Clear All button only clears non-Master Contract lines. The Check All button checks all lines. A registry may be enabled to allow lines associated with the Master Contract to be disabled. This change is true whether or not the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry is set to true. This change was made to prevent issues with Time of Service Earned and Billed Master Contracts being improperly billed / earned.  See Customer Note 16.1.4d for a registry to allow lines to be deselected.

Create PM Billings

When the UseMasterContractEquipmentTable global registry set to true, this process uses the new database Function to interpret Master Contract definitions.

16.5.8 Adv. Billing Tab

Changed Field: Date Scheduled - Leapday Not Allowed
February 29th (leapday) can cause issues with the new Master Contract Equipment functionality as well as with scheduling / billing into coming years that are not leap years. February 29th is no longer allowed to be entered as a date in the Adv. Bill or Schedule tabs, or the Master Contract saved with February 29th in the Adv. Bill or Schedule tabs; the error "Invalid Month Number Entered" will be displayed if this date is found.

By default,  you can't adjust scheduled or billed lines that have been generated but the following registry allows you to do so if absolutely necessary to change 2/29 to 2/28 so a record can be saved:

Id:  sys-viewer-vmstrcntrct

Setting Key: RemoveValidations  Setting Value: true

16.5.9 CVS Import of Master Contract Sites

A new CSV button has been added to the side toolbar of the Sites child tab of the Master Contract Viewer.  It allows the user to add lines from a .cvs file to a brand new Master Contract record.

When the .CSV button is pressed it verifies that the viewer is a New Record and that no changes have been made to the record before presenting a file selection dialog to access a provided CSV.  

The .cvs file must include a header row specifying the following columns that will define the lines that will be added to the Master Contract's Sites column:

Site Id
Job Id
Job Cost Code Id
Billing Item Id
Cost Category Id
Contract Values
Contract Hours

All of the Id lines must specify valid record Id's. the Values and Hours columns must be numeric.

If any value for a new line is considered invalid, that line is skipped and after all lines have been processed the user will be presented with a text box containing a list of the errors and the error.log file will also contain the errors.

Once the Site lines have been added, complete the Master Contract and be sure to save it.

16.6 Escalation Profile

16.6.1 Child Tab

Click Magnify

New Field: Disabled
When this field is flagged, this event will be ignored when scheduled events are generated for a new Weblog or Work Order. Weblogs and Work Orders created before line was flagged as disabled will not be impacted; the Scheduled Event will still be processed.

16.6.2 Tokens

This release supports tokens for the Latitude and Longitude fields in the Client Site. The token ^clntste.geo_code_latitude^ references Latitude and ^clntste.geo_code_longitude^ references Longitude.

The new ^workperformedall^ token displays the Equipment Id, Name and Work Performed of all Equipment lines on the Work Order when the Scheduled Event is executed.

The new IVR Instructions field on the Client Site record may be used in escalation emails (using the token ^clntste_ivr^) to the Technician. It is also designed for future use in TechAnywhere.

16.6.3 Emailing Documents Attached After Work Order Creation

Previously, to attach SAMPro documents to an escalation profile email, you had to select the documents by category at the time of New Call creation. This would add those documents to the work order at that time, and only those documents could be attached to the notification email. In this release, you can specify which categories of documents will be attached on each individual line of the escalation profile. This allows for documents added after initial creation to be attached to the corresponding email as the work order's technician status changes.

To attach documents to escalation notifications based on pre-determined document categories listed in Function Parameters field of Escalation Profile:

The document(s) must be attached to the work order prior to the specified status change to be eligible for attachment.

The Attach Document flag must be checked on child line of escalation profile. Hit the green plus sign on the top left corner of the escalation profile line to show the Function Parameters field. Set the document categories you wish to attach to the notification that is triggered by that lines status change. “Categories=” will precede a comma delimited list of valid document categories.

Tip: Double click the Category field in any document viewer in SAMPro to view a list of valid Document Categories. Custom Document Categories may be added manually and will be included if specified.  ***NOTE – SAMPro generated invoices are given a category of “Invoice” (not “Invoices”) and MUST be specified as such in the escalation profile for inclusion.

Important: The document must be a filetype capable of opening via email. We recommend autosavefiletype = PDF  be set in all report registries for the documents you wish to attach via escalation profile. Reports that autosave as a .dbr can only be opened in SAMPro and therefore will not open via email. Any/all pre-existing document records should be converted from .dbr to PDF before utilizing this functionality.

Example:

Status From: Parts Received

Status To: Completed

Function Parameters: Categories=Quote,VendorInvoice

In the example above, any document with a category of Quote or VendorInvoice that is attached to the work order prior to that status change will be attached to the email and sent to the contact specified in the Notify Id.

16.6 4  Account Manager Notifications

When a Notification Category is set to Account Manager, the Work Order's Account Manager's Contact Record Email Address is used to derive the 'email to' of the scheduled event.  Previously, the Site's Account Manager was always used, regardless of whether is was set in the Equipment record or changed in New Call. Note that if the Account Manager is cleared in New Call the selected Site's Account Manager Contact will continue to be used for Account Manager Notifications and Alarms.

16.6.5 New Escalation Profile Action Types

2 new escalation profile Action Types have been added:

AlarmR - recurring alarm
NotificationR - recurring notification

When a recurring alarm or notification is executed, the scheduled event will be sent back to OnHold so that it can be run again. These events would typically be used to ensure that service or account managers were alerted if a work order repeatedly achieved a certain status.

The recurring-type events can ONLY be used for events identified as Contingent; this has been added as validation in the Escalation Profile viewer.

The recurring alarms and notifications cannot be used for Tech-based notifications (also enforced by validation). .

For example, a business case for this new feature could be to build a Recurring Notification that triggers when the escalation status changes from Active to WaitcustApprvl. If it triggers and executes, the system would reset the Escalation Event to OnHold so that if the work order ever gets set to WaitCustApprvl again it would execute again (and subsequently go back on hold).

16.6.6 New Work Order Escalation Statuses

This enhancement allows users to specify more granularity for escalation statuses.  In this release, the Escalation Manager supports three new Work Order Escalation statuses: Travel, OnSite, and OnBreak. Previously, these were lumped together as 'active'. The Escalation Manager has been updated so that when the technician status changes to Travel it triggers escalation events based on both Travel and Active, and likewise for the other two statuses. This allows existing Scheduled Events to be handled as usual, as well as for Escalation Profiles to be revised/created to support the new statuses.

Work Order Other Info tab

The Work Order Escalation Statuses of Travel, Onsite and On Break have been added to support additional granularity in Scheduled Events and reporting.   These statuses were previously grouped together as Active. When the a Work Order is escalated in this release, the Work Order Escalation Status will be set to Travel, Onsite or On Break (as applicable) if previously it would have be set to Active.  This may impact existing range settings, reports and analytics.

Escalation Profile Status List

The Work Order Escalation Statuses of Travel, Onsite and On Break have been added the Status list.  These statuses were previously grouped together as Active. Existing Escalation Profiles referencing the Active status will continue to be supported. New or existing profiles may specify onsite, travel, on break or active as statuses.

Escalation Hierarchy

The escalation hierarchy has been updated as shown in the table below; the new functionality is highlighted.

16.7 Work Order Entry

Now supports posting to expanded Work Order Labor and Inventory cost and price fields. Also supports Accounting Periods with WO Inventory to GL flagged.

16.8 Start Scheduled Event Purge

Now purges scheduled events for archived WO's.  

16.9 Start Archive Work Orders

If the WO's Date Work Completed is set, it is now used for the archived Tech line. If the Date Work Completed is not set, the archived Tech line has today's date, as before.

New Field: Date Completed:
This field allows the user to include only those Work Orders whose Date Work Completed falls on or before the selected date (subject to the Date Opened Date Closed settings). If this field is completed, Work Orders whose Date Work Completed is blank will also be excluded. If this field blank, the Work Order's Date Work Completed will not be considered by this function when generating the checklist.

16.10 New Call

The Equipment's Date Installed has been added to the right-hand side of the Equipment pane.

This release corrects an issue when the Market Source was not always written to the Work Order. It also corrects a sporadic problem where the WO Email was not defaulted from the Client Site.

The Work Requested verbiage from the selected Web Log is used to generate the new Work Order's Work Requested and Equipment Work Requested, correcting a sporadic problem in previous releases.

'Purchases Blocked' subcontractor Technicians may NOT be selected in New Call but "Payments Blocked" technicians may be selected. See Customer Note 16.16.1 for details.

The PO Required field is once again enforced; corrects a problem in recent versions.  

The Site's Service Manager is no longer cleared when changing the Job changes the Client. Corrects a problem when the sys-newcall option ServiceManagerBasedOnSite=true.

In this release, Ctrl-A is ignored instead of generating an error.  The Add WO button must be clicked to add the Work Order; the keyboard equivalent is not supported.

This release corrects a performance slowdown loading New Call in recent versions.

This release refines handling of the middle pane so that the Client Site List (and not the Master Contract pane) is displayed after the user completes a Call Script.

Master Contract Id: (requires special v.cus file to display this field)
If the selected Equipment is associated with a Master Contract that is currently open or will be open in the future, the Master Contract Id is added to the Work Order header to support custom reporting/analysis of full service contracts.

When the Web Log references more than one work order, the dispatch comments are left blank. Before, the new web log would provide dispatcher comments from the first work order referenced in the web log.

16.10.1 Weblogs from TechAnywhere

Previously when filtering the equipment, the requested equipment was being filtered out of the list due to the user’s service category filtering when it should not have been. This issue was due to a timing error noticeable in a specific customization. Now, the service category filtering occurs after the equipment has loaded. This update will be included for all customers.

This update provides a minor performance update to TechAnywhere message processing for web logs.

Changed Field: Weblog
When a Weblog from TechAnywhere is entered in New Call, a wizard displaying the Weblog information will appear. The following buttons allow you to process the Weblog as follows:

Proceed:  Clicking this button will use this Weblog to create a new Work Order. The contents will load into NewCall to allow the dispatcher to finish creating the new Work Order.

Decline:  Gives the user the opportunity to change a Weblog to the status of ‘Cancelled’ to remove it from the list of New/Unacknowledged Weblogs.

AssignToWO: Click this button to select an existing Work Order to assign this Weblog to. The Weblog’s Equipment and Work Requested contents will be added to the Work Order's Equipment Tab. The Weblog will also be changed to Acknowledged and reference the selected Work Order.

Cancel: Returns you to the New Call with the weblog field cleared. It only cancels the operation of selecting the Weblog; it does NOT set the Weblog's status to Cancelled. Note: Pressing the X works the same as the Cancel button.

16.10.2  Caller Specific Email for Escalation rules

New Field: Work Order Email
When a Site is selected in New Call, the Client Site's Email field is now defaulted to new Work Order Email field. The user may manually update this field if desired. Escalations for the new  Notification Source 'Work Order' will be sent to this address.

The Email address for the Scheduled Events is set when the WO is generated. Changing it in the Work Order after creation will not propagate the change to the Events themselves.

The Work Order Email is also set from the Site Email by the following functions:

Start Create PM Work Orders
Start Create Job Scheduler WOs
TechAnywhere - new WOs created from TechAnywhere
QuoteMaster/Quote Manager (new Work Orders generated by this function).

Notification Category

New Source: Work Order
If the Source 'Work Order' is selected, the Work Order's Email Address field will be used when generating Email Notifications/Alarms.

Escalation Profile

Notification Category:
Escalation Profiles for Work Orders now support Notification Categories with a Source of Work Order.

16.10.3  New Call (FMMS)

Previously in New Call, when creating a Work Order from an FMMS Web Log, the selection window appeared with no relevant Tracking Number from Service Channel. Now the selection window includes the tracking ID and is placed to the right of the "ServiceChannel".

The NTE amount from the selected Service Request now defaults to the NTE Client field which will populate the corresponding field in the newly created Work Order.

Also fixes an error accessing the FMMSInfo table when the Vendor Value includes an apostrophe (e.g. "Domino's").

This release corrects issues in the FacilitySource integration when selecting the web log.

16.10.4  New Call 2

In version 9.1.611.060 and up, this update provides reminders for past due payments for invoices made via the NewCall COD Job's setup. When users create a work order via the Create New COD Sites feature in New Call, the Past Due warning messages appear if their client didn’t pay upon delivery. 

This release corrects an issue where changing the selected Site Equipment updated all applicable fields except the field the cursor was positioned on.  In this release selecting the Site Equipment also updates the New Call 2 field the cursor is positioned on.   

New Field: Original Caller
This field lists the person who called in this Work Order. It defaults from the Contact 1 First and Last Name fields in the Client Site record (if completed); if these fields are not completed it will default from the Client Site Contact 2 information. This field may be changed by the user; it will be written to the Work Order's Original Caller field.

16.10.5 New Call Create New COD

New Field: Original Caller
This field lists the person who called in this Work Order. If completed by the user, it will be written to the Work Order's Original Caller field.

The Quote Report Id (QuoteDefaults tab) and the GL Entity Id (COP tab) are now defaulted from the Client Site template to the new Client Site created by this function.

16.10.5 Service Manager Defaulting

In this release, the Client has been added to the New Call Service Manager defaulting. The hierarchy is as follows: Client Site Equipment - Client Site - Client - User. The Service Manager selected when the Work Order is added will be written to the new Work Order.

16.10.6  New Call Work Order List

Archived Work Orders (with a Work Order Status Category of Archived) are now excluded from the New Call WO list in SAMPro. This was done to improve the performance of New Call, especially when displaying Sites with significant history.  

Reminder on Archiving:
As in previous release, the Start Archive Work or Start Autoarchive Work Order functions may be used to Archive Work Orders. A Work Order may also be set to a Work Order Status Category of Archived by adding a Technician Line with a status of Archived; when the Work Order is saved the Status Category will be reset to Archived. A Work Order is 'unarchived' by deleting the Tech line set to Archived and saving the Work Order.

16.11 Dispatch Board (SAMPro)

What begin it's corporate life as 'Sagequest' turned into Fleetmatics and is now Verizon Connect.  The button has been changed to reflect this, as have the mouse over and status pane references.

This release corrects an extremely sporadic problem where closing the Dispatch Board after setting a Custom Date on the Date Range tab resulted in a childless copy of the selected Work Order being generated.

Error Handling: corrects a 'doWIthIndex:' error related to list pane filtering, and a very sporadic 'key is missing error' on certain mouse movements. Also corrects a sporadic "System Primitive Failed" error when clicking on the column header of the Time Chart.

Column Filters: If you use the new column filtering on the Workorder List, these filters are cleared on the Workorder List pane when a new Technician is selected on the Tech Status Summary (upper) pane.

When UseOutlook is enabled via registry, clicking the Email button launches the Outlook form and sets the Email To field with the Tech’s Email Address 2.

'Purchases Blocked' subcontractor Techs may NOT be selected if their required insurance is expired on the selected date.  

When a Subcontractor Tech is changed on the WO Tech tab or the Dispatch Board, the system automatically changes the Vendor in the associated PO. In this release, the PO's A/P Terms and Sales Tax Group are also updated from the Vendor record.

When the Tech Lists button is clicked, the Dispatch Board Id and Name will both appear when the list of Dispatch Boards is displayed.  This release also corrects a System Primitive Error in the Tech Lists tab when the user clicked at the top of the tab so that no list was selected, and displays Tech Lists with 15 character Id's correctly.

Work Order changes are only allowed from the Dispatch Board if the User belongs to a Group with Change permission for View Work Order or Work Order Dispatcher.  

16.11.1 Classic Board

Corrects an 'argument must be a collection' error launching TechFinder.

The Date Range button has been added to the Classic and Day boards. This allows users to switch the Date Range without having to switch to the Powerboard first.

This release corrects an overlap issue that made it difficult to click the left arrow to change the Date Scheduled.  

16.11.2 Work Order Summary

The Work Order Summary screen is accessed from the Power Board by right-clicking on a Work Order and selecting Update Work Order. It allows the dispatcher limited edits to specific WO fields. This function was never designed to support the deletion Work Order lines. The Delete Line button has been removed from the side button bar in this release to avoid confusion. This release also corrects a 'key is missing error' when Equipment is added or changed on the Equipment tab.

16.11.3 Power Board

The Work Order's Earliest Start date has been added to the Power Board as a new column. This column will initially be located on the extreme right-hand side of the work order list, but drag and drop may be used to reposition it according the user's preference.

16.11.4 Dispatch Board Filter Tab

The following statuses have been added to the 'uncompleted' filter option:  parts pickup, parts backorder, parts issue, parts shipped.

A status can be added to the Tech Status range by left-clicking on the Filter-By-Status Options list. Duplicated status are now removed from the Tech Status range when it is updated via left-click to prevent range issues.

The SAMPro Dispatch Board "uncompleted" filter now includes "Manager Review," which is listed as a filtered tech status.

16.12 Verizon Connect (was Fleetmatics)

Version 9.1.611.056b disables all logging to the 'SQHelper.log' file.  This change was made because in some cases where users and services are getting a 'Runtime Error: FileSharingViolation' error which has to do with the SQHelper.log file that is generated from the SageQuest/Fleetmatics/Verizon integration. This logging was not being used by support for troubleshooting and is now disabled since it was causing problems.

This release corrects a formatting issue which prevented GPS stops from getting to Verizon Connect (Fleetmatics).

This release provides revised handling of the cancellation of a schedule date, and direction request to be compatible with the Fleetmatics work order format.

16.13 Create PM Work Orders

Previously, when creating a PM Work Order via Start Create PM Work Orders, a work order would only be created at the Waiting parts status if all equipment records had a service parts list. However, work orders should be created at this status if any equipment has a Service Parts list and should be created at Waiting Parts. This update corrects this defect.

Client Site WO Other lines are now applied to all applicable PM Work Orders when enabled via registry (see Customer Note 16.1.4b) in Version 9.1.611.056.  

This release corrects a problem where the Tech Status was not always set correctly if Required Resource lines were generated for some Equipment (via the Service Parts list) but not others on the same Preventative Maintenance WO.

This release corrects a problem where only the first line marked "Already Done" was handled correctly. In this release, all PM's checked as "Already Done" will have the Equipment PM Schedule line updated with "NO WO" as the WO ID.

When the TechServiceParts=No registry is enabled and Service Parts and Tasks are specified, the Tasks now correctly written to the WO Equipment Work Requested

When this function generates a PO for Subcontractor Techs, the Site Equipment being serviced is completed on the PO's Gen line.

In 9.1.611.059, an issue is corrected where the Service Task list was not written to Work Order Equipment Work Requested if the Work Order Parts list did not reference any of Parts Types flagged in the Site Equipment PMSchedule. The Service Tasks will now be correctly written to the Work Order Equipment Work Requested (when enabled via registry) if no Service Parts are eligible.

16.13.1 New field - Override ALL Techs?

If this box is checked and the Technician Id field is also completed, the Technician Id selected will be assigned to ALL work orders generated by this function.  If the Override ALL Tech? box is blank, the Technician Id (if selected) will only be used where a Technician is not specified in the Equipment or Site record. If the Override ALL Techs? box is checked the Technician Id must be completed.  Additional changes to the Technician may be made when the Create PM WOs checklist screen is displayed.

16.14 Notification Category

Changed Field - Method:
The obsolete TechAnywhere option has been removed from the list of Methods to avoid confusion. This option was for RTD (Remote Tech Device for the Blackberry) notifications in previous releases.

NOTE: If any Notification Category records specifying the Method 'TechAnywhere' exist in your data, the 'Selected Record Not Found' message will appear when selecting from a list. The Notification record's Id must be typed in to access / edit the record.  You may wish to Obsolete these entries.

New Source: Work Order
If the Source 'Work Order' is selected, the Work Order's Email Address field will be used when generating Email Notifications/Alarms.

16.15 Start Renew Service Contracts 

Previously, running the Renew Service Contracts function renewed PM Schedule lines on equipment for inactive sites. This is unnecessary as the sites are inactive and don't need to be renewed. Now inactive sites remain inactive when running the Renew Service Contracts function.

When a Time of Service Earned contract is updated, the Advanced Bill lines are now updated by the percentage specified. In recent releases, only the Scheduled (accrual) lines were updated.  

Corrects a problem where TOS Equipment values and Client Site Billing amounts were being combined.

In previous releases, Start Renew Service Contract renewed schedules on inactive pieces of equipment if they are marked OK to renew.  In this release, Active/Inactive status of the equipment be considered during the renewal process so that Equipment flagged as Inactive will be skipped.

16.15.1 Start Renew Service Contract Checklist

This release corrects the issue where manual changes to the New Value field in the Start Renew Service Contracts Checklist were being ignored. The PM Billing lines on the Client Site were generated in the amount of the original contract, rather that the New Value entered during the renewal function. PM Billing lines are now given the cumulative total of the manually entered New Value.

The Description column has been enhanced to better define that type of renewal being run based on the types of lines filled in on the Site PM Billing and/or the Site Equipment PM Schedule:

PM Billing has no value and PM Schedule has no contract value: T&M Inspections

Scheduled PM Billing has no value and PM Schedule has contract value: Equipment: Time of Service Billing

PM Billing has value: Site: Bill in Advance

16.16  Technician Viewer

16.16.1 Main Tab

Changed Fields:

Email to Text:  (was Email Fax:)
The label for the above field has been changed to reference its ability to send Texts through the Web Dispatch board.  If the user sets up the technicians phone number in these fields to follow the formatting for their phone service provider, they will be able to launch an email that will be sent as a text to the technician from the Web Board:

Examples:

Verizon: <phone number>@vtext.com

Sprint: <phone number>@messaging.sprintpcs.com

ATT: <phone number>@txt.att.net

On the Web Board, the field will display as a clickable link, to open in your email client. The message will be processed and sent directly to the technician's cell phone.

Email2 to Text: (was Email Address 2:)
This field may also be used to send text to the Tech's cell phone from the Web Board as discussed above.  In addition, when the Email button on the SAMPro Dispatch Board is clicked, the “To” field in the Email form will default from this field.

New Fields:

Vendor Name:
If the Vendor field is completed on this subcontractor technician record, the Vendor's Name will be displayed, and the following fields will be completed if applicable.

Insurance Required: Insurance Expired:
The insurance required field defaults from the Insurance Required field in the Vendor record. If this field is checked, the system will check the INS tab in the Vendor record to determine if all insurance is still valid. If not, the Insurance Expired field will also be checked.

Payments Blocked:
If this display field is checked, the Vendor’s Insurance is flagged as 'Block Payments' and it is currently expired. A 'Payments Blocked' subcontractor may now be selected in New Call, the Dispatch Board or on a Work Order in SAMPro 9.1.611.045 and above. This was not true in previous releases.

Purchases Blocked:
If this display field is checked, the Vendor’s Insurance is flagged as 'Block Purchases' and it is currently expired. A 'Purchases Blocked Tech' may NOT be selected in New Call, on the Dispatch Board and on Work Orders.   

RAQ Group:
This field is reserved for TechAnywhere use.

Technician User 6-10
These fields are designed for use with TechAnywhere.

16.16.2 Technician Dispatch Boards Tab

The new Dispatch Boards tab on the Tech record provides right-click add or delete of Technician from the from the View Boards and Technicians viewer. Added Techs will be added to the end of the Tech list in View Boards and Technicians. The record change log of View Boards and Technicians is updated when a Tech is added or deleted.

Important Fields

Serves
If the contents of this field is set to Yes, the Technician is affiliated with this Dispatch Board. If the Serves field is blank, the Technician is not associated with this Dispatch Board.

To set the Serves field to Yes, right-click on the line you wish to change. Right-clicking will also toggle a Yes to a blank if you wish to remove the Dispatch Board affiliation.

Id - Name
The Dispatch Board Id and Name. Double-click on a line to access the Boards and Technicians viewer.

16.16.3 Technician Service Zones Tab

This release adds a new column to the Technician's Service Zones tab. This column is labeled 'Obsolete Flag' and will either be blank or will contain the word 'Obsolete' depending on the status of the Service Zone.

If the line is flagged as 'Obsolete', the user will be prohibited from changing the 'Serves' column from Blank to 'Yes' via the right click mechanism. An appropriate message is issued instead. However, the user will continue to be able to change the 'Serves' column from 'Yes' to Blank even for Obsolete lines.

16.16.4 Technician Remote Access Tab

New Remote Device Type - DBFleet

The DBFleet option supports a new mode built into the TechAnywhere app that only allows the user to use the DBFleet portion for GPS tracking and reporting to DBFleet. It disables all other TechAnywhere functionality. This allows a company that does not use TechAnywhere or has employees who would not need to use TechAnywhere, to have the ability to track these employees through DBFleet.

Important Implementation Note: If a client does not have/use TechAnywhere and wants to do this for DBFleet, a full TechAnywhere install will need to take place first.

Licensing for this mode is handled in DBFleet - SAMPro does not track count.

In order to log into TechAnywhere in this mode, the Technician record will need to be configured as follows:

Web Access = Technician
Remote Device Type = DBFleet
Set and confirm a password

16.17 Project Work Order Generator

16.17.1 Project Work Order Generator Overview

The new Project Manager Work Order Generator is designed to streamline the process of creating a large number of Work Orders to implement a one-time project.  For example, suppose that your firm wins a contract from BigBox to install Gizmos at all of its stores.  This will require hundreds – or thousands – of Work Orders to get the Project completed.  The Project record is the key to the Project Work Order Generator.

 

The following records must be configured correctly to run the Start Project Work Order Generator:

Project:
The Project specifies the Equipment and Jobs eligible for use in the Create Project Work Order Generator.  Typically, a new Project, Jobs and Equipment would be created for each major Project.  After the Project was completed and billed, the Jobs would be closed, the Equipment marked Inactive, and the Project obsoleted.  

Job:
Job records used by the Start Project Work Order must reference the selected Project.  To be used with this function, Jobs should be flagged as Service Compute.

Site Equipment:
The Equipment Id must match the Project Id exactly! Complete the Esc. Profile Id if you want Scheduled Events generated for the Work Order. The Default Service Job must point to a Job referencing the Project. The Cost Code and Billing Item must also be completed.

Milestone Group:
Defines the Milestone which will be attached to the Work Order. When the Work Order is generated, the Days and Minutes Offset will be used to calculate the End Date and End Time on the Work Order’s Milestone line based on the Date / Time Must Complete.  

Call Script:
A Closing Call Script may be applied to the Work Orders if required.  

Work Code:
The user may select a Work Code to be applied to the generated Work Orders. The Work Code Id is also used to determine if a matching WO already exists for a given Job.

Once the records have been correctly configured, Start Project Work Order Generator should be run to create the Work Orders needed to implement the Project.

16.17.2 Start Project Work Order Generator

Purpose:

The Start Project Work Order Generator is used to actually create Service Work Orders defined by the Project, Job and Equipment definitions.  If a Technician is specified in the Equipment record, the Work Order will be assigned to that Tech.

Registry:

This function is sensitive to the required fields registry settings for sys-start-snwcll. If a field is required in New Call it must be completed or defaulted when this function is run. If not, an information box describing the issue will be displayed and the Work Order will not be generated.

Important Fields - Range Screen:

Project Id:
Select the Project you wish to create Work Order for. Jobs must reference the selected Project AND the Client Site Equipment Id MUST MATCH the Project Id in order to be selected for Work Order generation.  

The Project Id must be completed.  The user will be warned if the Milestone Group, Work Code, or Call Script are blank.

Milestone Group:
The Milestone Group defines the Milestones which will be attached to the Work Order.

Work Code:
Specifies the Work Code to be assigned to the generated Work Orders. The Work Code Id is also used to determine if a matching WO already exists for a given Job. The Do checkbox on the Checklist screen will NOT be flagged if a Work Order for that Job / Work Code combination exists.

Client NTE  - Sub NTE
If these fields are completed, they will provide the defaults for the Work Orders' Client and Sub Not To Exceed (NTE) fields.

Closing Call Script:
Completing this field specifies the Closing Call Script for the generated Work Orders.

Date Must Complete:  Time Must Complete:
Enter the Date and Time that the work for the selected Project must be completed.  These fields will be used to set the Date and Time Scheduled on the Work Order Technician Tab. In addition, the Days and Minutes Offset in the Group and the Date / Time Must Complete will be used to calculate the End Date / Time on the Work Order’s Milestones.

Default PO#:
The customer's PO# for this work; this field will be used to complete the PO# field in the Work Order.

Dispatcher Id:
If this field is completed it will provide the default Dispatch Id to use when generating these work orders. If it is left blank, the Dispatcher referenced in the Equipment record will be used.

Job Id:  Job Name:
The Job Id or Name range may be used to filter the Jobs processed by this function.  This would be completed if you did not wish to generate all of the Work Orders for this Project at the same time.

Project Manager Id:
This range filters this function to the Project Manager(s) assigned to the Jobs for this Project.

Site State:
This range filters this function to the State specified in the Job's Site record.

Checklist Screen:

The Checklist displays the results from input filters on the previous screen.

Do:
Lines that are presented with the 'Do' box checked have been validated and will be used to successfully create a Work Order. If the 'Do’ box is not checked, a problem exists for that Equipment or Job.  The user will be informed of the particular problem when attempting to check the Do box (for example, if a Job points to the Project but there isn't  Equipment for this Job that matches the Project Id).

If a problem occurs, click Ok, then close the Checklist (with the red X in the upper right-hand corner) and correct the problem. After correcting the problems, rerun the function.

Milestone Group:  PO#:  Work Code:  Call Script:  
Date Must Complete: Time Must Complete: Client NTE:  Sub NTE: Dispatcher Id:
These fields defaulted from the previous screen, but may be adjusted on the Checklist if needed.

16.17.3 New Viewer: Milestone Group

Purpose:

The Milestone Group is designed for use with the Start Project Work Order Generator. It will populate the Work Order Milestone tab when the Start Project Work Order Generator creates Work Orders.

Important Fields: Upper Section

Milestone Group Id:
A unique name for this Milestone Group.

Milestone Group Description:
Briefly identifies the purpose of this Milestone Group.

Milestone Group User1-5:
These fields may be used for reporting and other informational purposes.

Obsolete?
If this field is checked, the record is considered Obsolete, and it may not be directly specified during data-entry (either by entering the Id or selecting it from a list).

Important Fields: Lower Section

Milestone Id:   Milestone Description:
Enter a Milestone Id (or double-click to select from a list.  The display-only Milestone Description defaults from the Milestone.

Description:
This editable field may be used to better define this Milestone.  Both the Milestone Description and the Description will appear on the Work Order Milestone tab.

Days Offset:  Minutes Offset:
When the Work Order is generated, the Days and Minutes Offset will be used to calculate the End Date and End Time on the Work Order’s Milestone line based on the Date / Time Must Complete.  

For example, if the Work Order was generated with a Date Must Complete of April 15, 2017 a Days Offset of 10 would generate Milestone End Date of April 25, 2017.  Negative Offsets may also be specified.  In the above example, a Days Offset of -10 would generate an End Date of April 5, 2017.

Fixed Date:  Fixed Time:
Milestone Dates and Times are set during initial WO creation regardless of whether these fields are flagged.  These fields come into play in the Work Order viewer when Date/Time Must Complete is changed.  Basically, Fixed means  do NOT change the Milestone’s End Date / Time after the initial Work Order creation.

16.17.4  Work Order Viewer

New Tab: Milestones

Work Order Milestones are typically referenced by DBAnalytics for tracking purposes for Work Orders generated by the Start Project Work Order Generator function.

Important Fields:

Milestone Id:  
Milestones are automatically populated by the Start Project Work Order Generator function when WO's are generated.

They may also be added to any Work Order for reporting purposes.
