Setting Key: skipEmailNoAddress     Setting Value: Y (default N)


Side Email Button on the Reports Screen:

These options can be implemented if the user wishes to either block or use the side Email button after responding to the question ‘Did this report print successfully’ confirmation box. 

Setting Key: OkToEmail    Setting Value: false (default is true)

This setting will permanently disable the Side Email button; an invoice cannot be emailed from the report screen's Email button.

Setting Key: OkToEmailWithoutPrint     Setting Value: false (default is true) 

If this option is set to false, the Email button will be disabled (grayed-out) when the report is first displayed. The button will be enabled only when the invoice has been printed and posted.

Note: This option would need to be disabled to Re-Print & email COP Invoices.

23.1.5 Report to Allow Email "To" Features to Work When Using Outlook Registry Setting

When the below registry is set to true, the Email Address "TO:" populates with the Default the Client Site's Email Address into Outlook. 

Id: 'sys-email’

Setting Key: UseOutlook    Setting Value: true

23.2 COP Reports

23.2.1 COP Invoices

Previously, all COP invoices added $.01 to the base price in Avalara and then returned the overstated base price back to the Tax History in SAMPro. This update corrects this defect.

This release corrects a spurious Runtime error that appeared when launching Report COP Invoice in a database which contained only a single AR Control GL Account,

The Invoice Master's Branch is set from the Client Order's Branch when the COP Invoice is generated.  

AR Terms on COP invoice included a line for a discount. In version 9.1.611.059 and up, the wording is now optional and available but removed until added. 

The updated customized v.cus now includes the PBBS page header for the COP Quote Report. 

This is a customized report includes an updated v.cus file that encompasses the ability for a bitmap on the COP Quote form and adds the ability (via registry) to specify a Job Cost Code to be used to override the Work Order Default Job Cost Code when TechAnywhere posts inventory line items to the WO Inventory child tab.

23.2.2 COP Quotation

The hard-coded footer text (including quote stated in US $, 30 day valid, and quoted by Customer Service Manager) has been removed from the standard COP Quotation report. See Customer Note 23.1.3 for a registry to specify customer footer text.

23.3 Client Order Intercompany Processing

This release corrects an issue with filling B/O's and completing Client Orders in intercompany configurations.

When using Intercompany processing, the GL Entity and Company are now defaulted when the Print Invoice button is pressed from View Client Order.

In order to support Intercompany Processing, Client Orders & COP Invoices now post with the proper Security and Company Security information. This ensures that the COP Orders carry the correct security/company information when the COP Invoices are posted to the AR Sales Journal and carried over into the various history tables (arhstry, glhstry, txhstry, imhstry, invcemstr, etc).  In addition, the Start Fill Backorders function now works properly for Client Orders generated in this release when InterCompany is enabled.

If the COP module is set up to default the information from the Client Site’s COP tab instead of the Location (where sys-viewer-vclntordr GLEntityScheme=clntste registry option exists), the system will now use the Client Site’s COP tab's GL Entity for posting the invoices Freight, Dropship Freight and make sure that the COGS posting for dropships uses the same GL Entity for both the debit & credit side of the AR Sales GL journal entry.

23.4 Client Order

In the 9.1.611.062c release, this update rewrites the Last Time Sold Tab in the Client Order to account for data that was previously not displaying. Additionally a "Site ID" column has been added to allow for it to automatically filter to the Client Site. Users may remove this filter to view all sites for the Client.

Previously, the Record Pick Ticket on an order with a Lot Controlled Item with a previously Invoiced order, the following error appears: The Serial/Lot Number: [Serial/Lot Number] is Already Being Shipping On Order [Order Number]”  This error appeared even if the quantity on hand is available in the Lot selected. This update corrects this defect.

This update makes the Client Order parts history site-specific, rather than client. This update adds the Client Site ID as a new column to the data present on the tab, filtering to the site that has been selected. A user may remove this filter if they choose to view it filtered by Client.

This update adds an error message if a user makes edits to the "Shipped","ToBckOrd", or "ToShort" when a Pick Ticket has been flagged as "PICK DONE". The warning message displays:
"Edits to quantities already recorded PICK DONE could have adverse effects to IMH"

Previously, when a user in the Project Manager Workbench clicked the 'Create Quote' button on the left-side pan, it would direct the user to Quote Master instead of the Quote Manager. This update corrects this defect. 
Note: Contact support if you want to launch the deprecated Quote Master instead.

This update adds Client Site ID and Client Site Alpha columns between Client Id and PO Number in the Recurring Orders "ByClientByAlphaID.”

This update adds additional filters for "Client Site" and "Entered By" for the COP order viewer.

This update adds a column on the COP Order Acknowledgement report for the Inventory Item's Unit of Measure provided it is present on the Inventory Item record. This is added to the right of the Quantity Column with a header of "UOM.”

This update adds the Site's "PO Required?" checkbox field to the Client Order viewer as a display-only field. If the Site used in the Client Order viewer has the "PO Required?" checkbox checked, then the PO Number field on the Client Order viewer must be filled in.

The Billing Comment box is now added to the Client Order Data page to provide information to New Call via SAMPro. Previously, there was not a billing comment box for the Client Order Data page.
Version 9.1.611.056 corrects a display issue where the Contract Id 'disappeared' when this field was set and the record saved. The Contact Id is now displayed correctly.

This release enhances validation to prevent the user from adding duplicate Inventory Id lines on a Client Order.

23.4.1 COP Pick List

Previously when a Serialized Item is sold via COP and then returned to stock via a Credit Memo, that Serial Number(s) could not be resold. Because users could not produce an Invoice and Bill the Client for these items that were returned to stock and resold, this triggered an error. In 9.1.611.062c and up, this update corrects this defect and returned items can now be resold.

24  Assets and Rentals

24.1 Assets / Rentals Registries

24.2. Assets / Rentals Reports

24.3  Asset Viewer

Changed Fields - Asset User Fields 1-5:
These fields can be used to set Equipment Fields when creating new equipment via the Create New Equipment button on the Location tab.

The following keys can be entered on any of the Asset User fields pass valid Id's to the corresponding Equipment fields.

Tech=a valid Technician Id
Cert=a valid Certification Id
Script=a valid Call Script Id
Profile=a valid Escalation Profile Id
Metric=a valid Log Form Id
Category=a valid Service Category Id

Important Note:
Do not include a space between the key and the Id.  For example, to set the Service Category to HVAC:

Correct:  Category=HVAC    Incorrect: Category = HVAC

Multiple key/id pairs, separated by commas, can be entered on a single Asset User line.

Tip: Use Custom Fields to Set User Asset Fields

The Custom Fields functionality allows the user to select from a list of appropriate key/id combinations.

25 DBSellpoint Point of Sale

25.1 Overview

DBSellPoint is a point of sales app developed to handle over the counter and retail sales transactions for SAMPro. Payments can be made with cash or credit card, or on account for existing customers. The app is designed to be run on an Android tablet with a credit card scanner, barcode scanner, and a cash drawer,

Returns of DBSellPoint sales are also supported in the app. A PowerPoint presentation focusing using the app itself is available.

25.2 New Function - Start Point of Sale Scheduled Event Manager

This function posts messages (transactions entered in the DBSellPoint app) to the SAMPro database. It is responsible for generating the needed AR Sales Journal, Invoice Master, Inventory History, Job History and Cash Receipts in SAMPro. It handles both DBSellPoint Sales and Returns.

This function will be configured to run automatically by support when it is installed.

25.3 Setting Up SAMPro for DBSellpoint

GL Entities are derived as follows:

ENTB = Balance Sheet Entity (from Company)

ENTI = Income Statement Entity (from Site COP tab)

Posting of POS sales should use the Entity defined above as follows in posting:

1) Cash Receipts Records

a. GL Entity – use Company ENTB – arrcpts.glentty.rn

2)  AR Sales Records

a.AR Control Entity – use Company ENTB – arsls.glentty.rn

b. Entities for GL Posting

i.All Sales Lines, Entity = Site COP ENTI
ii.All Expense (cost) Lines, Entity = Site COP ENTI
iii.Accounts Receivable, Entity = Company ENTB
iv.All Sales Tax Lines, Entity = Company ENTB
v.All Inventory, Entity = Company ENTB

25.3.1  RAQ: Default Cash / Client Site: Walk Up Customer

A default customer (Client Site) must be set up for walk up cash/credit customers where the sale will not be for  'on account' or cash sales to an existing customer. The RAQ configDefaultCustomer (site RN)  defines the default customer (site) that comes up on POS initial screen. This record will be configured by support when your system is set up.

25.3.2 Payment Type: GL Bank Account for Cash Receipts Entry

When an AR Cash Receipts entry is posted from DBSellpoint, the GL Bank Account will default from the Payment Type selected on the POS screen.

When Invoices are posted from DBSellpoint, the Invoice's Due Date, Discount Date, Discount Available are now set based on its AR Terms.

25.3.3 Returns Processing

NOTE: If a dollar limit for cash reimbursements is exceeded, a return will require submitting paperwork to accounting and a check gets cut to the customer at some future date.  In that scenario, SAMPro provides no automated help in managing the debt or producing the payment.  Accounting must create a Vendor record and the appropriate AP Journal entry so the customer eventually gets paid/reimbursed as a 'vendor'.

Returns are defined by messages including the key 'Return=true'?  If the customer is reimbursed (cash, credit card credit, etc), the DBSellpoint app will also provide that information so the appropriate negative Cash Receipt can be generated.

The posting depends on whether or not the customer was reimbursed at the POS counter.

If the customer is reimbursed:

The return is treated as a Credit Memo and posts the appropriate Sales and Cash Receipts transactions.

In the Sales Journal, the Invoice Id will be generated by appending the letters CM will to the original POS Invoice Id (e.g.,143234CM). The Transaction Description will be set to 'POS Return Entry'.

The Cash Receipts entry will be made with negative receipts and a Transaction Description will be set to 'POS Return Entry'.

If not reimbursed:

Only a Sales Journal entry will be made using the Costs tab of the Sales Journal to effectively put the Return 'On Account' for the customer.  The Client specified in the Sales Journal will be derived from the Client listed on the Site's COP tab.

A Restocking Fee may be assessed in the DBSellpoint return which will reduce the amount of the return. The RestockGLAccount registry detailed in Customer Note 25.4.3 may be used to specify the GL Account restocking fees will post to. If this registry is absent the Sales GL Account will be used.

If the registry is not set, the return amount for each line will be the original sales less the restocking fee.  If the registry is enabled then the difference on each line between the original sales and return amount will be posted to the Restock Account.

25.4 Registry Settings

25.4.1 User Registry Tab: Default Location/Tax Group for DBSellpoint

The Sales Tax Group on the default Client Site's COP tab is the one for the brick and mortar DBSellpoint location the DBSellpoint User is stationed at. This Sales Tax Group will be used for ALL DBSellpoint transactions. The default Site must be specified in the User's Registry tab for each DBSellpoint User.

Key:  defaultSite   Value: Site Id

25.4.2 Registry for Start Point of Sale Event Manager

Registry Id: sys-start-spntofsleevntmngr

Setting Key: DefaultLocation Setting Value: LocationId

The DefaultLocation is used to set the location for Sales Journal Expense Lines. If this registry is not specified the location 'Main' is Used.

Setting Key: emailpostlogsfrom  Setting Value: validemail

This registry defines the 'from' address for DBSellpoint posting logs. It must be a valid email address for the firm running DBSellpoint.

Setting Key: emailpostlogsto  Setting Value: validemail

This registry specifies the address receiving the posting logs; typically a support rep or IT administrator.

25.4.3 Registry for DBSellpoint Configuration and Defaults

Registry Id: sys-point

Setting Key: ARControlAccount Setting Value: GLAccountId

This required setting defines the AR Control Account to be used when AR Sales Journal entries are generated.

Setting Key: CollateralDirectory   Setting Value: path to uploaded POS collateral files

The CollateralDirectory is required.  It identifies the location where uploaded files can be found.    

Setting Key: DiscountGLAccount Setting Value: GLAccountId

This registry specifies the GL Account for sales discounts on sales posting. If this registry is absent the Sales GL will be used.

Setting Key: RestockGLAccount Setting Value: GLAccountId

This registry specifies the GL Account for restocking charges on returns posting; if this registry is absent the Sales GL will be used.

26  Facility Source

26.1 New Call

Web Log:
Scheduled Date/Time updates to FacilitySource are now supported when a Facility Source Weblog is selected in New Call to generated a SAMPro Work Order.  When creating a new work order from a Facility Source Weblog, the SAMPro PO# was previously populated with “????”. This is now updated with the “WorkOrderNumber:” from FacilitySource.

27 Marketplace Integration

27.1 Registry For Custom MarketPlace EDI Purchasing/Quoting

Purpose:

This registry provides the configurations required to run the MarketPlace functionality for Purchasing/Quoting.

Important Fields:

Id: sys-edi

Enable Marketplace EDI

Setting Key: Enabled    Setting Value: yes (default no)

Paths to Folders

The folders identified in these registries entry provide the interfaces with Marketplace. Your Marketplace configuration must reference the locations of these folders and have access to them.

Setting Key: InboundFolder    Setting Value: path to inbound folder

Marketplace will deliver .xml files to this folder to be processed by SAMPro

Setting Key: InboundAcceptedFolder    Setting Value: path to inbound accepted folder

Files will be moved to this folder after they have been processed by SAMPro.

Setting Key: InboundRejectedFolder    Setting Value: path to inbound rejected folder

Files that could not be processed by SAMPro will be moved to this folder.

Logging

Setting Key: LogMode    Setting Value: on

Setting Key: LogPath   Setting Value: path\EDILog.txt

If logging is enabled (strongly recommended), this registry specifies the path and filename to be used for logging.

Email Alerts

These registries are used to send emails whenever errors are encountered when processing Inbound folder messages.

Setting Key: EmailEnabled   Setting Value:  yes (default no)

Setting Key: EmailFrom    Setting Value: validemailaddress

Setting Key: EmailTo   Setting Value: validemailaddress

Setting Key: EmailSubject   Setting Value: string  

27.2 Setting up the Start EDI Scanner

The function Start EDI Scanner (Sscedi) will be used to poll the Upload Folder for the unprocessed Xml files from the Marketplace app. It may be necessary to run  Start Function List Update to and the new Start EDI Scanner function.  It should be added to the User Group for the special 'agent' user that will be running this function. A Scheduled Event should be set to run Start EDI Scanner every 60 seconds.

27.3 MarketPlace/SAMPro Integration Overview

The purpose of this integration is to reduce the effort and increase the accuracy of creating purchase orders and quotes in SAMPro. The PO’s requirements originate in the third-party Marketplace application. The integration includes several custom modifications to SAMPro including:

1. The automatic creation of Purchase Orders via a supplied .xml file.

2. The creation of a Purchase Order .xml file used for delivery to the vendor by the Marketplace app.

3. Receive Order Acknowledgements that update the existing Purchase Order.

4. Import Quote Scope details to an existing Quote via a supplied .xml file.

5. Automatic creation/update of Inventory Part records via a supplied .xml file.

6. Import Automated Ship Notifications (ASN) to the Receiving Journal in SAMPro.

Each of these is detailed below.

1 and 2. Create PO from Marketplace App / Generate PO .xml file Delivered to Vendor by Marketplace App (1 & 2 above)

When a user using the Marketplace app determines that parts need to be ordered to fulfill the needs of a repair work order it will create a Purchase Order .xml file (see below) and store it in a pre-defined (Inbound)) folder on the local database. Note that only one vendor can be specified in the PO .xml file (one PO per file).  

When it runs, the Start EDI Scanner function will poll the Inbound folder for unprocessed .xml files. When found, the system will first execute the create/update inventory part function (defined below) and then it will create a Purchase Order in the SAMPro database from the .xml file. Once the .xml file is processed it will be moved to a “processed” file folder (defined by the InboundAcceptedFolder registry option) and the log file updated.

Once the PO is created the system will create the 855 PO.xml file, this time with the newly created PO number inserted into the file and place it in a pre-defined folder (as specified by the InboundAccepted option) for pick up by the Marketplace app which will then deliver the PO to the designated vendor.

3. Receive Order Acknowledgements that update the existing Purchase Order

The Marketplace app will receive Order Acknowledgments (OA) from the vendor and provide a mechanism for users to accept/reject the OA. If accepted, the Marketplace app will create a revised 855 PO.xml file containing all the original and revised data accepted via the Marketplace app and store it in a pre-defined folder on the local database.  When it runs, Start EDI Scanner will poll the Inbound folder for unprocessed .xml files. When found, the system will first execute the create/update inventory part function (defined below) and then it will update the referenced Purchase Order in the SAMPro database from the .xml file. Once the .xml file is processed it will be moved to a “processed” file folder (defined by InboundAcceptedFolder) and the log file updated.

4. The ability to import Quote Scope details to an existing Quote

When a user using the Marketplace app determines that a repair needs to be quoted the app will create a Quote Scope .xml file and store it in "inbound" folder (defined via the InboundFolder registry) on the local database. The user will then create a Quote referencing the diagnostic Work Order Id and then create a new Quote Scope. From the Quote Scope viewer the user will press a new icon labeled “Import Scope”. The system will look in the Quote Scope folder location for .xml files that reference the Work Order Id specified in the Quote header record.  The Quote .xml file may contain multiple options (qtescpe_id’s) so a selection list needs to be displayed allowing the user to choose which qtescpe_id they want to import. After selecting the system will first execute the create/update inventory part function (defined below) and then the details specified in the (Quote).xml file will import into the Quote Scope viewer. Once the .xml file is processed it will be moved to a “processed” file folder (defined by the InboundAcceptedFolder registry) and the log file updated.

5. Automatic creation/update of Inventory Part records

When a new part is sourced by the Marketplace app and the details for the part either need to be added or updated in the SAMPro parts database, the Marketplace app will create an .xml file and store it an "inbound" folder (defined via the InboundFolder registry) on the local database. Every time the automatic PO creation or Quote Scope import functions are executed, SAMPro will first execute an import/update inventory function that looks for unprocessed inventory .xml files in the folder and either creates or updates inventory part records in the SAMPro database. Once the .xml file is processed it will be moved to a “processed” file folder (defined by InboundAcceptedFolder) and the log file updated.

6. Import Automated Ship Notifications (ASN) to the Receiving Journal in SAMPro

The Marketplace app will deliver 856 ASN .xml files to a pre-defined folder on the local database. On a daily basis, SAMPro users should open the Inventory Receipts Journal and specify a PO Id; this will execute a function that looks for unprocessed ASM .xml files and creates a selection list for the user to select from. The user will select a PO/ASN that has physically been received in the warehouse and it will then import into the Inventory Receipts Journal.

27.4 Recent MarketPlace Updates

Inventory Receipts -

Version 9.1.611.057 corrects a problem with Ship Notice files being sent to the "Processed" folder before they had actually been processed.

Quote Scope -

Main Tab - Import Diagnostics Button - When importing Diagnostics from a Marketplace Work Order, the status of the Scope will be set to Open instead of Diagnostic.

Purchase Order -

Main Tab - New Button - Import From Marketplace
This new button allows PO's to be imported from Marketplace, if this EDI function is enabled via registry. The Ordered By field of the PO will be set to the current User's Id.

EDI Tab: When the EDI Submit button is clicked, the Vendor Number will be added to the generated XML for Marketplace exports.

Inventory Item -

When updating Inventory Item via XML, the check determining if the Vendor is already in an Inventory Item Vendor line is now case-insensitive.

SAMPro Version 9.1.611.053 changes the functionality when an existing part is sourced by the Marketplace app, and the details for the part do not match those in the SAMPro parts database. Marketplace updates to existing Inventory Items will only update the Use Price Level field (invntryitm_mrkup) if the provided value is not blank (boolean Y/N). In addition, the Inventory Item Name and Extended Description will only be updated by MarketPlace if the provided values are not blank. 

Add ShipVia Line -

This release includes an Add ShipVia line element to the PO XLM export if so requested in the following Registry.

Id: sys-edi

Setting Key: ExportShipVia  Setting Value: Y

To turn on the export, the Setting key must be present, and the Setting Value must begin with ‘Y’, ‘y’, ‘T’, or ‘t’.

NOTE: An installation using this EDI functionality should have either the registry sys-edi-haller  OR sys-edi implemented. If for some reason both are implemented, sys-edi-haller will take precedence.  

27.4a Existing Part Changes

SAMPro Version 9.1.611.053 changes the functionality when an existing part is sourced by the Marketplace app, and the details for the part do not match those in the SAMPro parts database. Marketplace updates to existing Inventory Items will only update the Use Price Level field (invntryitm_mrkup) if the provided value is not blank (boolean Y/N). In addition, the Inventory Item Name and Extended Description will only be updated by MarketPlace if the provided values are not blank. 

27.4b Registry to Add Line Item Promise Date

This release includes a registry that will add the LineItemPromiseDate tag to the items section the Marketplace PO.xml output file; it will be populated with the SAMPro prchseordrlst_dte_prmsd.

Registry to Enable / Disable

Id: sys-edi

Setting Key: 855POIncludeLineDatePromised  Setting Value: Y  or  N (default is N)

Recent SAMPro Updates

9.1.611.062c (2023-04-12)

Accounts Payable

AP Journal viewer: This update corrects a defect with Credit APJ that could occur when selecting Reset Tax after changing the tax group creating a GL Out of Balance error. Credits would only pass when the users would not use the Reset Tax button, but leave the Tax Group as is, and edit the tax amount in the lines. This update now allows users to Credit APJ using the Reset Tax button.

Client Order Processing

Client Order viewer: This update rewrites the Last Time Sold Tab in the Client Order to account for data that was previously not displaying. Additionally a "Site ID" column has been added to allow for it to automatically filter to the Client Site. Users may remove this filter to view all sites for the Client.

Client Order Pick List viewer: Previously when a Serialized Item is sold via COP and then returned to stock via a Credit Memo, that Serial Number(s) could not be resold. Because users could not produce an Invoice and Bill the Client for these items that were returned to stock and resold, this triggered an error. This update corrects this defect and returned items can now be resold.

Service Management

Work Order viewer: Previously a change from versions 9.1.611.061 and 9.1.611.062 caused the Equipment ID from the Workorder Equipment tab to not populate into lines being entered on the Inventory, Labor, or Other tabs. This update corrects this defect. 

9.1.611.062b (2023-03-31)

Purchasing

Inventory Receipts Journal viewer: Previously for a specific user, the tax was included in average cost stopped being accurate after 2019. As a result of the bug, their inventory item average costs are understated by the 8% tax. This update corrects this defect. 

9.1.611.062a (2023-03-02)

Client Order Processing

COP Pick Ticket Processing: Previously, the Record Pick Ticket on an order with a Lot Controlled Item with a previously Invoiced order, the following error appears: The Serial/Lot Number: [Serial/Lot Number] is Already Being Shipping On Order [Order Number]”  This error appeared even if the quantity on hand is available in the Lot selected. This update corrects this defect.

Job/ Job Cost

Job Cloning Process: Previously when attempting to clone from a Job Template using an active client or site, it displayed a warning that the status is "blank" when the sites are active. This only occurred in version 9.1.611.062 if the ID for the site or client was NOT numeric. This update corrects this defect.

9.1.611.062 Revised Reports

Service Invoice Report Modification Request - Springbank Mech

This customized update to the Service Invoice Report changes the following format:
•    The terms below the INVOICE TOTAL section will be removed
•    The due date will be written out - e.g. "October 6, 2022"
•    Remove the Client and Site from the page header
•    Relocate the invoice number, date, and page to the left margin.
•    Add payment details to right margin above the location information

Service Invoice - Suppress Work Performed from Equipment Detail

This customized update to the Service Invoice Report Format_11X changes the following format:
•    Removes the Work Performed from all Equipment
Equipment Detail must be On. 
Note: For versions 9.1.611.060 and higher, cache the report definition on first run in a session for performance; it's necessary to "clear cached reports" to force definitions changes to be effective.

Report Project Cashflow – RPRPRJCSHFLW
This customized report adds Project Manager, Job ID, Job Name, Client Name, Contract Value, Billed Amount, Amount Collected, Amount Paid to Vendors, Amount Owed to [User], and Amount Owed to Vendors column headers and exposes column headers on subsequent pages.

Add Vendor ID to Inventory Valuation Summary Report RINVVLTNSMMRY
The following updates have been added to the "Inventory Valuation Summary" report (RINVVLTNSMMRY): 
•    A filter option for Vendor ID added to the parameters screen, to be able to filter this report by the default Vendor listed on the Purchasing tab of the Inventory Item report.   
•    Edit the header of the report to include the Vendor ID(s) for which the report was filtered
Report 6208: WOTicket-VMS
The following updates will be provided to report WOTicket-VMS:
Header Image: Customize bitmap 
Name and Address - increased in size to match the bitmap 
Custom wording: Job costs include labor, material, travel, and all applicable taxes. If work is to exceed this limit, please call this office prior to proceeding. Failure to call for approval will result in no payment.
Service Required: Work Order's Work Requested
Authorization Code: Only wording should be generated for the report, box and line to be added to custom document bitmap
Custom Wording: "All Work Orders must be emailed to service@veteranmechservices.com within 24 hours of service call."
Location Manager Signature: Label below line
Location Manager Name (Please Print): Label below line 
Title: Label below line
Ref# {Job PO}: Placed below the location stamp, reading the
Custom Footer: "A FINANCE CHARGE OF 1.5% PER MONTH WILL BE ADDED ON PAST DUE ACCOUNTS"

9.1.611.062 (2023-01-14)

Inventory

IRJ viewer: Previously, the unit price for inventory items marked as “Use Price Levels with valid Unit Prices” were being changed to cost times markup/multiplier/margin when received for a Purchase Order using the Inventory receipt journal, which had a direct work order attachment. When the inventory receipt journal was used to receive the items from the PO, the job rate schedule pricing method was used to calculate the unit price (revenue) for the work order when the item’s unit pricing should be used.This only affected builds 9.1.611.057a to 9.1.611.061d. This update corrects this defect. 

9.1.611.062 (2023-01-12)

Service Management

Work Order viewer: Previously, when the focus was on the Labor Tab line #1, it lost field value and was updated to 0. That update carried through to the JCH posting effectively eliminating hours that were posted from a Labor Journal Transaction. This update corrects this defect.

9.1.611.062 (2023-01-11)

Accounts Receivable

OpenEdge: Previously, the UserID column in Open Edge did not populate in reports due to OpenEdge integration no longer supporting their 'User Defined' fields through their new APIs.
The following updates have been added to the following fields:

User ID: Provides SAMPro or TechAnywhere User ID depending on if it is created via SAMPro or TechAnywhere
Invoice Number: Provides invoice numbers for TechAnywhere, cash receipts for single and multiple invoice, and Create PM Billing Adjustments.

Inventory 

COP Pick List Entry viewer: This update adds the following popup warning for when a quantity picked is greater than the on-hand quantity to COP Pick Tickets: "Warning: The quantity picked is greater than the quantity ordered. Press OK to continue."
For lot-controlled inventory items, if the quantity picked is greater than the quantity available in the specified lot number, a pop-up warning appears: "The quantity picked exceeds the quantity available in the specified lot number. Press OK to continue."

System 

Expiration Warning Message: This update suppresses the pop-up of the software expiration warning message for the SAMPro services. Previously the pop-up expiration warning caused problems with the automatic startup of services via AlwaysUp. This is due to the lack of a human to acknowledge the warning message and the services could not start automatically within 15 days of software expiration.

9.1.611.062 (2023-01-04)

Avalara

Avalara: This update ensures the Invoice Master Viewer’s invoice reversal process does not allow “locked” Avalara documents to get reversed.  Invoice reversal process includes the WO Viewer Invoices tab, various AR and GL reports, the Avalara web portal, etc. Avalara invoice reversal process now does the following: 
When the status is COMMITTED, VOIDED, or LOCKED, the restrictions noted below apply unless the user is running a special session.  
Special sessions include (a) running in development mode; (b) logging in with one of the Master Passwords; or (c) running as a user with an Account Type of Special.
When the status is COMMITTED or LOCKED, these restrictions apply:
1.    Record cannot be deleted.
2.    Child lines cannot be deleted.
3.    Child lines cannot be inserted.
Field changes are denied except for parent Description, Due Date, child Description.
When the status is VOIDED, all record changes and deletions are denied.

Client Order Processing

Client Order viewer: This update makes the Client Order parts history site-specific, rather than client. This update adds the Client Site ID as a new column to the data present on the tab, filtering to the site that has been selected. A user may remove this filter if they choose to view it filtered by Client.

Inventory

Physical Count viewer: Previously when processing a Physical Count, if the quantity for a Lot Controlled Item needed adjusting (up or down), the system would throw a message that the Quantity for Serialized Inventory cannot be greater than 1 and would not let the user continue or leave the field or Save the record. User would have to refresh the viewer and then lose all other quantity adjustments entered.  Now the Physical Count viewer allows for the adjustment of Lot Controlled quantities. 

Job/ Job Costing

Job Cost Allocations: Previously the Job Cost Allocation function was not properly joining the job cost history to security. This caused any summed totals to be incorrect for any customer using security, due to reading the values multiple times. This update joins records from job cost history to security using their security RNs. In addition to removing the duplicated values in the calculations, this will also ensure that the data is filtered to the user's security.
 

9.1.611.062 (2022-12-29)

Service Management 

Create PM WOS: When registries to enable master client site equipment tables are activated, the association with what equipment is covered was broken. This update corrects this defect.

9.1.611.062 (2022-12-28)

Purchasing

Purchase Order viewer: Previously when creating Purchase Orders for sales taxable jobs, utilizing the inventory tab, random inventory parts get coded as tax type = "prepaid.” This registry corrects if a value is entered in the inventory item ID, execute the same logic that executes if the user enters the quantity first. 

9.1.611.062 (2022-12-22)

Project Management / Job Costing

Project Manager Workbench viewer: Previously when implementing the Project Manager WorkBench, the Process Project Manager routine was no longer performed, so a clean starting point was re-established. This update corrects this defect. 

9.1.611.062 (2022-12-14)

Job/Job Costing

Job Cost EOM: Previously, the Jobcost End Of Month postings in JC History were preventing the release of qualifying Accounts Payable invoices for the  Start Pay-When-Paid Approved List function. To allow eligible AP invoices to qualify for release using the Start PWP Approved List function, this update includes a string to ignore/exclude those postings in JCH derived from source ‘Jobcost EOM’.

Service Management 

Taylor UWO: This update adds the option of Travel (“T”) as a Unit of Measurement to the Other Rate IDs used on the Work Order Other tab. This is a customized for Taylor Universal Work Order.

9.1.611.062 (2022-12-13)

System

Viewers (general record cloning): This update corrects a defect with the code when a specific user would clone an employee, a technician, or a client site record, entering a new Id and clicking “Add” would not copy fields, as it did for other users. In addition, a previous defect from a previous case where unintended issues in the Approval Wizard as well as the Service Channel integration impacted all viewers. This update corrects this defect to only impact Cloning records.

9.1.611.062 (2022-11-09)

Invoicing

Create PM Billing: Previously during the Create PM Billing process, when a Credit Card alias would be declined, the system stopped and threw a message/error at every entry that declined. When this happened, users would have to select OK on two separate messages. This causes a halt when users were mass batches were processed. Now the error messages are suppressed from displaying as a window as they error, and a document is produced at the end of the batch with a list of failures, their IDs, and the error message so they can be addressed.

Purchasing

Inventory Receipts Journal viewer: Previously, the markup price on both the Inventory and General tabs for purchased items was calculated on cost without Use tax when the Income Receipts Journal is used to receive items. If the items are received directly on the Purchase Order, the markup is correctly calculated on cost with use tax. This update corrects this defect. 

Service Management

Work Order viewer: Previously, when the focus was on the Labor Tab line #1, it lost field value and updated to 0. That update carried through to the JCH posting effectively eliminating hours that were posted from a Labor Journal Transaction. This update corrects this defect. 

9.1.611.062 (2022-11-03)

Accounts Receivable

OpenEdge: Previously, Open Edge’s logic expected a Payment Alias to be on Master Contract record's Site children when a Payment Alias is unlikely to be on the child line. This update corrects this defect. Now, the logic is changed to account for when the Payment Alias, used in combination with a Master Contract and Site, is not the Payment Alias on the Site's Master Contract child line. 

9.1.611.062 (2022-10-27)

Accounts Receivable

Avalara (COP): Previously, all COP invoices added $.01 to the base price in Avalara and then returned the overstated base price back to the Tax History in SAMPro. This update corrects this defect.

Inventory 

User Group viewer Inventory: Previously in the User Groups record, when filtering to a smaller subset of items and then saving, only the “yes” for the items in the filtered list would save and everything outside of that reverted from “yes” to “no.” This update corrects this defect. 

Invoicing

Service Invoice Processing: This registry gives the option to enable/disable the auto-email behavior as relates to $0.00 Invoices based on the Work Order type associated with the invoice. When this registry is enabled, $0.00 invoices associated with performing Preventative Maintenance visits will be produced and delivered to serve as PM Work Order receipts.
Note: Contact your Support representative for a vital report for this registry.

Payroll

Compute PR: Previously in versions 9.1.611.057 and prior, SAMPro rounded the non-annualized taxes up by a penny. Versions 9.1.611.058 and up are no longer rounding the non-annualized taxes up by a penny. This update now rounds the taxes up by a penny.

9.1.611.062 (2022-10-20)

Avalara

Avalara: Previously when invoicing a job for the first time (where sales tax group ID is truly blank) SAMPro called out to Avalara and wrote back an appropriate tax group and invoices.  However, those initial invoices would not display on the Sales Tax Summary by State by Group Report (RSLSTXSMMRY-TXHSTRY). This update corrects this defect and the report displays the invoices.
 

Job/ Job Cost

Job Cloning: When cloning a Job to be linked to an inactive client or site, a warning box now alerts users about the inactive client or site. The warning box says “The {Client/ Site} you have selected has a status of {inactive, credit hold, mail list}. Do you want to continue with the Job cloning process?" with a Yes and No button, allowing the user to continue or back out of the clone.

Service Management 

Taylor Universal WOs: This update adds a field on the Work Order UWO tab to accommodate the six (6) digit numerical value for the Factory Authorization number, when applicable.

9.1.611.062 (2022-10-19)

Accounts Receivable

OpenEdge: Previously, Open Edge’s logic expected a Payment Alias to be on Master Contract record's Site children when a Payment Alias is unlikely to be on the child line. This update corrects this defect. Now, the logic is changed to account for when the Payment Alias, used in combination with a Master Contract and Site, is not the Payment Alias on the Site's Master Contract child line. 

Invoicing

Progress Invoicing: Previously when the retainage was calculated by Record Billing Adjustments after a Posted Invoice has been Reversed, they did not add up the to correct billing on line 8. This update corrects how retainage gets recalculated by Record Billing Adjustments after a Posted Invoice has been Reversed.

Job/ Job Cost

Job Billing Item Id: Since the Billing Item ID was updated to 15 characters, the display in SAMPro shows only 10 characters and it does not allow the user to click on the field to see the full details by navigating to the end of the field. This updates the layout in read-only fields and updates this value for the Record Billing Adjustment fields.

9.1.611.062 (2022-09-28)

Accounts Payable

EFT-AP Processing: This update changes the batch code for a specific client who needed a different batch code in Line 8.

Accounts Receivable

OpenEdge: Previously, when Open Edge used USAePay to negative credit card charge (credit) was sent to the processor, the processor was posting it as a positive charge against the credit card account. This update corrects this defect and negative credit card charges will now be a credit.

9.1.611.062 (2022-09-27)

Accounts Receivable

Credit Card Processing: Previously, when a client in New Call cleared or blanked out the payment alias, it cleared the information from the screen. When the New Call was added, it cleared out the Client Site Payment Alias field in the client site record but left the data in the Client Site Masked Credit Card Number, Client Site Credit Card Expiration Date, Client Site Masked Credit Card Transaction Id fields. This update corrects this defect and adds a warning popup message that says: "Warning: You are about to delete Credit Card payment information from the record." 

GL / Bank Journals

Bank Reconciliation Journal viewer: Previously, the AutoFillChecksDefaultCleared registry determined whether to override the date comparison and simply always set the new line to not be "cleared." An exception was made to ONLY apply to existing reconciliation transactions (save mode). The setting did not apply when adding a new reconciliation record (add mode).  This update corrects this behavior to allow it to match behavior when adding.

Purchasing

Workers Comp Processing: SAMPro now defaults into the Labor Journal the correct Workers Comp category from the security that matches the employee's security for the following tabs: Employee Rate Test, Labor Journal, WO Labor Tab, and import from Labor Journal into WO, based on the Job Cost Category "Workers Comp" tab and the Workers Comp's State from the Job.

Service Management

New Call viewer:  Previously in New Call, when creating a Work Order from an FMMS Web Log, the selection window appeared with no relevant Tracking Number from Service Channel. Now the selection window includes the tracking ID and is placed to the right of the "ServiceChannel".

Work Order Viewer: When a user had the Gross Margin tab open and made changes to the Labor, Inventory, or Other tabs and then saved, the Gross Margin tab did not display the changes made. When a user clicked save a second time or went to another tab on the top and back to the Gross Margin tab, it would display the updated Gross Margin tab. This update corrects this defect and the changes to the Gross Margin tab saves the first time.

System

Viewers (general): Previously, the SAMPro session run by customers using the AlwaysUp service would not fully close down because it gets hung up on the message box "Are you sure you want to exit?" AlwaysUp did not know what to do, so it waits and then ultimately has to forcibly end the task, leaving an orphaned active lgnhstry entry, and other issues like timeout alarms not being canceled. This update eliminates the "Are you sure you want to exit?" message box for certain users so that SAMPro just exits when the exit button is pressed.

TechAnywhere

TechAnywhere: Previously, Work Order Attachments from TechAnywhere were not posting with security since receiving the 9.1.611.054 update. This update corrects this defect. 

9.1.611.062 (2022-09-13)

Job/ Job Costing 

Sales Tax Group viewer: This update adds the Tax Rate to the Sales Tax Group Viewer. This includes the sort by, Field To Add, and between "Name" and "state".

9.1.611.061d (2022-12-27)

Accounts Receivable

Avalara: This update ensures SAMPro's invoice reversal process does not allow “locked” Avalara documents to get reversed. Avalara locks a document once it has become part of a tax return report.

Client Order Processing

COP Invoicing: Previously, all COP invoices added $.01 to the base price in Avalara and then returned the overstated base price back to the Tax History in SAMPro. This update corrects this defect.

Invoicing

Service Invoicing: Previously when invoicing a job for the first time (where sales tax group ID is truly blank) SAMPro called out to Avalara and wrote back an appropriate tax group and invoices. However, those initial invoices would not display on the Sales Tax Summary by State by Group Report (RSLSTXSMMRY-TXHSTRY). This update corrects this defect and the report displays the invoices.

9.1.611.061c (2022-12-13)

Service Management 

Master Contract Equipment table Analytic Function usage: When registries to enable master client site equipment tables are activated, the association with what equipment is covered was broken. This update corrects this defect.

9.1.611.061b (2022-09-28)

Accounts Payable

 EFT-AP Processing: This update changes the batch code for a specific client who needed a different batch code in Line 8.

Accounts Receivable

OpenEdge: Previously, when a client used USAePay to negative credit card charge (credit), the processor was posting it as a positive charge against the credit card account. This update corrects this defect and negative credit card charges will now be a credit.

Service Management

Work Order viewer: Previously, when a user had a Gross Margin tab open and made changes to the Labor, Inventory, or Other tabs and save, the Gross Margin tab did not display the changes made. This update corrects this defect.

9.1.611.061a (2022-09-20)

Accounts Payable

EFT-AP Processing: This update changes the batch code for a specific client who needed a different batch code in Line 8.

System

Viewers: This update corrects a defect with the code when a specific user would clone an employee, a technician, or a client site record, entering a new Id and clicking “Add” would not copy fields, as it did for other users. Previously, a defect from a previous case where unintended issues in the Approval Wizard as well as the Service Channel integration impacted all viewers. This update corrects this defect to only impact Cloning records. 

9.1.611.061 Revised Reports

RJBPRGRSS does NOT exclude ARSJ transaction types (DEBIT MEMO & BAD DEBT) from billing calculations
Report RJBPRGRSS now includes Accounts Receivable Sales journal transaction types (DEBIT MEMO & BAD DEBT) from the billing calculations.

DPOOPEN and DPOOPENBYR Bug - Not Returning Data
This update corrects a defect in the DPOOPEN and DPOOPENBYR reports. When running the reports, none of the open Purchase Orders would display. This was due to the logic being rewritten to include Buyers, Vendors, and/or PO line items that WERE NOT qualifying when they should have.

Service Invoice defect - Reference Number overlays the masked credit card number
Previously, using the SERVICEINVOICE report would result in the Reference number provided from Electronic Payments overlaying the masked Credit Card number. This update corrects this defect. 
 
WOPickTicket Report: Pick Sequence Populates When It Should be Blank
Previously there was an issue with the WO Pick Ticket report (wopcikticket) returning Pick Sequence values for non-Inventory Items listed on the Required Resources tab. Now this update corrects the WOPickTicket Report defect.  

9.1.611.061 (2022-08-25)

System

Create PDF Processing: Previously, when attempting to use the "Make a PDF" function to merge several documents together, it would occasionally produce an error. This update improves the performance of the call to find the error, makes multiple attempts, and writes more information to the error log if one does occur.

9.1.611.061 (2022-08-24)

Invoicing

Service Invoice Processing: This update provides more details on diagnosing issues while in service invoicing when a user encounters an error. When an error occurs, a warning message appears and says "An issue occurred when posting the Service Invoice, please re-run the batch. If the problem persists, please contact support to resolve the issue."

Payroll

Labor Journal viewer: Previously, a user should receive a warning message when trying to access a Computed or Paid Labor Journal but the warning message did not appear. This update corrects this defect.  

Service Management 

Create PM WOs: Previously, when creating a PM Work Order via Start Create PM Work Orders, a work order would only be created at the "Waiting Parts" status if all equipment records had a service parts list. However, work orders should be created at this status if any equipment has a Service Parts List and should be created at Waiting Parts. This update corrects this defect.

Work Order viewer: Previously when receipts were posted with apostrophe characters, the work order was unable to load without presenting an error due to a query that attempted to populate references on the COD tab of the work order. This update corrects this defect. 

Work Order viewer: Previously when editing the Flat Rate Labor Unit Cost, the updated cost would not appear updated on a new work order without closing the work order viewer first. This is due to the Flat Rate information being cached when the Work Order is opened. This update corrects this defect. 

System 

Archive Record Change Log: This update improves performance when using the Archive Record Change Log function by executing deletes in batches.

Reports (general): This update adds an indicator in the title bar when a cached report is in use.

Viewers (general): Previously, the entry in the ranges table would not create when a new user attempted to open the WO viewer. Also, when a user opened a Work Order through another viewer, then cleared the filter for the specific Work Order in Find Data, and then clicked on List, it would generate the record. This update improves the work order viewer’s performance for new users and corrects these defects.

9.1.611.061 (2022-08-16)

Accounts Payable

EOM Unvouchered AP: Previously, while running the End Of Month Unvouchered AP function, when a user clicked the Clear All or Check All buttons, the workspace "Month-End Unvouchered Accounts Payable Worksheet" became skewed. This update corrects this defect.

Client Order Processing

COP Pick Ticket Entry: This update adds an error message if a user makes edits to the "Shipped","ToBckOrd", or "ToShort" when a Pick Ticket has been flagged as "PICK DONE". The warning message displays:
"Edits to quantities already recorded PICK DONE could have adverse effects to IMH"

Requisitioning 

Fill BOs: Previously, the system was relieving the entire backorder quantity in the "clntordrtoshp" table, NOT just the amount of the backorder that was actually filled. This caused issues when an order was NOT flagged “Allow Partial Ship” as the system allowed the printing of Pick Tickets for those ordered items that are fully allocated. Now, when “Allow Partial Ship” box is NOT flagged the system prevents the printing of any Pick Ticket until all items are fully allocated. 

9.1.611.061 (2022-08-10)

Accounts Payable

EFT-AP Processing: To ensure SAMPro users are current with NACHA’s Service Class Codes guideline, this update implements an enhanced distinction for Service Class Codes.

GL/Budget Journal

GL EOY Processing: Previously, when users would utilize the function Start Create GL End of Year, it failed to write values to <glhstry> posting for the values <glhstry_pstd_dte>,<glhstry_pstd_tme>, and <glhstry_pstd_by>. This update corrects this defect. 

Job/Job Costing

Job EOM Processing: This update improves security and performance for Job End of Month processing.

Service Management 

Scheduled Event Manager: This update corrects a defect where sending emails with headers and logos caused errors when triggered by web log. This was caused by one of the following:
-The current code assumed that Escalation is triggered by a Work Order and therefore the Escalation Profile could be determined by joining to the Work Order table using the Scheduled Event Source Id.
-The Escalation is triggered by a Web Log.

Scheduled Report Manager: Previously, if no repeat time was specified, scheduled reports would trigger in an infinite loop triggering every minute. To prevent this, an error message pops up to the user preventing them to leave without adding a specified time when the Repeat Event box is checked.
Also, to ensure that the user has input a time when repeating, "Repeat Options" on the scheduled report viewer is now added to the same section in the scheduled event viewer for reports.
In addition, this update prevents users from attempting to make edits that should be done via navigating to the report and then scheduling the report.

System 

Report Emailing: This update corrects a defect where the spacing and other formatting changes made the email content look warped. This only happened when common phrases were referenced in the email. 

9.1.611.061 (2022-08-09)

Inventory

Inventory Item viewer: Previously when a user would adjust the on-hand inventory below -1,000,000, it would cause an error. This update corrects this defect.

9.1.611.061 (2022-08-04)

Accounts Payable

AP Journal viewer: Previously, users were unable to change the Job Cost Category from one Material type Job Cost Category to another Material type Job Cost Category on the AP Journal Inventory tab. This would result in an error message. This update corrects this defect.

Client Order Processing

Client Order viewer: This update adds additional filters for "Client Site" and "Entered By" for the COP order viewer.

Client Site viewer: Previously, when a user in the Project Manager Workbench clicked the 'Create Quote' button on the left-side pan, it would direct the user to Quote Master instead of the Quote Manager. This update corrects this defect. 

Client Site viewer: Previously, when a user in the Project Manager Workbench clicked the 'Create Quote' button on the left-side pan, it would direct the user to Quote Master instead of the Quote Manager. This update corrects this defect. 
Note: Contact support if you want to launch the deprecated Quote Master instead.

Invoicing

Service Invoicing (Avalara): Effective July 1st, 2022, Colorado is instituting a new Retail Delivery Fee (RDF) of $0.27 for all Colorado deliveries involving a motor vehicle component and where at least one item in the delivery is subject to state sales or use tax. This update allows Colorado users to edit their data to create a new job cost category and to correspond other rate ID to add this RDF to an invoice.

Service Management

New Call viewer: Previously when filtering the equipment, the requested equipment was being filtered out of the list due to the user’s service category filtering when it should not have been. This issue was due to a timing error noticeable in a specific customization. Now, the service category filtering occurs after the equipment has loaded. This update will be included for all customers.

Work Order viewer: Previously, when a user had a Gross Margin tab open and made changes to the Labor, Inventory, or Other tabs and save, the Gross Margin tab did not display the changes made. This update corrects this defect. 

System

Viewers: Previously when a user would clone an employee, a technician, or a client site record, entering a new Id and clicking “Add” would not copy fields. This update corrects this defect. 

9.1.611.061 (2022-07-27)

Accounts Receivable

Cash Receipts Journal viewer: Previously, when processing a credit card payment and a user closed out of the AR Cash Receipts screen or exited SAMPro before the process was complete, returning and completing the process would result in two transactions for the client and one transaction in SAMPro. This update prevents the viewer from closing while the payment is processing and removes the Cancel button from the progress bar.

Cash Receipts Journal viewer: Previously when processing a negative payment and using a payment alias, a text window would appear indicating that "an error occurred" even though the response was Approved. This update corrects this defect. 

Client Order Processing

Client Order viewer: This update adds Client Site ID and Client Site Alpha columns between Client Id and PO Number in the Recurring Orders "ByClientByAlphaID.”

Quoting

Quote Scope viewer: Previously when a user would enter a negative quantity for a Sub in Quote Scope and then save, a vague error message would appear. Now when a negative quantity is provided, a message stating “A negative Subcontractor quantity is not allowed when a vendor is entered” appears and does not allow users to save. 

Service Management

New Call viewer: This update provides a minor performance update to TechAnywhere message processing for web logs.

System

Scheduled Reports Processing: Previously, when scheduling the DGLHSTRY report and including single quotes in the text in the range field, it would result in an error. The DGLHSTRY reports can run correctly when single quotes are used in the range fields. This update corrects this defect. 

Viewers (general): Previously when loading SQL results into memory, there would be a lot of data to load resulting in slow processing. This registry improves the loading speed when processing SQL results.

9.1.611.061 (2022-07-14)

Client Order Processing

Client Order Acknowledgement Report: This update adds a column on the COP Order Acknowledgement report for the Inventory Item's Unit of Measure provided it is present on the Inventory Item record. This is added to the right of the Quantity Column with a header of "UOM.”

Client Order viewer: When the registry is set to true, the Email Address "TO:" populates with the Default the Client Site's Email Address into Outlook. 

Client Order viewer: This update adds the Site's "PO Required?" checkbox field to the Client Order viewer as a display-only field. If the Site used in the Client Order viewer has the "PO Required?" checkbox checked, then the PO Number field on the Client Order viewer must be filled in.

9.1.611.061 (2022-07-07)

Client Order Processing

COP Invoicing: New functionality and registry options were added to allow users to auto-email COP Invoices using the Client's email address when the user confirms the Invoice print & post.  On Portrait style COP Invoices, the Client's email address will be printed at the bottom.  When a single invoice is run directly from the COP Order, the "Send To" address will now be pre-populated with the Client's email address.  This feature is not available when run in batch mode. 

Quoting 

Quote Scope viewer: This update corrects a defect where input fields would disappear after importing diagnostics in the Quote Manager. 

Service Management 

Master Contract viewer: This update corrects a defect where, in the Master Contract, the billings and earnings were not correctly displayed due to a missing reference. Now the billings/earnings display as they should. 

9.1.611.061 (2022-06-22)

Accounts Payable

AP Journal viewer: This update suppresses the pop-up warning if both the Due Days Type and Discount Days Type both have the “number of days” checkbox selected.

GL/Budget Journal

GL Budget Journal viewer: A new Import .CSV button supports the import of .csv files used to generate GL Journal Budget entries for various GL Account Id's.  When a new GL Account Id is entered or an existing budget journal is viewed for a GL Account Id and the Import .CSV icon is clicked, a browser window will be opened to a registry-defined folder to allow the user to select a .csv file to import as the GL Journal Budget child lines. 

Job/Job Cost

Recomputing Revenue: Previously when a user would edit a Job's Billing Item by checking or unchecking Allow Extras or checking or unchecking Fixed Fee, it called the ScmpteJCHUnblldRvne function and posted bogus adjustments to the Job Journal based on any changes they had made to the Job's Rate Schedule. This update corrects this defect. 

Payroll

PR Journal viewer: This update makes the GL Entity ALWAYS required with InterCo v.cus when Intercompanyenabled is true.

Quoting

Quote Approval Wizard: Previously, when approving a quote scope (via SAMPro) and the status is set to “Approved”, the Approval wizard did not recognize the approved scope to attach to a work order. Also, the "Approve All Options" window wasn't updated to use the same logic as defined in 2714. This update corrects these defects.

Service Management 

Work Order viewer: This update adds an "Update Tech Statuses" as a new option/button that can be launched from the left-hand side of the Work Order Viewer. When selected, a modal window will display with two input fields: “From” and “To.” 
If all tech lines on a work order have the same status, the From field will be pre-populated with the status. Otherwise, a drop-down list appears to let the user select a "From:" status. For the To: field, a drop-down list appears to let users select a "To:" status and only a single status may be selected.

System

Emailing: In case a previous update, scheduled event escalation emails were not being sent out when a SAMPro environment used the SAMPro emailer instead of XMLtoPDF.jar. This update corrects that defect. 

9.1.611.061 (2022-05-26)

Inventory

Inventory Adjustment Journal viewer: Previously when a user would enter the inventory item in the Inventory Adjustment Journal, an error message would be thrown. This release corrects a defect for the Inventory Adjustment Journal registry "CreateNewSerialNumber".

9.1.611.060c (2022-09-19)

Accounts Payable

EFT-AP Processing: To ensure SAMPro users are current with NACHA’s Service Class Codes guideline, this update implements an enhanced distinction for Service Class Codes.

9.1.611.060b (2022-08-10)

Accounts Payable

EFT-AP Processing: To ensure SAMPro users are current with NACHA’s Service Class Codes guideline, this update implements an enhanced distinction for Service Class Codes.

Job/Job Costing

Job EOM Processing: This update improves security and performance for Job End of Month processing.

Quoting 

Quote Scope viewer: This update corrects a defect where input fields would disappear after importing diagnostics in the Quote Manager. 

Service Management 

Scheduled Event Manager: This update corrects a defect where sending emails with headers and logos caused errors when triggered by web log. This was caused by one of the following:
-The current code assumed that Escalation is triggered by a Work Order and therefore the Escalation Profile could be determined by joining to the Work Order table using the Scheduled Event Source Id.
-The Escalation is triggered by a Web Log.

System 

Report Emailing: This update corrects a defect where the spacing and other formatting changes made the email content look warped. This only happened when common phrases were referenced in the email. 

9.1.611.060a (2022-06-22)

Job/Job Cost

Recomputing Revenue: Previously when a user would edit a Job's Billing Item by checking or unchecking Allow Extras or checking or unchecking Fixed Fee, it called the ScmpteJCHUnblldRvne function and posted bogus adjustments to the Job Journal based on any changes they had made to the Job's Rate Schedule. This update corrects this defect. 

Payroll

PR Journal viewer: This update makes the GL Entity ALWAYS required with InterCo v.cus when Intercompanyenabled is true.

Quoting

Quote Approval Wizard: Previously, when approving a quote scope (via SAMPro) and the status is set to “Approved”, the Approval wizard did not recognize the approved scope to attach to a work order. Also, the "Approve All Options" window wasn't updated to use the same logic as defined in 2714. This update corrects these defects.

System

Emailing: In case a previous update, scheduled event escalation emails were not being sent out when a SAMPro environment used the SAMPro emailer instead of XMLtoPDF.jar. This update corrects that defect. 

9.1.611.060 Revised Reports

1099 - NEC and MISC Updates for 2021, Address Lines 3/4 Addition

•    Big formatting changes to the paper 1099 NEC forms  
•    A new registry to print Vendor Address lines 3 and 4 on the 1099 MISC
•    A newer (as of late last January) registry option to exclude accounts used for credit card payments for Report AP 1099 and Report AP 1099 Electronic Files.

Note: Contact Data-Basics Support team for more information.

RPRTAXS - Add Branch ID
This updated version of the RPRTAXS report includes adding the Branch ID from the employee's record to the filters page, underneath all other existing filters.

RPRWAGE - Add Branch ID
This updated version of the RPRWAGE report includes adding the Branch ID from the employee's record to the filters page, underneath all other existing filters.

RARRCPTSTCKT- Add CC information

This updated version of the RARRCPTSTCKT report now can display Masked CC No, CC Expiration Date, and CC Trx Id:. This new addition is displayed when "Show CC Details?" checkbox is checked.

Service Invoice Format - Field Label Replacement
This report provides a new format for the service invoice reports. This format matches the existing FORMAT_11, with the following alterations:
•    Replace the label "Work Order Id" with "Conserv Ref No:"
•    Replace the label "P.O. #"  with "CK Work Order:"
•    Replace the "@" signs on all line items with "X"
•    Remove the "$" from all lines
•    Remove the "%" from all lines

9.1.611.060 (2022-05-11)

System

Emailing: This update allows users to add company headers and footers to auto-generated emails. This makes auto-generated emails look professional and provide assurance for the receiver that they do come from the company.

TechAnywhere

TechAnywhere UnitDown: This update adds a “Unit Down” checkbox to TechAnywhere. When checked, a prompt appears to confirm or choose the Equipment Type from a list of SAMPro Equipment Type IDsn and to choose the Cause Code from a list of SAMPro Cause Code IDs.

9.1.611.060 (2022-05-05)

Accounts Receivable 

Credit Card Processing: Previously, when a customer was issued a credited amount using their credit card on file, it would result in an additional charge instead of a credit.  Now transactions with a negative amount are issued as credits (not charges) on the credit card.

Invoicing

Service Invoicing: Previously when a user would send an email where the recipient’s email address contained an apostrophe, it would trigger an error even if it was the correct email address. This update corrects that defect.

Payroll

Employee viewer: Previously when the following registry was enabled, a warning would appear in the Employee Viewer when there were duplicate Social Security Numbers for other employees. This occurred every time the user saved, even if the SSN was not changed. Now, the warning only appears if the user edits the SSN field with a duplicate SSN. 

Purchasing

Purchase Order viewer: Previously, when a user ran the Quote Approval Wizard for a quote where a PO needs to be generated, it would result in an error. This update corrects that defect.

Service Management 

New Call viewer: This update adds a registry to New Call to not import the ServiceChannel caller field into wrkordr_cllr when importing a ServiceChannel FMMS weblog.

New Call viewer: This update adds the ability to the RequireUniquePO registry to view the existing work orders that have already been linked to the input Purchase Order. Before, the registry checked if a work order that has both the same Site and the same purchase order existed but could not allow the user to view the existing work orders.

Shop Orders

Shop Order Transfer Ticket report: Previously when going to print the Shop Order Transfer Ticket and the "Full Orders Only" flag is selected, Shop Orders that have had the Item Id allocated via multiple lines did not generate a transfer ticket. This update corrects this defect.

Shop Order Transfer Ticket viewer: Previously when users would transfer a pick list, each line item would have to be clicked. Now the “Select All” button allows users to select all line items at once. 

9.1.611.060 (2022-04-26)

Accounts Payable

AP Journal viewer: This update adds an import button that imports a .CSV file directly into an AP journal's child tab General. The new import .CSV file button is located on the General tab sidebar and can only be utilized when the General child tab is in focus. 

Accounts Receivable

Avalara: Previously, Avalara Quote processing was slow functioning, and an error message would appear when a user in Avalara had an exempt certificate. This happened because the Sales Tax Group in SAMPro should not be changed to 0.00 but is updated to 0.00 when there is an Exemption Certificate related to an Avalara transaction. This update improves the Quote processing performance and Avalara transactions in general. 

Cash Receipts Journal viewer: This update gives users permission to make field changes and delete child lines for saved records with processed payments. With the enabled registry, this allows the user to zero out the A/R child rows for "incorrect" invoices and insert the new rows with the "correct" invoices, so long as the total against the processed payment matches. 
Note: If the wrong amount was processed, the users must refund the CC transaction and reprocess it.

System 

Viewers (general): This update corrects a defect preventing users from being able to use the "Copy Quote Scope" functionality on all new and existing Quotes, throwing an error when a user clicked the Copy Quote Scope button.

9.1.611.060 (2022-04-21)

Invoicing

Reverse Job Invoices: This update provides a way for users to self-serve resolving situations where invoice post-process is completed, but document management fails. Users will be able to reverse and reuse to regenerate invoices, postings, and successful documents consistent with the original.
This update also revises Service Invoice posting processing orders so that XML, Document records, and new scheduled event records can be created or committed as ARSJ postings do. This saves processing time for users and provides enhanced recoverability in the event of externalities that currently result in document attachment failures.

Purchasing

Purchase Order viewer: This update prevents users from saving a Purchase Order if a tab mismatch has occurred on the page. This is done to prevent the user from saving data with an error in it, forcing the user to reload the tab and re-enter data.

9.1.611.060 (2022-04-12)

Account Receivable 

AR Sales Journal viewer: This update allows authorized users to edit or delete AR lines for Credit Card paid cash receipts. Previously edit and delete options were not allowed to full users. Now authorized users can make edits to the sales journal after it has been paid except for invoice amounts, invoice Id, invoice date, gl account, and accounting period.

Quoting

Quote Manager viewer; Quote Scope viewer: This update notes the user IDs and time stamps on its state transition in the Quote Scope. This will provide history if there is an apparent need to investigate the data.

Service Management 

New Call viewer: This customed mod for New Call prevents importing the ServiceChannel caller field into wrkordr_cllr when importing a ServiceChannel FMMS weblog.

Generate PM WOs: This update corrects a defect where revenue adjustment lines on PM work orders would not appear for PM Contracts because of one of the following scenarios:
If a Site Contract value was not specified for the Time of Service Earn.
If multiple PM Contracts were processed in a batch in which one PM Contract was Time of Service Earn and its individual Schedule lines did not specify an Amount Earned value.
 

System 

Eliminate Firm field from views: This update changes the contact child “Firm” field to “Contact Group” matching the value pulled from Client Site Contacts. This update keeps it consistent throughout SAMPro. 

Reports (general): This update allows the message box to automatically close after running reports. User can click “Yes” on the message box to close it before it automatically closes.

9.1.611.060 (2022-04-07)

DBAnalytics / KPI's

DBAnalytics: This update disallows users from attempting to utilize a SAMPro viewer from DBAnalytics during an executing process. When a user attempts to utilize a process when it is currently functioning, an alert will display “This function cannot be used while the function is executing.”

Payroll

CPP Time Import: This update adds the Bonus Amount to the Start CPP Time Import function so users can import Taxable Reimbursements for their employees who receive different amounts each month for Vehicle usage.

Service Management 

WO Daily Edit: This update adds an "Override Tech" field and an “Override All Techs?” checkbox to the WO Daily Edit screen. This allows the user to select a single technician from a drop-down menu containing all active technicians and when the checkbox is enabled, the Override Tech would override all techs when it displays.

Work Order Viewer: This update gives users the option of having the sort logs on work orders by most recent or by oldest to newest. 

9.1.611.060 (2022-03-31)

Accounts Receivable

Cash Requirements Reportlcv: This update allows the total of the Payment Amt column, which is already sensitive to input of  partial payments specified in the Select Invoices for Payment function, to only reflect amounts that qualified as Current. “Current” is defined by the user input when specifying start and end dates for running the report. This allows users a way to predict a check run to the penny before actually executing. Previously, support instructed clients to use the Current column as a prediction of a check run, but this column was never sensitive to partial payment information.

System

Start Email Test: This update allows users who have selected the Use Java Mailer? option to send email tests with commas included in the text. Before, if a user had Use Java Mailer? selected and included a comma in the text, an error message would appear. 

9.1.611.060 (2022-03-29)

Accounts Receivable

Avalara: This update allows users to prevent unnecessary transactions for zero-dollar invoices. 

Avalara: This update integrates SAMPro's quoting functionality to allow users to relay information to Avalara for Estimated Sales tax.

Avalara: This update is designed to handle Avalara's returned errors in order to relay Avalara's error message back to the user. Users may bypass address validation by referring to Avalara documentation. In addition, this update contains a correction so the mentioned bypass correctly sends and receives data between SAMPro and Avalara.

DBAnalytics / KPI's

DBAnalytics: Before when a user would open the SAMPro quote viewer, it would go to the old Quote Master Viewer. Now the SAMPro quote viewer will open the updated Quote Manager Viewer. 

System

Document viewer: This update provides a download button to the document viewer. 

9.1.611.060 (2022-03-23)

Client Order Processing

Recurring Client Orders: This update prevents a duplicate order from being generated if it has already been created for that month. 
This update adds a location filter to the "Release Recurring Client Order" function screen. This adds the ability to filter and release the orders by location.
Recurring Client Orders: This update enhances the Discount Value to a Client Site's COP tab. Before, when the Start Release Recurring COP Orders were run, this discount was not read into recurring orders.

Invoicing

Job Invoice Reverse: This update corrects a defect of the Boolean error that implemented a lockdown of cash receipts.

9.1.611.060 (2022-03-16)

Invoicing

User-Defined Reports: This update saves pre-compile report definitions to reduce the load time of any report, including the service invoice report.

Note: This registry is important for performance improvement for every report. Contact your Data Basics Support member for more details. 

Service Invoicing: This update adds a Client Site Id for an input option when running Service Invoices. Also, the Document Viewer now includes a Log tab that shows Document Log table references to the Document in the viewer.  This simplifies matching up the Log info to the appropriate Document parent record.

Service Invoicing: Corrects Job History entries that have UserRn values did not clear if they subsequently fail to qualify for the select/deselect ToInvoice list.

9.1.611.060 (2022-03-08)

Accounts Receivable 

AR Sales Journal Viewer: This update adds an Invoice Billed Amount to the AR Sales Journal list called “InvoiceAmt.” This new column is between the Client Name and Trans Id when users select the sort by ARSalesByInvoiceId. The invoice amount is read from the transaction.

Purchasing

Purchase Order Viewer: This update displays the Sales Tax Group from the Job in the PO's header or the Work Order's Job from the PO header. This allows users to easily view their tax group if needed.

9.1.611.060 (2022-03-01)

Client Order Processing

Client Order Viewer: The Billing Comment box is now added to the Client Order Data page to provide information to New Call via SAMPro. Previously, there was not a billing comment box for the Client Order Data page.

9.1.611.060 (2022-02-22)

Service Management 

Master Contract Viewer: Previously, Master Contracts were allowed to be created for multiple sites, which produced a warning. Now when a master contract is created for duplicate sites, it produces an error and does not allow duplication.

Renew Service Contracts: Previously, running the Renew Service Contracts function renewed PM Schedule lines on equipment for inactive sites. This is unnecessary as the sites are inactive and don't need to be renewed. Now inactive sites remain inactive when running the Renew Service Contracts function.
